analyzed: bstod dang rab bstod bsngags pa dang // dmigs dang de yi rnam pa yi //

analyzed: de nyid don dam dgongs pa dang // 'thob dang mtha' gnyis spangs pa dang // bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang 'chad //

original: rang gi ngo bo'i thogs med blo //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i thogs med blo //

original: dam chos yun ring gnas ched du //
analyzed: dam chos yun ring gnas ched du //

original: lha rnams kyis ni rjes su bsgrubs //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis ni rjes su bsgrubs //

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin brlabs 'di //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin brlabs 'di //

original: rnam bshad mtshan nyid mdo don gyis //
analyzed: rnam bshad mtshan nyid mdo don gyis //

original: bdun brgya pa yi don bsdus yin //
analyzed: bdun brgya pa yi don bsdus yin //

analyzed: de la tshig dang po gsum ni gleng bslang ba'o //

analyzed: gleng bslangs nas skabs 'byed par rtsom pa ni dus gcig na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas / kun dga' rab na zhes bya ba'i @7a * //

original: bar yin no //
analyzed: bar yin no //

original: bshad par gtogs pa'i 'khor gyi dbang du byas nas dge slong stong tham pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bshad par gtogs pa'i 'khor gyi dbang du byas nas dge slong stong tham pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From the perspective of the retinue included in the explanation, with a thousand monks... and so forth,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa ya dang thabs cig go zhes bya ba'i bar des ni 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa ya dang thabs cig go zhes bya ba'i bar des ni 'khor bstan to //

original: de phan chad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gal ba der mchis nas /
analyzed: de phan chad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang gal ba der mchis nas /

original: phyogs gcig tu mchis so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu mchis so //
translated: they sat to one side.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gleng gzhi'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gleng gzhi'o //

analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang / phyag bgyi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The cause is stated in the passage beginning with “to see the Tathagata, to bow down to him,” and so on.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni sems can gyi don to //🔽mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i sa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni sems can gyi don to // mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i sa nas brtsams te /
translated: The result is the benefit of sentient beings.🔽The path of vision is stated in the passage beginning with “the bodhisattva should see the Tathagata in the aspect of thusness and in the aspect of non-conceptuality, by way of non-apprehension,” and so on,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dmigs pa can rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir phyag rgya 'di gzhag go zhes bya ba'i bar ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa dmigs pa can rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir phyag rgya 'di gzhag go zhes bya ba'i bar ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: up to “this seal is set down for the bodhisattvas who have conceptual thoughts, in order that they may understand reality just as it is.”

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher ston par spobs lags so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher ston par spobs lags so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The path of cultivation is stated in the passage beginning with “Lord, I have confidence to expound extensively the perfection of wisdom,” and so on,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jig tshogs de ni ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jig tshogs de ni ma mchis pa ste /
translated: up to “Lord, that perishable collection is non-existent.

original: 'jig tshogs ma lags pas de ni mi 'pho la 'pho ba dang bral ba yang ma lags te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs ma lags pas de ni mi 'pho la 'pho ba dang bral ba yang ma lags te /
translated: It is not a perishable collection, and so it is not transferred, nor is it free from transfer.

original: de ci'i slang du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slang du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig tshogs de ni 'jig tshogs ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs de ni 'jig tshogs ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: Up to “That perishable collection is not a perishable collection” is the path of cultivation.

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes la bsgom pa'i lam yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi rjes la bsgom pa'i lam yin la /
translated: Thus, after the path of seeing, there is the path of cultivation.

original: mthong ba'i lam de'i rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de'i rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that path of seeing?

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i mos pa rnam gsum yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i mos pa rnam gsum yin par bstan te /
translated: The three kinds of interest that are its cause are taught.

original: de la de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There, after that, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said this to the Lord:

original: byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar sh'a ri'i bus smras pa rnams ni rang gi don du mos pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba'i bar sh'a ri'i bus smras pa rnams ni rang gi don du mos pa'o ;
translated: Up to “One will certainly attain enlightenment” are the words of Śāriputra.

original: / de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / de nas bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said this to the Lord:

original: byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so zhes bya ba'i bar byams pa'i tshig rnams ni rang dang gzhan gyi don du mos pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so zhes bya ba'i bar byams pa'i tshig rnams ni rang dang gzhan gyi don du mos pa'o //
translated: The words of Maitreya from “The bodhisattvas who have entered the stages” up to “have come close to enlightenment” are the interest in benefit for oneself and others.

original: de nas bcom @7b ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom @7b ldan 'das la 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta said to the Bhagavān:

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'jam dpal gyi tshig ni gzhan gyi don du mos pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'jam dpal gyi tshig ni gzhan gyi don du mos pa'o //
translated: The words of Mañjuśrī from “They should be seen as the state of buddhahood” are the interest in the benefit of others.🔽Then the sister Nirālambā said to the Bhagavān:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la sring mo dmigs pa med pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa sring mo dmigs pa med pa'i tshig ni thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa rnams kyi dmigs
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la sring mo dmigs pa med pas 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa sring mo dmigs pa med pa'i tshig ni thar pa dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i mtshan nyid mos pas spyod pa'i sas bsdus pa rnams kyi dmigs
translated: The words of the sister Nirālambā from “Bhagavān” up to “I have no doubt” are the interest in the stage of the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa ni ji snyed yod pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi dmigs pa ni ji snyed yod pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The object of the path of seeing and the path of cultivation is the existence of all things and the existence of things as they are, together with the reasoning that establishes them.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Śāradvatīputra:🔽“It is so, Śāradvatīputra, it is so!

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: From the beginning, up to:

original: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni mos pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i bar du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar ni mos pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: they will have the knowledge of a completely perfect Buddha, endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: de la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bstod pa dang rab tu bstod pa dang bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bstod pa dang rab tu bstod pa dang bsngags pa'o //
translated: And there, the Lord praised, praised greatly, and extolled them.

original: dmigs pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The brief teaching on the object.

original: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The extensive teaching is from “Mañjuśrī, what did you see as the controlling power of the meaning?” up to:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni /
translated: Because all dharmas🔽are not conjoined and not disjoined,🔽have no obstruction,🔽and are without thought and without discrimination.

original: gang la gnas te rnam par rig par 'gyur ba'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: gang la gnas te rnam par rig par 'gyur ba'i skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar yin no //
translated: because there is no arising of that which would be cognized, abiding in what?

original: gang dag mtshams med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gang dag mtshams med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution, etc.

original: kun dga' po 'jig rten du sa g-yos pa byung ba 'di'i rgyu ni de yin no //
analyzed: kun dga' po 'jig rten du sa g-yos pa byung ba 'di'i rgyu ni de yin no //
translated: Ānanda, this is the cause of the earthquake in the world, this is the reason.

original: rkyen ni de yin no zhes bya ba la thug pa ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa gtan la 'bebs pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen ni de yin no zhes bya ba la thug pa ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa gtan la 'bebs pa ste /
translated: This is the way to determine the aspects of the object.

original: tshul rnam pa drug bstan to //🔽bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal lo zhes bya ba nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni sgra ma lags so ;
analyzed: tshul rnam pa drug bstan to // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal lo zhes bya ba nas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni sgra ma lags so ;
translated: The six modes are taught.🔽Blessed One, this Mañjuśrī is the inconceivable glory, etc.

original: / sgra ma lags pa yang bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar ni de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: / sgra ma lags pa yang bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar ni de'i 'bras bu thob pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: Inconceivability is not sound, and what is not sound cannot be taught. This teaches the characteristic of attaining its result.

original: 'jam dpal khyod bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug gam zhes bya ba nas /🔽'di ltar 'jam dpal khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba @8a * //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug gam zhes bya ba nas / 'di ltar 'jam dpal khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba @8a * //
translated: Mañjuśrī, do you enter the meditative absorption of the inconceivable?

original: byas pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa ste /
translated: Mañjuśrī, you have served the victorious ones of the past,🔽and you have practiced pure conduct for a long time without apprehending anything.

original: mi dmigs par tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa'o zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar ni rjes su myong ba bstan pa smras pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs par tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa'o zhes bya ba la thug pa'i bar ni rjes su myong ba bstan pa smras pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on the experience.

original: ci 'jam dpal khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: ci 'jam dpal khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, do you think, I abide in the perfection of wisdom

original: de skad smra'o snyam du sems sam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de skad smra'o snyam du sems sam zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: and speak like this?

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyings dang / bdag gi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su ma mchis te /
translated: Thus, the realm of the Tathāgata and my realm are non-dual,🔽and there is no division into two.

original: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching on its essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa de yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang bdag bsgom pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa'o zhes bka' stsal pa de yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One has said, “Whoever meditates on the self meditates on the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang ma bgyis pa ma bsgrubs pa ma bskyed pa ma 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du ye shes 'di yang ma bgyis pa ma bsgrubs pa ma bskyed pa ma 'gags pa ste /
translated: This knowledge, Blessed One, is also unmade, unaccomplished, unproduced, and unceasing.🔽Therefore, Blessed One, it is not to be altered.”

original: de'i slad du mi bsgyur ba lags so zhes bya ba la thug pas ni ye shes thogs pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi bsgyur ba lags so zhes bya ba la thug pas ni ye shes thogs pa med par bstan to //
translated: This passage teaches that knowledge is unobstructed.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can gyi gang zag ston te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can gyi gang zag ston te /
translated: Then, the person who is a bodhisattva’s family is taught.

original: de yang rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / spyod pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de yang rigs la gnas pa dang / zhugs pa dang / spyod pa la zhugs pa dang / spyod pa'i yon tan no //
translated: That is to say, it is taught by means of the one who is situated in the family, the one who has entered, the one who has entered into the practice, and the qualities of the practice.

original: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa 'di la 'di ltar bstan par su dag mos zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bstan pa 'di la 'di ltar bstan par su dag mos zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, those who believe in this teaching of the Tathāgata’s knowledge, as it has been taught, up to…”

original: 'jam dpal legs so legs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal legs so legs so //

analyzed: de ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas /

analyzed: de bas na shes par 'dod pa'i phyir don 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ces bya bas sgrub par byed de /

analyzed: gang bdag gis thos pa de ni 'di skad yin gyi gzhan du ma yin te /

analyzed: cig char skyabs su 'os pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro // rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pas ni gnas de mchod rten du gyur pa dang mes 'jig pa la sogs pas mi shigs par yang bstan te /

original: sa phyogs de ni skyon thams cad las grol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa phyogs de ni skyon thams cad las grol ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he is worthy of being the refuge of both the retinue that is engaged in its own aim and that which is engaged in the aim of others

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam bzhi po gang yang rung bas bzhugs pa'i sa phyogs de ni me la sogs pa'i 'jig pa rnams kyis shigs par mi 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam bzhi po gang yang rung bas bzhugs pa'i sa phyogs de ni me la sogs pa'i 'jig pa rnams kyis shigs par mi 'gyur ro//
translated: The place where the Tathāgata stands, sits, or lies down in any of the four postures is not destroyed by fire, water, or wind.

original: zhes byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las bcom ldan 'das kyis dngos su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed One has taught this explicitly in the Bodhisattva Canon.

original: de ltar byas na zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar byas na zla ba sgron ma'i mdo las /
translated: If we do this, then the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says,

original: rgyal po'i khab kyi shar phyogs 'di nyid du //
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab kyi shar phyogs 'di nyid du //
translated: In this very place, to the east of Rājagṛha,🔽I have seen ten thousand million buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bye ba stong phrag mthong ba dang // rgyal ba de dag kun gyi drung du ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba stong phrag mthong ba dang // rgyal ba de dag kun gyi drung du ni //
translated: And in the presence of all those victors

original: ting 'dzin zhi ba mchog 'di zhu ba bgyis //
analyzed: ting 'dzin zhi ba mchog 'di zhu ba bgyis //
translated: I have requested this supreme, peaceful samādhi.

original: zhes bya ba dang / blo gros shin tu brtan pas zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / blo gros shin tu brtan pas zhus pa las kyang /
translated: And the Sūtra Requested by Suvikrāntavikrāmin says,

original: byams pa chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag bdun cu rtsa bzhis sa phyogs 'di nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: byams pa chos kyi rnam grangs 'di ni sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig stong phrag bdun cu rtsa bzhis sa phyogs 'di nyid du gsungs so //
translated: Maitreya, this Dharma discourse has been taught in this very place by 7,400,000,000 buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba dag dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is consistent with the statement, “He is endowed with a special mode of conduct.

original: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni spyod pa khyad par can dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhugs so zhes bya ba ni spyod pa khyad par can dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ” “He was dwelling” means that he was endowed with a special mode of conduct.

original: bzhugs pa'i tshig gis ni lha dang 'phags pa tshangs pa'i gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i tshig gis ni lha dang 'phags pa tshangs pa'i gnas pa bstan te /
translated: The word “dwelling” indicates that he was abiding in the divine and noble abodes.

original: rgyal byed kyi tshal la sogs pa na sems can gyi don mchog tu mdzad cing bcom ldan 'das de ljongs rgyu ba bzhin du bzhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyal byed kyi tshal la sogs pa na sems can gyi don mchog tu mdzad cing bcom ldan 'das de ljongs rgyu ba bzhin du bzhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: He was dwelling in the Jeta Grove and so forth, performing the highest benefit for sentient beings, like the Blessed One who was traveling.

original: dus bzla ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dus bzla ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he was not dwelling in the sense of having the characteristics of a good time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dus gcig na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dus gcig na zhes gsungs te /
translated: That is why it says, “at one time.

original: gzhan na ni yul gzhan dag na bzhugs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan na ni yul gzhan dag na bzhugs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” Otherwise, it would be taught that he was dwelling in other places.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su slob pa gdul bya rnams kyis kyang gnas pa mchog gsum gyis gnas par bya ba yin gyi 'jim gong bzhin du 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes su slob pa gdul bya rnams kyis kyang gnas pa mchog gsum gyis gnas par bya ba yin gyi 'jim gong bzhin du 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that disciples who are training themselves in the way of the Lord should abide in the three supreme methods, and should not remain like a lump of clay.

original: gzhan dag na re dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Others say that the phrase “at one time” is connected with the previous passage.

original: bdag rang la skad cig ma gcig la snang ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: bdag rang la skad cig ma gcig la snang ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: They say that the Buddha’s self-appearance occurs in a single moment.

original: de ni gcig tu nges @10b par dgongs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gcig tu nges @10b par dgongs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the Buddha’s definite intention.

original: de'i bdag rang la snang ba ni 'khor rnams 'dri bar mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de'i bdag rang la snang ba ni 'khor rnams 'dri bar mi 'dod kyi /
translated: The Buddha’s self-appearance is not something that the retinue wishes to ask about.

original: dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa 'dri bar bsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal gyi mgur nas gsungs pa 'dri bar bsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha’s intention is to speak about the teaching of the glorious tantra.

original: gang yang rang tshang mar grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang rang tshang mar grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Some say that the Buddha’s self-appearance is established in the same way that the Buddha’s appearance for others is established.

original: yul dang dus ni gtan tshigs /
analyzed: yul dang dus ni gtan tshigs /
translated: The place and time are the reason.

original: 'khor ni dbang po yin te ;
analyzed: 'khor ni dbang po yin te ;
translated: The retinue is the sense organ.

original: rtsod pa'i dbang rgya dang tshul 'dra'o zhes smra na /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i dbang rgya dang tshul 'dra'o zhes smra na /
translated: This is like the seal of a legal document.

original: de ni bdag gis rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bdag gis rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not my understanding.

original: 'di ltar yul thog thag tu song zhing dbang la dri bar bya ba ni der 'gro mi nus pa rnams kyis mdo sde'i don gtan la dbab pa ring du thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul thog thag tu song zhing dbang la dri bar bya ba ni der 'gro mi nus pa rnams kyis mdo sde'i don gtan la dbab pa ring du thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the sutra would be delayed for those who are unable to go there and who must rely on a teacher to determine the meaning of the sutra.

original: gang du 'khor gyi ming ma bstan pa der yang su la dri bar bya /
analyzed: gang du 'khor gyi ming ma bstan pa der yang su la dri bar bya /
translated: And in those places where the name of the retinue is not mentioned, to whom should one go for instruction?

original: da ni bstan pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i 'khor gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas de ni /
analyzed: da ni bstan pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i 'khor gang yin pa'i dbang du byas nas de ni /
translated: Now, with regard to the retinue included in the teaching, it is said:

original: dge slong stong tham pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge slong stong tham pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Together with a great community of one thousand monks.

original: 'dir yang dge slong gi 'khor sngar bstan pa ni chung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang dge slong gi 'khor sngar bstan pa ni chung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the retinue of monks is mentioned first because it is inferior.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phyis bstan pa ni che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phyis bstan pa ni che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The retinue of bodhisattvas is mentioned later because it is superior.

original: dper na 'gro ba kun dang slob pa dang mi slob pa dang rang rgyal rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba kun dang slob pa dang mi slob pa dang rang rgyal rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is said: All beings, those in training, those beyond training, and the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gzhan dag na re 'khor rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dge slong gi 'khor sngar smos so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'khor rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dge slong gi 'khor sngar smos so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The assembly of monks is mentioned first because the retinue is permanent.

original: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong ngo //
translated: They are monks because they have destroyed the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa tsam zad par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'i nang du gtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa tsam zad par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa'i nang du gtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Those who enter in order to destroy the afflictions alone belong to the śrāvaka vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po'i nang du ma gtogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i nang du ma gtogs pa yin nam /
translated: but do they belong to the Mahāyāna?🔽This Abhidharma treatise in seven hundred verses is a single definitive meaning that completely summarizes the Mahāyāna.

original: bdun brgya pa 'di ni theg pa chen po shin tu bsdus pa gcig tu nges pa'i don mchog tu zad pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag las gzhan pa nyan thos la sogs pa dag 'dir ji ltar gtogs /🔽gang gis na nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan ce na de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: bdun brgya pa 'di ni theg pa chen po shin tu bsdus pa gcig tu nges pa'i don mchog tu zad pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can dag las gzhan pa nyan thos la sogs pa dag 'dir ji ltar gtogs / gang gis na nyan thos kyi 'khor bstan ce na de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: How do those who are not of the bodhisattva type, such as śrāvakas, belong to this?

original: don 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las byams pas zhus nas de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: don 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las byams pas zhus nas de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: There is no fault in that, because this meaning is requested by Maitreya in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Stanzas and the Tathāgata replies:

original: sems can rnams kyi rigs ni gsum mo //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rigs ni gsum mo //
translated: The spiritual gene of beings is threefold.

original: de la sems can gyi rigs kha cig ni thog mar rgya che ba dam pa tshol bar byed la rgya che ba nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi rigs kha cig ni thog mar rgya che ba dam pa tshol bar byed la rgya che ba nyid khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, some beings first seek the extensive and sublime, and they understand the very extensiveness.

original: kha cig ni thog mar dman pa tshol @11a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni thog mar dman pa tshol @11a * //
translated: Some first seek the inferior,

original: la dman pa nyid khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: la dman pa nyid khong du chud pa'o //
translated: and they understand the very inferiority.

original: de tsam gyis mgu ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis mgu ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not satisfied with just that.

original: yang mchog rgya che ba tshol zhing de yang khong du chud do //
analyzed: yang mchog rgya che ba tshol zhing de yang khong du chud do //
translated: They also seek the sublime and the extensive, and they understand that as well.

original: kha cig ni dman pa kho na tshol zhing dman pa khong du chud de /
analyzed: kha cig ni dman pa kho na tshol zhing dman pa khong du chud de /
translated: Some seek only the inferior, and they understand the very inferiority.🔽But they are satisfied with just that, and they do not seek the sublime and the extensive.

original: de tsam gyis mgu nas gang ma mchog rgya chen po tshol bar mi byed pa de ni zhi ba phyogs gcig la zhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: de tsam gyis mgu nas gang ma mchog rgya chen po tshol bar mi byed pa de ni zhi ba phyogs gcig la zhugs par bstan to //
translated: They are taught to be those who have entered the one-sided peace.

original: gang dag nyan thos kyi byang chub thob kyang de tsam gyis mgu ba ma yin gyi bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: gang dag nyan thos kyi byang chub thob kyang de tsam gyis mgu ba ma yin gyi bla na med pa yang dag pa'i byang chub tu sems skyed par byed cing /
translated: Those who, even though they have attained the enlightenment of the disciples, are not satisfied with just that, but generate the spirit of unexcelled perfect enlightenment,

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur par byang chub tu yongs su sgyur bar byed la ;
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur par byang chub tu yongs su sgyur bar byed la ;
translated: They are not subject to karma and the afflictions, and they turn them into enlightenment.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba gzhan dang gzhan bsgrubs te /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba gzhan dang gzhan bsgrubs te /
translated: By the power of their prayers, they achieve other and other rebirths,

original: byang chub tu tshogs rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub tu tshogs rdzogs par byed do //
translated: and they complete the collections for enlightenment.

original: de nyan thos kyi rigs can du bstan pa ni thog mar de'i byang chub tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyan thos kyi rigs can du bstan pa ni thog mar de'i byang chub tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are taught to be of the śrāvaka type because they first seek their own enlightenment.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las kyang nga ni rnam grangs kyis de dag byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can du smra'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las kyang nga ni rnam grangs kyis de dag byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can du smra'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: In the Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, it says, “I say that they are of the bodhisattva type by way of metaphor.”

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin par blta'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa yang de lta bu yin par blta'o //
translated: You should understand that Śāriputra and so forth are similar.

original: des na de dag 'di nyan pa la sogs pa'i snod nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag 'di nyan pa la sogs pa'i snod nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are vessels for listening to this teaching and so forth.

original: byang chub la 'am byang chub nyid sems pa yin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la 'am byang chub nyid sems pa yin pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: They are bodhisattvas because they think of enlightenment or because they think of the mind of enlightenment.

original: sems che ba nyid dang spong ba che ba nyid dang rtogs pa che ba nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems che ba nyid dang spong ba che ba nyid dang rtogs pa che ba nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: They possess a great mind, great abandonment, and great realization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: is a great bodhisattva.

original: phan tshun du 'brel pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du brtson 'grus khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun du 'brel pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i ched du brtson 'grus khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir go cha chen po bgos pa'o //
translated: He is clad in great armor, because he is endowed with special effort for the sake of perfecting the six perfections in mutual relationship.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the purport:

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug po re re la yang rnam pa drug po 'dus pa la go cha'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa drug po re re la yang rnam pa drug po 'dus pa la go cha'i brtson 'grus gang yin pa ste /
translated: In each of the six perfections, such as generosity, there is the armor-effort, which is the collection of the six aspects.

original: de ni rnam pa drug dang ldan pa ji skad du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa drug dang ldan pa ji skad du bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the possession of the six aspects, as has been taught.

original: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa bstan te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa nyid kyis ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa bstan te /
translated: By means of irreversibility, the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas is taught,

original: go cha chen po nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go cha chen po nyid kyis bye brag tu byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by great armor.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa med par ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams chen po nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa med par ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams chen po nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: Without the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, the perfections are not suitable for greatness.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa la ni bya bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi phyir mi ldog pa la ni bya bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not proper to say that one who is irreversible from the stage of the factors conducive to insight and so on is a bodhisattva.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: drod dang spyi bo bzod pa dang // chos @11b kyi mchog la gnas pa dag / rtags ni rnam pa nyi shu 'dis //
analyzed: drod dang spyi bo bzod pa dang // chos @11b kyi mchog la gnas pa dag / rtags ni rnam pa nyi shu 'dis //
translated: Those abiding in heat, summit, patience, and the supreme mundane state

original: byang chub dag las mi ldog yin //
analyzed: byang chub dag las mi ldog yin //
translated: are irreversible from the three enlightenments🔽by these twenty signs.

original: mi ldog pa yi rtags dag ni //
analyzed: mi ldog pa yi rtags dag ni //
translated: The signs of irreversibility

original: mthong ba'i lam gnas yin par 'dod //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gnas yin par 'dod // ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: are said to be on the path of seeing.

original: skya rengs ni mang ste mthon ka dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang nyi ma'i mdog 'dra zer ba'o //
analyzed: skya rengs ni mang ste mthon ka dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang nyi ma'i mdog 'dra zer ba'o //
translated: The dawn is said to be many, such as the red dawn, the yellow dawn, the red dawn, and the sun-colored dawn.

original: 'dir dus la ma babs par 'ongs pas na rings pa yin par brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir dus la ma babs par 'ongs pas na rings pa yin par brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, since it has come before the right time, it is called quick.

original: skya rengs mthon ka yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: skya rengs mthon ka yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The dawn should be seen as the red dawn,

original: de ni thams cad pas sngar 'char ba'i phyir dang / khyad par med pas na thams cad bsdu ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad pas sngar 'char ba'i phyir dang / khyad par med pas na thams cad bsdu ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it rises earlier than all others and includes all, since it is not distinguished.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: thog mar skar ma'i 'od nyams shing //🔽nam mkha' dag ni sngo ser mdog / shar phyogs su ni mdog snga'o 'od //
analyzed: thog mar skar ma'i 'od nyams shing // nam mkha' dag ni sngo ser mdog / shar phyogs su ni mdog snga'o 'od //
translated: First, the light of the stars diminishes,🔽and the sky has a blue-yellowish hue.🔽In the east, the color is blue,

original: mthon ka'i skya rengs shar ba yin //
analyzed: mthon ka'i skya rengs shar ba yin //
translated: and the dawn is breaking.

original: de shar ba ni de byung ba'o //
analyzed: de shar ba ni de byung ba'o //
translated: When it breaks, that occurs.

original: des mtshon pa'i dus la bab pa ni tshe ste /
analyzed: des mtshon pa'i dus la bab pa ni tshe ste /
translated: The time indicated by that is life.

original: dus de la bab pa na de'i tshe mtshan mo thog ma rnga brdung ba'i dus so //
analyzed: dus de la bab pa na de'i tshe mtshan mo thog ma rnga brdung ba'i dus so //
translated: When that time arrives, at the beginning of the night, it is the time for beating the drum.

original: de'i phyir dus las 'das so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus las 'das so //
translated: Therefore, it is beyond time.

original: gnas ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i khang pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i khang pa la bya ste /
translated: The place is the house of right seclusion.

original: de nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas byung ba'o //
translated: Then, it comes out.

original: ga la ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: ga la ba zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang mtshon pa'o //
translated: Where indicates the palace of the Tathagata.

original: der zhes bya ba 'dis kyang song ba mtshon par byed do//
analyzed: der zhes bya ba 'dis kyang song ba mtshon par byed do//
translated: There also indicates going.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan bshams pa'i phyogs kyi nye 'khor du 'dug par 'os pa'i gnas las phyi rol na 'dug pa'i phyir yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gdan bshams pa'i phyogs kyi nye 'khor du 'dug par 'os pa'i gnas las phyi rol na 'dug pa'i phyir yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: Since it is outside the place suitable for sitting in the vicinity of the Blessed One's prepared seat, it is beyond the country.

original: yul dang dus las 'das pa 'di gnyis kyis bsam pa'i khyad par ston pa'i phyir 'chad pa'i gleng gzhi yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus las 'das pa 'di gnyis kyis bsam pa'i khyad par ston pa'i phyir 'chad pa'i gleng gzhi yin no //
translated: These two, transcending place and time, are the subject of the introduction, because they show the special nature of the thought.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la lta ba la sogs pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la lta ba la sogs pa ni ji skad du /
translated: The seeing of the Tathagata, etc., is as follows:

original: rin po che'i za ma tog las bcom ldan 'das 'od kyi tog gis /
analyzed: rin po che'i za ma tog las bcom ldan 'das 'od kyi tog gis /
translated: In the Ratnakaranda-sutra, the Lord Suryagarbha🔽said to the noble Manjusri:

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa dang / gang bcom ldan 'das chos la lta ba shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la lta ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal la bka' stsal pa dang / gang bcom ldan 'das chos la lta ba shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la lta ba shin tu rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: Manjusri, when the seeing of phenomena becomes completely pure, the seeing of the Tathagata becomes completely pure.

original: gang gi tshe lus kyis ma yin sems kyis ma yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus kyis ma yin sems kyis ma yin /
translated: Manjusri, when one does not stand in the body, in the mind,

original: mi 'dud rab tu mi 'dud khengs par ma yin gus par ma yin par mi gnas par 'dug ste /
analyzed: mi 'dud rab tu mi 'dud khengs par ma yin gus par ma yin par mi gnas par 'dug ste /
translated: in non-contention, in non-restraint, in non-arrogance, in non-devotion,

original: btang snyoms thob cing rnam par dben pa'i regs kyis sems gnas te /
analyzed: btang snyoms thob cing rnam par dben pa'i regs kyis sems gnas te /
translated: but stands in equanimity, in the state of solitude, with the mind dwelling in its natural peace,

original: dran pa dang @12a * //
analyzed: dran pa dang @12a * //
translated: with mindfulness and awareness,

original: ldan zhing shes bzhin du 'dug pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: ldan zhing shes bzhin du 'dug pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: that is the homage to the Tathagata.

original: gang gi tshe bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag tu sgro 'dogs par mi byed /
translated: When one does not reify the self,

original: sangs rgyas su sgro 'dogs par mi byed /🔽mnyam pa nyid yin par mnyam par mi byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su sgro 'dogs par mi byed / mnyam pa nyid yin par mnyam par mi byed /
translated: does not reify the Buddha,🔽does not make equality equal,

original: mi mnyam pa nyid yin par mi mnyam par mi byed /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa nyid yin par mi mnyam par mi byed /
translated: does not make inequality unequal,

original: rnam par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: rnam par mi byed kyi /
translated: does not discriminate,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang lhan cig tu shin tu gcig par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang lhan cig tu shin tu gcig par byed /
translated: but unifies with the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku yang chos kyi sku yin par rtogs /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku yang chos kyi sku yin par rtogs /
translated: realizes that the Buddha’s body is the Dharma body,

original: rang gi lus kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi nang du gtogs par mthong /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi nang du gtogs par mthong /
translated: sees that one’s own body is included in the realm of the Dharma,

original: mthong ba rnams kyang ma yin par ma mthong /🔽rnam par ma mthong /
analyzed: mthong ba rnams kyang ma yin par ma mthong / rnam par ma mthong /
translated: does not see what is seen as not seen,🔽does not see what is not seen,

original: ring bar ma yin /
analyzed: ring bar ma yin /
translated: does not see what is far as far,🔽does not see what is near as near,

original: nye bar ma yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa yin no zhes gsol to //
analyzed: nye bar ma yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur byed pa yin no zhes gsol to //
translated: then that is service to the Tathagata.

original: de ltar na lta ba la sogs pa de dag ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lta ba la sogs pa de dag ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, these views, etc., are the causes.

original: sems can gyi don ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is the effect.

original: de dag ni phyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: nyon mongs pa med cing kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sku tshe bstod pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med cing kha na ma tho ba med pa'i sku tshe bstod pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He is called the Fortunate One because he has praised the body that is free of afflictions and free of vile actions.

original: tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Fortunate One because he has praised the body that is free of afflictions and free of vile actions.

original: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa kun la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa kun la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all the terms beginning with “vision” and so on.

original: mngon du zhugs te mngon du zhugs te zhes rnam pa gnyis 'byung ba ni gsal ba gsal ba bzhin pa'am /🔽'jam po 'jam po zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: mngon du zhugs te mngon du zhugs te zhes rnam pa gnyis 'byung ba ni gsal ba gsal ba bzhin pa'am / 'jam po 'jam po zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: The two occurrences of the term “facing” are like the expression “clear clear” or “smooth smooth.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon du phyogs pa 'am bshad pa'i don la mngon du phyogs te zhugs pa ni gnas pa'i ched dam spyod pa'i ched du zhugs pa dang gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mngon du phyogs pa 'am bshad pa'i don la mngon du phyogs te zhugs pa ni gnas pa'i ched dam spyod pa'i ched du zhugs pa dang gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Facing the Tathāgata or facing the meaning of the explanation, he abides and engages for the sake of abiding or for the sake of practice, up to here.

original: lta ba la sogs pa bstan zin pa'i ngo bo de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa bstan zin pa'i ngo bo de dag la ji lta ba bzhin du brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is properly diligent in those very things that have been taught, such as vision and so on.

original: glegs bam kha cig las 'das shing thal te 'dus par mkhyen nas zhes 'byung ba zhes bya ba der yang yul dang dus las 'das te zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig las 'das shing thal te 'dus par mkhyen nas zhes 'byung ba zhes bya ba der yang yul dang dus las 'das te zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Some editions of the sutra have “having known that they have passed beyond and are assembled,” but there it should be understood that “having passed beyond” means “having passed beyond time and place.”

original: nyan thos sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dag shes rab dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas chen po yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dag shes rab dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas chen po yin no //
translated: The śrāvakas, such as Śāriputra, are great in terms of their wisdom, miracles, and so on.

original: yang na nyan pas na nyan thos te /🔽gdul bya thams cad do //
analyzed: yang na nyan pas na nyan thos te / gdul bya thams cad do //
translated: Or, they are śrāvakas because they listen,

original: de dag ni mang ba'i phyir chen po nyid do //
analyzed: de dag ni mang ba'i phyir chen po nyid do //
translated: and they are great because they are many.

original: 'dus pa tshogs par mkhyen nas so //
analyzed: 'dus pa tshogs par mkhyen nas so //
translated: Having known that they have assembled,

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi mdzad pa @12b gsum kho nar zad par 'dir nges par gzung ba'i don yin gyi /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi mdzad pa @12b gsum kho nar zad par 'dir nges par gzung ba'i don yin gyi /
translated: The word “also” in the root text means that the three deeds of the Bhagavat that were taught above are definitely included here.

original: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las ting nge 'dzin dang rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pas gdul bya rnams gzud pa lta bur byas pa ni 'dir ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las ting nge 'dzin dang rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pas gdul bya rnams gzud pa lta bur byas pa ni 'dir ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the Bhagavat’s deeds are limited to those three, for in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines and so on, he guides those to be trained by means of his samādhis, miracles, and magical manifestations.

original: gdul bya'i sems kyi rgyud yongs su smin ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par zhugs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems kyi rgyud yongs su smin ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par zhugs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already entered into the character of the complete maturation of the mental continuum of the disciples, which is small, middling, or great.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rnam par zhugs zin pa de yang mngon du zhugs pa mngon du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rnam par zhugs zin pa de yang mngon du zhugs pa mngon du zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan to //
translated: And that complete maturation which has already entered is indicated by the expression “having entered into the manifest.”

original: kha cig gis phyi dang nang gi gnas phye nas /
analyzed: kha cig gis phyi dang nang gi gnas phye nas /
translated: Some, having distinguished the external and internal abodes,

original: bgrod par bya ba gnyis su brtags te mngon du zhugs pa mngon du zhugs pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i tshig gnyis sbyor bar byed pa mi rigs par mthong ste /
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba gnyis su brtags te mngon du zhugs pa mngon du zhugs pa zhes bya ba byed pa'i tshig gnyis sbyor bar byed pa mi rigs par mthong ste /
translated: consider the two to be the objects of approach, and see no point in applying the two verbal expressions “having entered into the manifest” and “having entered into the manifest.”

original: sgra dang don gnyis mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang don gnyis mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable for there to be two words for one meaning.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sh'a ri'i bu dus dang yul las 'das te /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu khyod ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sh'a ri'i bu dus dang yul las 'das te /
translated: “Why is it, Shariputra?” and so on indicate that Shariputra has transcended time and place,

original: 'ongs pa'i dgongs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dris pa ni thams cad pas thog mar 'phags pa 'jam dpal la 'ongs pa ni shin tu dgongs pa mchog dang ldan pa yod par 'khor rnams la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ongs pa'i dgongs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dris pa ni thams cad pas thog mar 'phags pa 'jam dpal la 'ongs pa ni shin tu dgongs pa mchog dang ldan pa yod par 'khor rnams la bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavān’s intention in asking about the one who came is to show the assembly that the one who came first of all was the noble Mañjuśrī, who has the highest intention.

original: thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du 'jam dpal zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jam dpal ni ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba la sogs pa ston par mkhas pa'i phyir dang / thog mar 'ongs pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du 'jam dpal zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'jam dpal ni ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba la sogs pa ston par mkhas pa'i phyir dang / thog mar 'ongs pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: With “Mañjuśrī, etc.,” he shows that Mañjuśrī is skilled in teaching the Tathāgata’s way of seeing things, etc., as they are, and that he came first.

original: sh'a ri'i bus kyang de 'jam dpal lags so zhes smra'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus kyang de 'jam dpal lags so zhes smra'o //
translated: Śāriputra also says, “He is Mañjuśrī.”

original: mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Knowing” means that he is always in meditative equipoise.

original: chos kyi sku thob pa dang sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs pa'i 'phags pa 'jam dpal yang de ltar brtson par 'jug pa dang sbyar na nges par dgos pa chen po zhig yod do snyam nas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pa dang sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs pa'i 'phags pa 'jam dpal yang de ltar brtson par 'jug pa dang sbyar na nges par dgos pa chen po zhig yod do snyam nas /
translated: If the noble Mañjuśrī, who has attained the dharmakāya and entered buddhahood, is engaged in such striving, then it must be for a great purpose.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba la sogs pa la 'khor rnams kyi gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir /🔽'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba la sogs pa la 'khor rnams kyi gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir / 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba la sogs pa bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to generate respect for the Tathagata in the retinue,🔽the Bhagavat asked Manjushri,

original: thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du pho brang gi sgor 'dug ces grag na bden nam zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thog ma nyid du pho brang gi sgor 'dug ces grag na bden nam zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: Is it true that you are sitting at the door of the palace in order to see the Tathagata?

original: de nyid kyi phyir mi srid pa la grag na zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mi srid pa la grag na zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyor bar mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, he used the term if it is said that it is impossible.

original: ci'i phyir khyod kho na lhag par brtson par byed @13a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kho na lhag par brtson par byed @13a * //
translated: Why do you strive so much?

original: ce na ; ma ngoms pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ce na ; ma ngoms pa'i slad du'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because I am not satisfied and so on.

original: 'dis ni shin tu dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni shin tu dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid bstan te /
translated: This shows that he has great faith and so on.

original: 'di ltar blta ba dang phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba 'ang 'dod pa mi ngoms te 'ongs pa ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyis ni dad pa dang brtson 'grus shin tu che ba nyid dang lta bas shes rab che ba nyid dang phyag 'tshal bas ni dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: 'di ltar blta ba dang phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba 'ang 'dod pa mi ngoms te 'ongs pa ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid rnams kyis ni dad pa dang brtson 'grus shin tu che ba nyid dang lta bas shes rab che ba nyid dang phyag 'tshal bas ni dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin
translated: The above passage shows that one has great faith and effort, great wisdom through seeing, and great mindfulness and concentration through paying homage.

original: che ba nyid dang bsnyen bkur byed pas ni thams cad kyang che ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: che ba nyid dang bsnyen bkur byed pas ni thams cad kyang che ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Through serving, all of these are shown to be great.

original: blta ba la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir khyod brtson pa nyid du byed ce na /
analyzed: blta ba la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir khyod brtson pa nyid du byed ce na /
translated: Why should one be diligent in seeing and so forth?

original: 'di ltar bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba nas bsnyen bkur bya ba'i slad du mchi ba de yang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi slad du ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba nas bsnyen bkur bya ba'i slad du mchi ba de yang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi slad du ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Because one goes to see the tathagatas up to serve them for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: 'dis ni blta ba la sogs pa ni rgyu nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'dis ni blta ba la sogs pa ni rgyu nyid yin la /
translated: This shows that seeing and so forth are the causes.

original: sems can gyi don de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin par bstan te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid yin par bstan te /
translated: The benefit of sentient beings is taught to be its result.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byas par 'ga' yang sems can gyi don byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma byas par 'ga' yang sems can gyi don byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, no one is able to benefit sentient beings without seeing the Tathagata and so on in the proper way.

original: de dag gis rim gyis mngon par shes pa bskyed pas sems can rnams kyi sems 'dzud pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang yongs su smin pa la sogs par byed na /
analyzed: de dag gis rim gyis mngon par shes pa bskyed pas sems can rnams kyi sems 'dzud pa dang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang yongs su smin pa la sogs par byed na /
translated: They gradually generate the superknowledges and thus they are able to engage the minds of sentient beings, generate their roots of virtue, and bring them to full maturity.

original: phan pa dang bde ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sems can gyi don byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba'i mtshan nyid kyi sems can gyi don byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are able to benefit sentient beings by means of the characteristics of benefit and happiness.

original: de la phan pa ni theg pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: de la phan pa ni theg pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa'o //
translated: Among them, benefit is the establishment of sentient beings in nirvana by means of the three vehicles.

original: bde ba ni lha dang mi'i bde ba la bkod pa ste ;
analyzed: bde ba ni lha dang mi'i bde ba la bkod pa ste ;
translated: Happiness is the establishment of sentient beings in the happiness of gods and humans.

original: sngar lha dang mi la bkod nas phyis theg pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor bar mdzad do //
analyzed: sngar lha dang mi la bkod nas phyis theg pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor bar mdzad do //
translated: Having previously established them in the happiness of gods and humans, they are later caused to attain nirvana by means of the three vehicles.

original: de ltar ma byas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar ma byas pas thugs rje med cing sbyor ba la ma lcogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar ma byas pas thugs rje med cing sbyor ba la ma lcogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not do so, one is not free from the suffering of conditioned existence, and so one is without compassion and one's practice is not feasible.

original: 'dir ni de yongs su spang bar bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir ni de yongs su spang bar bzhed do //
translated: Here, it is the latter that is intended.

original: de ltar na bdag ni blta bas mi ngoms so zhes bya ba 'dis ni chog par 'dzin pa dang rgyun tu mi sbyor bar byed pa yongs su spangs so //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag ni blta bas mi ngoms so zhes bya ba 'dis ni chog par 'dzin pa dang rgyun tu mi sbyor bar byed pa yongs su spangs so //
translated: Thus, by the statement, I am never satisfied in looking at him, the author rejects the attitude of self-satisfaction and the lack of constant application.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi ched du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thad du 'ongs bas ni ma gus par byed pa dang le lo dang snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba yongs su @13b spangs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi ched du de bzhin gshegs pa'i thad du 'ongs bas ni ma gus par byed pa dang le lo dang snying rje med pa'i sbyor ba yongs su @13b spangs so //
translated: I have come into the presence of the Tathagata for the sake of sentient beings rejects the attitude of disrespect, laziness, and lack of compassion.

original: de dag gi sa ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid de dag yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de dag gi sa ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid de dag yin par bstan te /
translated: The author has indicated the characteristics of the conventional as being the bases of those attitudes.

original: gang zag gis sems pa dang / spyod pa la sogs pa kun tu brtags pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag gis sems pa dang / spyod pa la sogs pa kun tu brtags pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He has indicated that the conventional is the mental construction of persons, things, etc.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang phyag bgyi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la blta ba dang phyag bgyi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mthong ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: Now, Blessed One, if I were to see the Tathagata and bow down to him... and so on, this teaches the path of seeing.

original: de yang skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma bcu drug gi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: And that has the nature of sixteen moments,

original: skad cig ma de dag rim gyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: skad cig ma de dag rim gyis ston par byed do //
translated: and those moments are gradually taught.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji lta zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If means how.

original: ji ltar bdag gis mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis zhes bya ste /
translated: How I see means by what aspect.

original: rnam pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that aspect?

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be the aspect of suchness.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin du 'dug pas na /
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin du 'dug pas na /
translated: Because it always exists as such,

original: de bzhin nyid de ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du skye ba'i gnas skabs kyang smig rgyu'i chu bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de ma skyes pa'i gnas skabs bzhin du skye ba'i gnas skabs kyang smig rgyu'i chu bzhin du yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: like the unborn state, the state of birth does not exist like a mirage.

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog za ma tog las kyang skye ba dang mi skye ba gnyis mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog za ma tog las kyang skye ba dang mi skye ba gnyis mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: “The equality of arising and nonarising is thusness.”🔽Thusness is seen

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa de'i sgo nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o //🔽'dis ni de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas gnyis dang gzhi dang gnas pa bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa de'i sgo nas / de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o // 'dis ni de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas gnyis dang gzhi dang gnas pa bstan te /
translated: through that aspect.

original: rnam pa ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This shows that thusness and the Buddha are the same, and that the aspect is not different from what is seen.

original: gzhan yin na yang rnam pa nyid du mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yin na yang rnam pa nyid du mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were different, it would be unreasonable to call it an aspect.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ni blta bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ni blta bar bya ba yin la /
translated: If the Tathāgata is what is seen,

original: khyod ni lta bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: khyod ni lta bar byed pa yin na /
translated: and you are the one who sees,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par mthong ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par mthong ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then because of the existence of apprehended object and apprehending subject, you would not see in the aspect of thusness.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it says, “in a manner of nonapprehension.”

original: chos thams cad dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang bdag kyang mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dang de bzhin gshegs pa dang bdag kyang mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: all phenomena, the Tathāgata, and the self are not apprehended.

original: de la sbyor zhing mnyam par 'jog pa de'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de la sbyor zhing mnyam par 'jog pa de'i sgo nas so //
translated: By that, one is joined to and becomes absorbed in meditative concentration.

original: ci ste zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the word “tathāgata” is distinguished by the realization of the suchness of all phenomena, and because the Tathāgata is the aspect of suchness,

original: 'jam dpal gyis kyang de ltar mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de lta yin na ni mi dmigs par sbyor @14a * //
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis kyang de ltar mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro // de lta yin na ni mi dmigs par sbyor @14a * //
translated: and because Mañjuśrī sees it in that way.

original: ba 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ba 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the practice of nonapprehension is established.

original: gzhan du dmigs pa yod na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du dmigs pa yod na ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise, if there is apprehension.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata is seen.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan du mthong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan du mthong ba yin zhe na /
translated: Why is he seen otherwise?

original: de rjes su dran pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: Because he is seen as the Tathāgata by the power of recollecting him.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa ni mthong ba'i byang chub kyi gnas kyi yan lag tu gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dran pa ni mthong ba'i byang chub kyi gnas kyi yan lag tu gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, mindfulness is said to be the limb of the enlightenment of seeing.

original: ma mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-seeing,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nonconceptual intuition exists.

original: gzugs kyi skur ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skur ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar mi bya ste /
translated: Why should the Tathāgata not be seen in the form body?

original: de ni 'di ltar yum gyi lhums su bltams pa dang / tshal lum bir skyes pa dang / byang chub chen por de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar yum gyi lhums su bltams pa dang / tshal lum bir skyes pa dang / byang chub chen por de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Because he is born in the mother’s womb, in the Lumbini Grove, and in the great enlightenment, and becomes the Tathāgata.

original: der mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: der mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because he is fully enlightened there.

original: spros pa'i dra ba 'di thams cad dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa de dag gis /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ni yang dag pa mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: spros pa'i dra ba 'di thams cad dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du brdzun pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa de dag gis / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba ni yang dag pa mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: This entire net of conceptual elaborations is false, like a fairy city.🔽Therefore, seeing the Tathāgata in those aspects is not seeing correctly.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mi skye ba'i rnam par blta ba nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la mi skye ba'i rnam par blta ba nas /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata should be seen in the uncreated aspect,🔽up to the aspect of the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: dngos po ma mchis pa'i rnam pa'i bar du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa'i rnam pa'i bar du zhes gsungs so //
translated: up to the aspect of non-entityness.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bgyi'o zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skye ba ma mchis pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po ma mchis pa'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bgyi'o zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The word “up to” is to be applied to the aspect of non-production and the aspect of non-entityness.

original: rnam pa de dag gis bltas na /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis bltas na /
translated: When one sees in this way,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba yin zhe na /
translated: how does one see the Tathāgata as he is?

original: 'dir bshad pa 'bras bu skye na /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa 'bras bu skye na /
translated: Here it is explained: If an effect arises,

original: rgyu dang dus mnyam par skye 'am dus tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: rgyu dang dus mnyam par skye 'am dus tha dad pa yin /
translated: does it arise simultaneously with its cause or at a different time?

original: dus mnyam pa yin na ni kun cig car dmigs par 'gyur ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa dang / bskal ba yang skad cig gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa yin na ni kun cig car dmigs par 'gyur ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa dang / bskal ba yang skad cig gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is simultaneous, then everything would be observed simultaneously, cause and effect would be undifferentiated, and an eon would be just a single moment.

original: dus tha dad na yang nus pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus tha dad na yang nus pa med pa'i phyir rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is at a different time, then because there would be no capacity, it would be causeless.

original: rgyu med pa yin na ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yin na ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is causeless, then because it would not depend on anything,

original: rtag tu yod pa 'am med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa 'am med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that it would always exist or not exist.

original: de bas na don dam par skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par skye ba zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, what is called “arising” does not exist at all.

original: de ltar gzugs su de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya ba ma yin par bstan nas /🔽mtshan du blta bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs su de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya ba ma yin par bstan nas / mtshan du blta bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: Having taught that the Tathāgata is not to be viewed in terms of form,🔽he says that he is not to be viewed in terms of the major marks,

original: dpe byad du yang ma yin no zhes @14b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe byad du yang ma yin no zhes @14b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and also not in terms of the minor marks.

original: de bzhin nyid la kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis te /
translated: In suchness, there is no arising,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: gzugs kyi skur de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skur de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba ma yin na /
translated: If the Tathāgata is not to be viewed in terms of the form body,

original: 'o na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa thams cad du khyad par du gyur pas bsags pa'i gnas skabs de
analyzed: 'o na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan pa pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa thams cad du khyad par du gyur pas bsags pa'i gnas skabs de
translated: then, since the enjoyment body is endowed with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks, and is the uncommon accumulation of all the qualities of the Mahāyāna result, such as the perfections and the immeasurables, which is the basis for the enjoyment of the result,

original: bzhin gshegs pa yin par lta mod /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa yin par lta mod /
translated: is it not the case that the Tathāgata is the enjoyment body?

original: de skad du mgon po byams pas kyang /🔽thub pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan //
analyzed: de skad du mgon po byams pas kyang / thub pa'i sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan //
translated: The protector Maitreya also says:🔽The Sage has the thirty-two marks

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bdag / theg chen longs spyod rdzogs pas na //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bdag / theg chen longs spyod rdzogs pas na //
translated: And the eighty excellent signs🔽In the great vehicle’s enjoyment body.

original: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs skur bzhed //
analyzed: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs skur bzhed //
translated: This is asserted to be the enjoyment body.

original: gang dang gang gi 'dir rgyu gang //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi 'dir rgyu gang //
translated: Whatever is the cause of whatever

original: mtshan nyid dag ni sgrub byed pa //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag ni sgrub byed pa //
translated: Is the characteristic of the effect of that.

original: de dang de ni rab rgyas pa //🔽kun nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin //🔽zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de dang de ni rab rgyas pa // kun nas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin // zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Whatever is the full development of that

original: de yang yod pa yin te /🔽'di ltar skye bo bla ma'i drung du 'gro ba dang sdom pa blang ba dang / dngos po bzang po sbyin pa dang // bsad pa las thar bar byed pa dang / yid dam len pa dang / dge ba spel ba la sogs pa rang ji lta ba bzhin du phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan dang /
analyzed: de yang yod pa yin te /🔽'di ltar skye bo bla ma'i drung du 'gro ba dang sdom pa blang ba dang / dngos po bzang po sbyin pa dang // bsad pa las thar bar byed pa dang / yid dam len pa dang / dge ba spel ba la sogs pa rang ji lta ba bzhin du phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo la sogs pa'i mtshan dang /
translated: Is the characteristic of the origin of that.

original: sen mo'i mdog snum ba la sogs pa dpe byad bzang po sgrub par byed pa'i las rnams kun nas 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sen mo'i mdog snum ba la sogs pa dpe byad bzang po sgrub par byed pa'i las rnams kun nas 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: the minor marks such as the glossy nails, and so on, do not arise.

original: de med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyang 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: And because they do not exist, the results of those, the major and minor marks, do not arise.

original: des na de dag gi sku yang de dag gis khyad par du gyur pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag gi sku yang de dag gis khyad par du gyur pa'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, their bodies also do not exist as the nature that is distinguished by those.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid la kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid la kun nas 'byung ba ma mchis te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Suchness is not a source.”

original: 'dis ni 'byung ba'i rgyu bkag go //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'byung ba'i rgyu bkag go //
translated: This refutes the cause of arising.

original: de bzhin nyid ni 'byung ba 'ang ma lags zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshan dang dpe byad 'byung ba bkag go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni 'byung ba 'ang ma lags zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshan dang dpe byad 'byung ba bkag go //
translated: “Suchness is not an arising” refutes the arising of the major and minor marks.

original: khyad par yang ma lags te zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshan dang dpe byad med pa'i phyir des khyad par can du gyur pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bkag go //
analyzed: khyad par yang ma lags te zhes bya ba 'dis ni mtshan dang dpe byad med pa'i phyir des khyad par can du gyur pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bkag go //
translated: “It is not a distinction” refutes the enjoyment body, which is distinguished by those, because the major and minor marks do not exist.

original: 'o na byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya @15a * //
analyzed: 'o na byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i chos rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar bya @15a * //
translated: Well, the unshared qualities such as the aspects of enlightenment should be viewed in the Tathagata.🔽

original: mod ce na /
analyzed: mod ce na /
translated: Well then, should the Tathagata be viewed in terms of the unshared qualities such as the aspects of enlightenment?

original: de yang mi rung bar yul na mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang mi rung bar yul na mi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: That is also not correct, he says, since he does not dwell in a place, etc.

original: yul ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po'i spyi la bya'o //
analyzed: yul ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po'i spyi la bya'o //
translated: A place is to be understood as the general category of the aggregates of morality, etc.

original: phyogs ni de'i cha shas te /
analyzed: phyogs ni de'i cha shas te /
translated: A region is a part of that,
