original: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba spangs ba'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa mthar phyin pa'i bdag nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba spangs ba'i mtshan nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa mthar phyin pa'i bdag nyid la bya'o //
translated: to be understood as the perfected nature of the elimination of the latent proclivities.

original: gnas pa ni de nyid la slob pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni de nyid la slob pa ste /
translated: Dwelling is training in just that.

original: tha dad pa de dag de bzhin nyid la med pas na /
analyzed: tha dad pa de dag de bzhin nyid la med pas na /
translated: Since those differences do not exist in reality,

original: yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas phyogs na mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: he does not dwell in a place or a region.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa bkag pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' dang / de ltar byung ba'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa rnams brtsal to //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa bkag pas sngon gyi mtha' dang / ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' dang / de ltar byung ba'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa rnams brtsal to //
translated: By the negation of the past, etc., the extremes of former and future births and the conduct that occurs in that way are sought.

original: gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba la gnyis ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba zhes bya ba la gnyis ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase distinguished by duality means that the two are characterized by the accumulations of merit and direct intuition.

original: des rab tu phye ba ni de las skyes pa dang / de las byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du yin na de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: des rab tu phye ba ni de las skyes pa dang / de las byung ba zhes bya ba'i bar du yin na de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: It is distinguished by them in the sense that it is produced from them and arises from them, but suchness is not like that.

original: gnyis su ma mchis pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la sogs pa yin na des rab tu phye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su ma mchis pa ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid la sogs pa yin na des rab tu phye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The absence of duality is the emptiness of the unconditioned etc., but it is not distinguished by that.

original: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pas rab tu phye ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir /🔽de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa la sogs pa med pas na de bzhin nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyis su med pas rab tu phye ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi phyir / de bzhin nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par dag pa la sogs pa med pas na de bzhin nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said: because it is not distinguished by non-duality.🔽Since there is no defilement or purification etc. in suchness, he says: suchness is not defiled etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mi skye ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'gag pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mi skye ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams mi 'gag pa de'i phyir /
translated: For this very reason, since the dharmas of purification are not produced and defilement is not terminated, he says: because there is no termination of defilement etc.

original: de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag pa ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag pa ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Suchness is not produced and does not cease.🔽This is the view, because this mass of conceptual elaborations does not exist in suchness.

original: de ltar lta ba ni spros pa'i tshogs 'di thams cad de bzhin nyid la med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni spros pa'i tshogs 'di thams cad de bzhin nyid la med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de ltar byas na nyi khri lnga stong pa dang / rdo rje gcod pa dang / sgo mtha' yas pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na nyi khri lnga stong pa dang / rdo rje gcod pa dang / sgo mtha' yas pa la sogs pa la /
translated: If this is done, it will accord with the teaching in the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines, the Diamond Cutter, the Teaching of Akṣayamati, and so on,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba dang / rjes su dran pa bstan pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba dang / rjes su dran pa bstan pa dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: that seeing the Tathāgata is seeing suchness.

original: zla ba sgron ma las kyang /🔽gzugs sum yin mtshan nyid chos min par //
analyzed: zla ba sgron ma las kyang / gzugs sum yin mtshan nyid chos min par //
translated: The Candrapradīpa Sūtra also says,🔽The bodhisattva who is a child of the victors

original: rgyal ba'i sras 'di sangs rgyas rjes su dran //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras 'di sangs rgyas rjes su dran //
translated: remembers the Buddha🔽in the absence of form, in the absence of characteristics,🔽in the absence of attributes.

original: gang du sems med 'gro zhing rgyu ba med //
analyzed: gang du sems med 'gro zhing rgyu ba med //
translated: Where there is no mind, no going, and no wandering,

original: de ltar de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde ni mdo sde gzhan gyi rjes su @15b 'brangs te /
analyzed: de ltar de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran // zhes gsungs so // bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde ni mdo sde gzhan gyi rjes su @15b 'brangs te /
translated: in that way he remembers the Buddha.

original: khong du chud par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, “The sūtras should be understood in dependence on other sūtras.”

original: de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rnam pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa lta na yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i rnam pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa lta na yin gyi /
translated: Thus, one sees the Tathagata means that one sees the Tathagata in accordance with the teaching, and not otherwise.

original: de las gzhan du lta na ma yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan du lta na ma yin no zhes nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: This is the definite conclusion.

original: 'di dag gis ni rang gi 'dod pa dam bcas pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rang gi 'dod pa dam bcas pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: By this, he has established his own belief.

original: 'di tsam gyis kha cig la gsal bar mi 'gyur bas na de bas na ma lus par khong du chud par bya ba'i ched du 'jam dpal khyod kyis de ltar bltas na ji zhig mthong zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis kha cig la gsal bar mi 'gyur bas na de bas na ma lus par khong du chud par bya ba'i ched du 'jam dpal khyod kyis de ltar bltas na ji zhig mthong zhes dris so //
translated: Since this is not clear to some, in order that they may understand it completely, he asks, Manjusri, if you see in that way, what do you see?

original: dris pa rtogs par bya ba'i ched du /
analyzed: dris pa rtogs par bya ba'i ched du /
translated: In order to understand the question,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis de ltar bltas na ci yang mthong ba ma mchis so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis de ltar bltas na ci yang mthong ba ma mchis so zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, Blessed One, if I see in that way, I do not see anything at all.

original: de nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is that like? Therefore, he says,

original: bdag gis chos gang la yang skye ba yang ma mthong zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gis chos gang la yang skye ba yang ma mthong zhes gsungs te /
translated: I do not see any dharma that arises.

original: ma skyes pa mthong bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa mthong bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to see what has not arisen.

original: ma mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Not seeing is seeing the Tathāgata.

original: de ni rnam grangs kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa ston te /
analyzed: de ni rnam grangs kyis zhal gyis bzhes pa ston te /
translated: This shows the acceptance through enumeration.

original: de ltar blta ba dang bsnyen bkur byed pa'i dang tshul can dag sems can du dmigs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba yin na byams pa chen po nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: de ltar blta ba dang bsnyen bkur byed pa'i dang tshul can dag sems can du dmigs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba yin na byams pa chen po nye bar gnas te /
translated: Thus, those who have the way of seeing and serving are free from observing sentient beings and clinging, and great love is present.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha dag 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'thad par ston pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha dag 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'thad par ston pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la /
translated: To show that it is untenable because of the contradiction of the armor of completely liberating all sentient beings, it says, Mañjuśrī, you say to the Tathāgata:

original: de ltar mthong ba dang de ltar bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba dang de ltar bsnyen bkur byas pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Seeing like this and serving like this...

original: go cha chen po bgos pa de ni khyod dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa de ni khyod dka' ba byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: up to The one who wears the great armor is the one who does what is difficult.

original: phan tshun 'gal zhing mi rigs pa'i don la rjes su brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal zhing mi rigs pa'i don la rjes su brtson par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that they are engaged in things that are mutually contradictory and unreasonable.

original: sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: With regard to all sentient beings means with regard to those characterized by the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nyid yin gyi sems can dang chos la dmigs pa gnyis ni chen po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byams pa chen po zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nyid yin gyi sems can dang chos la dmigs pa gnyis ni chen po nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Great love means nonapprehending, because love that apprehends sentient beings and phenomena is not tenable as great love,

original: mtshan ma ma spangs pa'i phyir dang rtsol ba yod pa'i phyir dang dbang rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽sa brgyad pa la sogs pa mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa la ni byams pa chen po lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba @16a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma ma spangs pa'i phyir dang rtsol ba yod pa'i phyir dang dbang rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro // sa brgyad pa la sogs pa mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa la ni byams pa chen po lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba @16a * //
translated: because it does not abandon signs, because it is effortful, and because it does not obtain the controlling power over the mind.🔽On the eighth ground and above, when one obtains the acceptance that phenomena are unborn, great love arises spontaneously.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It arises from the maturation of the seeds of great love that have been cultivated for a long time.

original: ci yang med cing zhes bya ba ni sems can la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa dag gis sems can du dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci yang med cing zhes bya ba ni sems can la dmigs pa dang chos la dmigs pa dag gis sems can du dmigs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Nothing whatsoever” means that there is no objective reference to sentient beings, by means of the objective reference to sentient beings and the objective reference to the Dharma.

original: sems can du mngon par zhen pa ci yang med cing zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa gnyis kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya bar ji ltar rang gi rnam par rtog pa spangs par bstan to //
analyzed: sems can du mngon par zhen pa ci yang med cing zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa gnyis kyis mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya bar ji ltar rang gi rnam par rtog pa spangs par bstan to //
translated: “Nothing whatsoever in the notion of sentient beings” means that, by means of the non-apprehension and the non-objectification, he has abandoned the notion of sentient beings, as his own idea, which is to be abandoned by the path of vision and by the path of cultivation.

original: byams pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir zhugs kyang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: byams pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir zhugs kyang zhes gsungs te /
translated: “Although he has set out for the complete Nirvana of all sentient beings, in order to accomplish loving kindness,”

original: theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du zhi ba bde ba yin te /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni gtan du zhi ba bde ba yin te /
translated: Nirvana in the three vehicles is the eternal peace and happiness.

original: de nyid bsgrub pa'i ched du lha dang mi'i bde ba la dgod par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub pa'i ched du lha dang mi'i bde ba la dgod par mdzad do //
translated: For the sake of its accomplishment, he establishes them in the happiness of gods and men.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ched du zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ched du zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi don du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings means for the sake of sentient beings.

original: go cha ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: go cha ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Armor has been explained above.

original: khyod mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mi 'thad pa nyid smos par byed do //
analyzed: khyod mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mi 'thad pa nyid smos par byed do //
translated: With in a manner of non-apprehension, and so on, he states the untenability of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir thams cad du kyang gi sgra smos so //🔽'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang rnam grangs kyis mi 'gal ba 'thad pa zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba bstan pa'i phyir thams cad du kyang gi sgra smos so // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang rnam grangs kyis mi 'gal ba 'thad pa zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir /
translated: For that very reason, in order to show the contradiction, he says in every way with the word also.

original: ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The noble Mañjuśrī also accepts the non-contradiction by way of a category, saying, It is so, just as you have said, and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa yod na ni gal te sems can mi dmigs na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yod na ni gal te sems can mi dmigs na /
translated: If there is conceptualization, then if sentient beings are not apprehended,

original: ji ltar de dag la bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid byams pa la nye bar gnas par byed ces bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag la bde ba nye bar bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid byams pa la nye bar gnas par byed ces bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: how is it that this fault does not arise: How does one abide in love, which is characterized by the accomplishment of their happiness?

original: gang gi tshe lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba dmigs pa med pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong skyes pa de'i tshe ji ltar goms pa bzhin du lhun gyis grub pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe lhun gyis grub par 'byung ba dmigs pa med pa'i zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong skyes pa de'i tshe ji ltar goms pa bzhin du lhun gyis grub pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When spontaneous occurrence is observed, the effortless meditative serenity and insight arise, and then all the undefiled qualities arise effortlessly, just as one becomes accustomed to them.

original: de bas na byams pa chen po dang sems can mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha dang sems can mi dmigs pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa rnams cung zad kyang 'gal ba 'am mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na byams pa chen po dang sems can mya ngan las 'da' ba'i go cha dang sems can mi dmigs pa dang mngon par zhen pa med pa rnams cung zad kyang 'gal ba 'am mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction or inconsistency in the great love, the armor of nirvana for sentient beings, and the non-apprehension of sentient beings and the absence of attachment.

original: de ltar na chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam la yang cung zad kyang skyon med do zhes rnam grangs kyis khas blangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam la yang cung zad kyang skyon med do zhes rnam grangs kyis khas blangs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the path of insight, which is the realization of the reality realm, is also faultless in every way.

original: @16b da ni chen po nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: @16b da ni chen po nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate its greatness,

original: go cha de ni ji ltar bdag gis sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: go cha de ni ji ltar bdag gis sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “This armor is like the realm of sentient beings,” and so on.

original: de ltar go cha bgos te /
analyzed: de ltar go cha bgos te /
translated: Thus, having donned the armor,

original: sems can gyi khams sems can gyi rigs 'khor bar gtogs pa rnams /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams sems can gyi rigs 'khor bar gtogs pa rnams /
translated: The realm of sentient beings is the class of sentient beings that belong to cyclic existence.

original: bri ba 'am mya ngan las 'das pa gnas pa rnams gang bar bya zhes bya ba'i sems can gyi khams nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bri ba 'am mya ngan las 'das pa gnas pa rnams gang bar bya zhes bya ba'i sems can gyi khams nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the realm of sentient beings itself is not observed,

original: bri ba nyid dang gang ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bri ba nyid dang gang ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no decrease or increase.

original: yongs su brtag pa bzung ste /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa bzung ste /
translated: Taking up a hypothetical case,

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid ston par byed de /
translated: he shows that very point with “If, for example, etc.”

original: de ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: That is the clarification.

original: rnam pa 'di dag tsam gyis ci'i phyir bri ba med pa nyid dang gang ba nyid du mi mngon zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag tsam gyis ci'i phyir bri ba med pa nyid dang gang ba nyid du mi mngon zhe na /
translated: If it is just these aspects, why is there no decrease and no increase?

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni sems can dben pa dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni sems can dben pa dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here the reason is stated: “because of the emptiness of sentient beings.”

original: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It means because of the emptiness of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin nyid la sems can 'ga' yang dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sems can 'ga' yang dmigs su med do //
translated: In reality, no sentient being at all is observed in suchness.

original: de nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that also so?

original: sems can sems can ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can sems can ma yin pa'i phyir te zhes gsungs te /
translated: because of the non-existence of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi mtshan nyid phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang bdag la sogs pa gzhan yang rung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gyi mtshan nyid phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang bdag la sogs pa gzhan yang rung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because the characteristics of sentient beings, such as the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, self, etc., do not exist.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du che ba nyid bstan zin to //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du che ba nyid bstan zin to //
translated: The greatness of the Buddha, like space, has been taught.

original: da ni 'o na ni byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtha' med pa nyid 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: da ni 'o na ni byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtha' med pa nyid 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Now, in the passage beginning with “If, having fully awakened to enlightenment,” the author asks about the absence of an end.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sems can med na zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sems can med na zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “ That” refers to the non-existence of sentient beings.

original: chos nyan pa med pas chos ston pa mi 'thad na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa med pas chos ston pa mi 'thad na /
translated: If there are no sentient beings to hear the Dharma, the teaching of the Dharma is not tenable.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yod pa ma yin pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa yod pa ma yin pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since the deeds of the Buddha do not exist, the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment is meaningless.

original: lan ni gang gi tshe sems can shin tu mi dmigs pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lan ni gang gi tshe sems can shin tu mi dmigs pa de'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The answer is: “When sentient beings are not at all apprehended…”

original: gang gi tshe sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang da ltar gyi dngos po med pas sems can mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang da ltar gyi dngos po med pas sems can mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When sentient beings are not apprehended because of the non-existence of things in the past, future, and present,

original: 'dir su zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya su la chos bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir su zhig mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya su la chos bstan par bya ste /
translated: then who here is fully awakened, and to whom is the Dharma taught?

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos 'chad pa dang nyan pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / chos 'chad pa dang nyan pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no one at all who is fully awakened, or who teaches or listens to the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can de dag shin tu dmigs su med @17a * //
analyzed: sems can de dag shin tu dmigs su med @17a * //
translated: Why are those sentient beings utterly unapprehendable,

original: pa yin / gang gis na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa 'ga' yang med ce na /
analyzed: pa yin / gang gis na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba la sogs pa 'ga' yang med ce na /
translated: so that there is no one at all who is fully awakened, and so on?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said, “Because all phenomena are empty of their own intrinsic reality,” and so on.

original: 'dis ni gtan tshigs bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan tshigs bstan te /
translated: This teaches the reason.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all those phenomena, such as form, and so on, are empty of their own intrinsic reality,

original: shin tu mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It is utterly non-apprehensible.

original: mtha' med pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: mtha' med pa bstan zin to //
translated: The infinitude of the world has already been taught.

original: da ni 'jam dpal gang gi tshe chos thams cad shin tu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpag tu med pa nyid 'dri'o //
analyzed: da ni 'jam dpal gang gi tshe chos thams cad shin tu mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpag tu med pa nyid 'dri'o //
translated: Now, in the passage beginning “Mañjuśrī, when all phenomena are utterly non-apprehensible,” the infinitude of sentient beings is being questioned.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya bas ni 'das ma thag par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de'i tshe zhes ston to //🔽ci zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ci zhe 'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya bas ni 'das ma thag par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa de'i tshe zhes ston to // ci zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs ci zhe 'am /
translated: The phrase “at that time” indicates that it is at the time when all phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: ci zhes 'dri ba tsam yin no //
analyzed: ci zhes 'dri ba tsam yin no //
translated: The word “what” is used to ask a question, or it is used to ask “why?”

original: da ni zhes bya ba ni sems can dpag tu yod pa 'dri ba'i tshe'o //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ni sems can dpag tu yod pa 'dri ba'i tshe'o //
translated: The word “now” refers to the time when the infinitude of sentient beings is being questioned.

original: sems can du yang 'dogs sam zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jog gam zhes 'dir tshig zur du 'dod do //
analyzed: sems can du yang 'dogs sam zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jog gam zhes 'dir tshig zur du 'dod do //
translated: The phrase “would one designate sentient beings” is to be understood as “would one posit sentient beings.”

original: yang gal te zhes bya ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang gal te zhes bya ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “if one were to” means “if one were to say.”

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni sems can dpag tu med pa shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni sems can dpag tu med pa shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase “some person” refers to someone who wishes to know the infinitude of sentient beings.

original: gang dag yin zhes bya ba ni sems can du dpag tu yod pa gang zhes bya ba'o //🔽de skad 'dri na de la khyod kyis ji skad bya zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po la sogs pa'i chos tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gang dag yin zhes bya ba ni sems can du dpag tu yod pa gang zhes bya ba'o // de skad 'dri na de la khyod kyis ji skad bya zhes bya ba ni gal te phung po la sogs pa'i chos tsam du zad do //
translated: What are they? means What are the sentient beings that are to be measured?

original: sems can gdags su med na zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sems can gdags su med na zhes dgongs so //
translated: If it is asked like that, what would you say? means If it is asked like that, what would you say if it is asked, 'If sentient beings are not to be apprehended, then what is the basis for the practice of the bodhisattva?'

original: lan du de skad 'dri ba de la bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lan du de skad 'dri ba de la bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The answer is I would say to the one who asks that question... and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni nam mkha' bzhin du sems can dpag tu med par bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni nam mkha' bzhin du sems can dpag tu med par bstan te /
translated: By saying What are the qualities of the Buddha? he shows that sentient beings are immeasurable like space.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the qualities of the Buddha are immeasurable like space.

original: de skad du yang nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las dpag tu med pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de skad du yang nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las dpag tu med pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines and so on, it is taught to be immeasurable.

original: nam mkha' dpag tu med pas na gzugs dpag tu med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' dpag tu med pas na gzugs dpag tu med do //
translated: Because space is immeasurable, form is immeasurable.

original: gzugs dpag tu med pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dpag tu med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs dpag tu med pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dpag tu med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because form is immeasurable, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: de las gzhan par dpag pa yang bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan par dpag pa yang bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is also said that it is not to be measured in any other way.

original: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gsang ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gsang ba'i mdo las /
translated: As the Tathāgatācintya-guhya-sūtra says,🔽Those who want to know the limit

original: @17b mi rnams gang zhig sangs rgyas chos //
analyzed: @17b mi rnams gang zhig sangs rgyas chos //
translated: Of the Buddha’s Dharma,

original: nam mkha' 'dra ba'i bdag nyid la /🔽pha mtha' rtogs par 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: nam mkha' 'dra ba'i bdag nyid la / pha mtha' rtogs par 'dod pa ni //
translated: Which is like space,

original: de ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Will not succeed.🔽Whatever examples are given

original: sangs rgyas dang ni chos rnams kyi //🔽dper ni ji tsam 'ga' byed pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang ni chos rnams kyi // dper ni ji tsam 'ga' byed pa //
translated: Of the Buddha and the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas dag dang de mi mthun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag dang de mi mthun //
translated: The Buddha and the Dharma are not like that;

original: de dag rgyal ba smos par byed //
analyzed: de dag rgyal ba smos par byed //
translated: They are said to be like the Victor.

original: sangs rgyas chos dang mnyam pa gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang mnyam pa gang //
translated: Whatever is equal to the Buddha’s Dharma

original: dpe ni de la gcig yod pa //
analyzed: dpe ni de la gcig yod pa //
translated: Has only one example:

original: nam mkha'i khams su bstan pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams su bstan pa ste //
translated: It is taught to be the element of space,

original: de yi tshad ni gang na'ang med //
analyzed: de yi tshad ni gang na'ang med //
translated: Which has no measure at all.

original: nam mkha'i khams ni ji tsam par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni ji tsam par //
translated: As vast as the element of space is,

original: rgyal ba'i tshul khrims de tsam yin //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i tshul khrims de tsam yin //
translated: The morality of the Victor is just that.🔽Concentration, wisdom, knowledge,🔽liberation, and the knowledge of liberation,

original: bsam gtan shes rab ye shes dang // rnam grol ye shes mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab ye shes dang // rnam grol ye shes mthong ba dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: gal te de lta na nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'dir yang nam mkha' bzhin du sems can dpag tu med pa yin zhes ci'i phyir ma gsungs /
analyzed: gal te de lta na nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'dir yang nam mkha' bzhin du sems can dpag tu med pa yin zhes ci'i phyir ma gsungs /
translated: If that is so, then just as in the Twenty-five Thousand, here too why did he not say, “Like space, sentient beings are infinite”?

original: gzhan du ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gzhan du ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the need for anything else?

original: 'di yang gsal ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang gsal ba kho na yin te /
translated: This is also quite clear.

original: nyi khri lnga stong par ni rgyas par bstan la /
analyzed: nyi khri lnga stong par ni rgyas par bstan la /
translated: In the Twenty-five Thousand, he taught extensively.

original: 'dir ni mdor bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mdor bstan te /
translated: Here, he taught in brief.

original: tshig nyung yang don mang ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig nyung yang don mang ba yin no //
translated: Although the words are few, the meaning is great.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention of this teaching is as follows.

original: sems can dpag tu med pa la dmigs pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa rgyu nam mkha' bzhin pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos 'bras bur gyur pa rnams de tsam kho nar mngon par grub pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa la dmigs pa'i byang chub kyi sems dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa rgyu nam mkha' bzhin pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos 'bras bur gyur pa rnams de tsam kho nar mngon par grub pa yin no zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that the enlightenment mind that takes immeasurable sentient beings as its object and the immeasurable, etc., which are like space, are the cause, and that the qualities of a Buddha that are the result are established just to that extent.

original: dpag tu med pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa bstan zin to //
translated: The immeasurable has been explained.

original: da ni tshad med pa brjod par bya ba ni sems tsan gyi khams kyi tshad ji tsam zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: da ni tshad med pa brjod par bya ba ni sems tsan gyi khams kyi tshad ji tsam zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Now, the immeasurable should be stated. When it is asked, “What is the measure of the realm of mind alone?,”

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi tshad ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yul ni rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi tshad ji tsam pa de tsam mo zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yul ni rnam pa lnga'i bdag nyid de /
translated: it is said, “It is just the measure of the domain of the Buddha.” The domain of the Buddha has the nature of five aspects.

original: de yang so sor yongs su ma chad cing tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang so sor yongs su ma chad cing tshad med pa yin no //
translated: And that is not individually differentiated and is immeasurable.

original: de bas na sems can gyi khams tshad med pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi khams tshad med pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable.

original: khams lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: khams lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five realms?

original: sems can gyi khams rnam pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang / gdul bya'i khams dang / gdul bya'i thabs kyi khams so //🔽gal te dpag tu med pa nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid la tha dad @18a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnam pa thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang / gdul bya'i khams dang / gdul bya'i thabs kyi khams so // gal te dpag tu med pa nyid dang / tshad med pa nyid la tha dad @18a * //
translated: the realm of sentient beings, the realm of the world, the realm of the teaching, the realm of those to be trained, and the realm of the means of training.

original: du byar ci yod /
analyzed: du byar ci yod /
translated: If the realm of sentient beings is immeasurable and limitless, what is the difference between immeasurable and limitless?

original: gang gis na gnyis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na gnyis bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are two terms used?

original: de bzhin nyid la ni ci yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ni ci yang med do //
translated: In reality, there is nothing at all.

original: gzhan du ni tha dad pa nyid yod de 'di ltar /
analyzed: gzhan du ni tha dad pa nyid yod de 'di ltar /
translated: But in conventional usage, there is a difference.

original: sems can ji snyed yod ces bya ba ni rdzas 'di ji snyed cig la sems can zhes tha snyad 'dogs /🔽cig cig la 'am /
analyzed: sems can ji snyed yod ces bya ba ni rdzas 'di ji snyed cig la sems can zhes tha snyad 'dogs / cig cig la 'am /
translated: To the extent that there are sentient beings, to that extent there is the conventional usage of the term sentient being.

original: 'on te gnyis la 'am /🔽'on te mang po la gang gi tshe phung po lnga la 'jig rten zhes brjod na 'jig rten dang sems can don tha dad pa med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis la 'am / 'on te mang po la gang gi tshe phung po lnga la 'jig rten zhes brjod na 'jig rten dang sems can don tha dad pa med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Is it used for one or for two or for many?🔽When the world is said to be the five aggregates, the world and sentient beings are said to be synonymous.

original: sems can zhes brjod par bya ba phung po lngar dpag tu yod pa'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: sems can zhes brjod par bya ba phung po lngar dpag tu yod pa'i tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: To the extent that the term sentient being is used, to that extent the five aggregates are measured. What is the measure?

original: dper na 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi tshad ni khru phyed dang khru bzhi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi tshad ni khru phyed dang khru bzhi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the size of the humans of Jambudvipa is four cubits, half a cubit, and so on.

original: yul 'di lta bu la ni dpag pa'i sgra sbyar bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul 'di lta bu la ni dpag pa'i sgra sbyar bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not appropriate to apply the term parimaṇḍala to such a place.

original: 'dir ni 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pas sems can gyi khams kyi tshad shes par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'jig rten gyi khams la sogs pas sems can gyi khams kyi tshad shes par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the realm of sentient beings is to be understood as the realm of the world systems and so on.

original: tshad med pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshad med pa bstan zin to //
translated: The measure of the realm of sentient beings has already been explained as immeasurable.

original: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las ni thog mar tshad med pa de'i 'og tu dpag tu med pa phyis mtha' med pa 'byung la //
analyzed: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las ni thog mar tshad med pa de'i 'og tu dpag tu med pa phyis mtha' med pa 'byung la //
translated: In the Twenty-five Thousand and other sūtras, first it is immeasurable, then it is immeasurable, and finally it is limitless.

original: 'dir go rims bzlog pa ni snga phyir mngon par zhen pa bsal ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir go rims bzlog pa ni snga phyir mngon par zhen pa bsal ba'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the order is reversed in order to eliminate attachment to sequence.

original: de ltar yang nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las kyang /
analyzed: de ltar yang nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las kyang /
translated: Thus, in the Twenty-five Thousand and so on, and in the Ornament of Clear Realization,

original: bden pa'i rnam pa go rims bzhin du bstan te /
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam pa go rims bzhin du bstan te /
translated: the aspects of the truths are taught in order.

original: de ni brgyad dang bdun dang lnga //
analyzed: de ni brgyad dang bdun dang lnga //
translated: They are eight, seven, and five.

original: bcu drug tu ni bstan pa ste //
analyzed: bcu drug tu ni bstan pa ste //
translated: They are taught to be sixteen.

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa dag la go rims bzhin //🔽'dir yang 'og nas yul gcig na //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa dag la go rims bzhin // 'dir yang 'og nas yul gcig na // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya //
translated: They are cause, path, suffering, and cessation, respectively.🔽Here, too, it will be clearly shown that there is no order, as it will be said below:🔽“In one place, the Bhagavat Buddha,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims med pa bzhin du gsal bar ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas go rims med pa bzhin du gsal bar ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on.

original: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ston par byed de /
analyzed: da ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa ston par byed de /
translated: Now, it is shown that one abides in the perfection of wisdom:

original: yang la la zhig 'di skad du sems can gyi khams gang du gtogs zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du de'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang la la zhig 'di skad du sems can gyi khams gang du gtogs zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam pa thams cad du de'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa yin nam /
translated: If someone asks, “To which realm of sentient beings does one belong?” and so on, is it the nature of that which is in every way the self?

original: gang du gtogs she na /
analyzed: gang du gtogs she na /
translated: Or to which does one belong?

original: 'dir lan ni skye ba med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag tu gtogs par gtogs so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lan ni skye ba med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag tu gtogs par gtogs so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Here, the answer is that one belongs to the inconceivable realm of the unborn.

original: skye ba med pa dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The unborn is non-entity.

original: bsam @18b gyis mi khyab pa ni rnam par rig par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam @18b gyis mi khyab pa ni rnam par rig par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable is not even to be known.

original: tshul de lta bu'i skye ba med pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni gang du yang gtogs pa med do //
analyzed: tshul de lta bu'i skye ba med pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni gang du yang gtogs pa med do //
translated: Such non-production and inconceivability are not included anywhere.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid sems can gyi khams kyang gang du yang gtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid sems can gyi khams kyang gang du yang gtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The sentient beings’ realm, which has the characteristic of being not different from that, is also not included anywhere. This is the meaning.

original: sems can gyi khams ci la gnas zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba ni gnas gang la zhe 'am /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ci la gnas zhes 'dri na zhes bya ba ni gnas gang la zhe 'am /
translated: When it is asked, “In what does the sentient beings’ realm abide?” it is asking, “In what abode?

original: dmigs pa gang la gnas shing 'dug ci la gnas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la gnas shing 'dug ci la gnas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In what objective support does it abide and remain?”

original: 'dir lan ni skye ba med pa'i khams ci la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lan ni skye ba med pa'i khams ci la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Here the answer is, “In what does the realm of non-production abide?” and so forth.

original: skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi khams ni skye ba med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid kyi khams ni skye ba med pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm that has the nature of non-production is the realm of non-production.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni bstan zin to //
translated: Its characteristic has already been explained.

original: de dag dngos po med pa nyid kyis na gang la yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dngos po med pa nyid kyis na gang la yang gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they do not exist as things, they do not abide anywhere.

original: sems can gyi khams de yang mtshan nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams de yang mtshan nyid gcig ste /
translated: And that realm of sentient beings has one characteristic,

original: gang la yang gnas pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang la yang gnas pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that it does not abide anywhere.

original: 'jam dpal khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mañjuśrī, when you cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad shes pa 'am shes pa'i mchog ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad shes pa 'am shes pa'i mchog ni shes rab bo //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects or supreme knowledge is wisdom.

original: shes rab de mchog nyid dang / dam pa'i dngos po dang / phul du byung ba nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab de mchog nyid dang / dam pa'i dngos po dang / phul du byung ba nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That wisdom is supreme, the highest thing, and the most excellent, which is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: nges pa'i tshig 'di ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig 'di ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: This etymology is itself reasonable,

original: skyon med pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i phyir dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is faultless and because it is taught by the Blessed One.

original: brgyad stong pa las kyang /🔽bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: brgyad stong pa las kyang / bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni shes rab bo //
translated: And in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines it says,🔽“Blessed One, that which is inconceivable is wisdom.

original: mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa de shes rab yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu bsam gyis mi khyab pa de shes rab yin te /
translated: That which is supremely inconceivable is wisdom.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su sngo bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one that dedicates all roots of virtue to omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab de mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun dga' bo de bas na shes rab de mchog nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Ānanda, therefore, because that wisdom is supreme,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it obtains the name of perfection.

original: 'di ltar shes rab 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags par sgro 'dogs par mi byed cing chos thams cad ma skyes pa la chags pa dang bral zhing rtog pa'i ngo bo thams cad bcom pa don dam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab 'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun brtags par sgro 'dogs par mi byed cing chos thams cad ma skyes pa la chags pa dang bral zhing rtog pa'i ngo bo thams cad bcom pa don dam pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this wisdom does not superimpose the imagined on the unreal, and it is free from attachment to the non-arising of all phenomena, and it conquers all conceptual natures. It is the ultimate.

original: de las gzhan pa yod pa ma yin pa'i don can gyi shes rab las phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir @19a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yod pa ma yin pa'i don can gyi shes rab las phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir @19a * //
translated: Because it is superior to wisdom that has a meaning other than that,

original: mchog yin no //
analyzed: mchog yin no //
translated: it is supreme.

original: 'dis yongs su zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: 'dis yongs su zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa yang /
translated: And the generosity and so on that are possessed by this [wisdom]

original: des yongs su ma zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa las mchog yin no //
analyzed: des yongs su ma zin pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa las mchog yin no //
translated: are supreme compared to generosity and so on that are not possessed by it.

original: mchog yin pa'i phyir yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob pa yin te kun mchog yin no //
analyzed: mchog yin pa'i phyir yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming 'thob pa yin te kun mchog yin no //
translated: It is also called perfection because it is supreme.🔽At that time, with respect to what does one abide?

original: de'i tshe ci la gnas te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gang la sems 'dug ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ci la gnas te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa gang la sems 'dug ces bya ba'o //
translated: This means, with respect to what object does the mind rest?

original: bdag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de'i tshe /
translated: When I cultivate the perfection of wisdom,🔽at that time I cultivate the perfection of wisdom without abiding.

original: mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni gang la gnas shing gang gis ji ltar de bsgom par 'gyur ba'i gnas par bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma
analyzed: mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni gang la gnas shing gang gis ji ltar de bsgom par 'gyur ba'i gnas par bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma
translated: This means that in the perfection of wisdom, there is nothing at all that abides, by which, and in which it would be cultivated,

original: yin te / chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all phenomena are utterly unborn.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of the perfection of wisdom is non-attachment.

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig la gnas pa yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig la gnas pa yod na ni /
translated: If one were to abide in something,

original: de'i tshe log pa'i shes pa yin pas /
analyzed: de'i tshe log pa'i shes pa yin pas /
translated: at that time it would be a distorted cognition.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could there be meditation on the perfection of wisdom?

original: don 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify this point,

original: 'jam dpal mi gnas pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom du yang ci yod ces dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal mi gnas pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom du yang ci yod ces dris so //
translated: [Subhūti] asks, Mañjuśrī, what is there to meditate on the perfection of wisdom for one who does not abide?

original: 'dis ni 'khor gyi nang du 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te dngos po goms par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'khor gyi nang du 'di skad bstan te / gal te dngos po goms par bya ba 'am /
translated: This is taught in the assembly:

original: bsgom par bya ba de la sems rgyun du ma bzhag na ji ltar bsgoms pa yin zhes bya ba yin no /🔽// / bam po gnyis pa //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba de la sems rgyun du ma bzhag na ji ltar bsgoms pa yin zhes bya ba yin no / // / bam po gnyis pa //
translated: If one does not continuously settle the mind on that thing to be cultivated or meditated upon, how can it be meditation?

original: 'jam dpal gyis kyang gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis kyang gang ci la yang mi gnas pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Mañjuśrī also says, That which does not abide anywhere... and so on. This is taught:

original: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang ci la yang mi gnas pa nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: That which does not abide anywhere is the perfection of wisdom, characterized by non-attachment.

original: mi gnas pa las gzhan du bsgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa las gzhan du bsgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no meditation other than non-abiding.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bstan zin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bstan zin te /
translated: The teaching on abiding in the perfection of wisdom has been completed.

original: 'di nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who abides in this is certain for buddhahood.

original: len pa med pa dang gtong ba med pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: len pa med pa dang gtong ba med pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: The absence of appropriation and the absence of relinquishment, etc. should be stated.

original: de'i tshe khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i tshe khyod gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de'i tshe /
translated: At that time, when you cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: khyod kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / lam gyi @19b sgras de las gzhan pa dag 'bri zhing 'grib par 'gyur zhes bya bar blta'o //🔽lan ni de'i tshe bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba 'am /
analyzed: khyod kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / lam gyi @19b sgras de las gzhan pa dag 'bri zhing 'grib par 'gyur zhes bya bar blta'o // lan ni de'i tshe bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba 'am /
translated: at that time, you should see that your roots of virtue, such as the perfections, increase and expand, while the other paths decrease and diminish.

original: 'bri bar 'gyur ba ci yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bri bar 'gyur ba ci yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The reply is: At that time, there is no increase or decrease of my roots of virtue at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba dang mi dge ba zad ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang 'gal ba med kyi /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba dang mi dge ba zad ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dang 'gal ba med kyi /
translated: The increase of roots of virtue and the exhaustion of non-virtue are not incompatible with the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir ni yongs su len pa dang gtong ba'i bsam pa la dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni yongs su len pa dang gtong ba'i bsam pa la dgongs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the intention is with regard to the thought of taking up and giving up.

original: rlom pa'i bdag nyid pas na bsgom pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlom pa'i bdag nyid pas na bsgom pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of conceit, it is incompatible with meditation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don 'di nyid 'og nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don 'di nyid 'og nas /
translated: For this very reason, this meaning is taught below,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang la chos 'ga' zhig 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang la chos 'ga' zhig 'phel ba dang 'grib pa mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par byed do //
translated: in the passage beginning, “Blessed One, for one who has the idea that some dharma increases or decreases. . . ”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig 'phel ba 'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'ga' zhig 'phel ba 'am /
translated: For one who has the idea that some dharma such as generosity increases,

original: ser sna la sogs pa bri'o zhes gang la bsam pa yod pa de la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa bri'o zhes gang la bsam pa yod pa de la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgom pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: or that stinginess and so on decreases, there is no meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Why is that? For that reason, it is said,

original: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “That is not the meditation on the perfection of wisdom. . . ”

original: gang la chos 'ga'i dngos po 'phel ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gang la chos 'ga'i dngos po 'phel ba'i phyir ram /
translated: For one who has the idea that some dharma increases or decreases,

original: 'bri ba'i phyir nye bar gnas shing 'jug pa de ni sgom pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bri ba'i phyir nye bar gnas shing 'jug pa de ni sgom pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is present and engaged in order to write is to be known as not meditation.

original: de ltar 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa sgom pa las log par bstan nas sgom pa dang rjes su mthun pa rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa sgom pa las log par bstan nas sgom pa dang rjes su mthun pa rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the opposite of meditation, which has the quality of contradiction, in order to teach the concordance with meditation, the concordance, he says:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mi spong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mi spong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Bhagavan, it is not the case that they do not abandon the qualities of ordinary beings, and so on.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa mi spong mi sel la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dod chags la sogs pa mi spong mi sel la /
translated: They do not abandon, do not remove, the qualities of ordinary beings, such as attachment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa mi len mi 'dzin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos stobs la sogs pa mi len mi 'dzin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: They do not take up, do not grasp, the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers. That is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de ltar len pa med pa dang gtong ba med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni de ltar len pa med pa dang gtong ba med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: Thinking, “What is the reason for not taking up and not abandoning?”

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the reason,🔽he says:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas chos gang la spang ba 'am blang bar bya /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ngo bor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas chos gang la spang ba 'am blang bar bya /
translated: Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.

original: blang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba ni skyon @20a * //🔽dang yon tan mthong ba las 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blang ba la sogs par 'gyur ba ni skyon @20a * // dang yon tan mthong ba las 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa 'di ni skyon dang yon tan gnyis mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa 'di ni skyon dang yon tan gnyis mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.

original: gtang ba 'am gzung ba gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gtang ba 'am gzung ba gar yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.🔽Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti, thus, the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of all dharmas.

original: de nyid kyi gtan tshigs bsdu bar bcom ldan 'das gang 'khor ba'i skyon du yang mi mchi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi gtan tshigs bsdu bar bcom ldan 'das gang 'khor ba'i skyon du yang mi mchi la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Subhūti, it is so.🔽Subhūti,

original: gang 'khor ba'i skyon 'dod chags la sogs pas byas pa skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pas byas pa rnams su mi mchi zhing mi sems pa
analyzed: gang 'khor ba'i skyon 'dod chags la sogs pas byas pa skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs bsgoms pas byas pa rnams su mi mchi zhing mi sems pa
translated: It is not the case that the faults of cyclic existence, such as attachment, and so on, and birth, aging, death, and so on, and the qualities of nirvana, such as the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on, are not made by cultivating the factors of enlightenment.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: That is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba de ni de nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhes dogs pa la bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'khor ba nyid kyang re zhig mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba de ni de nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhes dogs pa la bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar 'khor ba nyid kyang re zhig mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Why is that? That is asking, “Why is that?” The Bhagavān said, “Thus, cyclic existence itself is not seen at all, and nirvana itself is not apprehended at all.”

original: 'khor ba nyid kyang re zhig ces bya ba ni skyon la ltos te /
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid kyang re zhig ces bya ba ni skyon la ltos te /
translated: “Cyclic existence itself is not seen at all” is in terms of faults.

original: re zhig mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig mi mthong ba'o //
translated: “At all” means not seen at all.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyang re zhig mi dmigs na zhes bya ba 'dir yang re zhig ces bya ba'i rim pa ni yon tan la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyang re zhig mi dmigs na zhes bya ba 'dir yang re zhig ces bya ba'i rim pa ni yon tan la ltos pa'o //
translated: “Nirvana itself is not apprehended at all” is in terms of qualities.

original: de dag ni rang gis mi dmigs pa'i don la nye bar gtod pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni rang gis mi dmigs pa'i don la nye bar gtod pa yin te /
translated: They are directed to the meaning of non-apprehension by them.

original: de'i ched du bris pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ched du bris pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are written for that purpose.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang blang ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang blang ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The statement, “Bhagavat, in regard to any dharma, there is no taking up or…” and so on, is the conclusion.🔽In regard to any Buddha-dharma, there is no taking up or grasping.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la yang blang ba 'am gzung ba zhes bya ba la tha dad pa 'ga' zhig gis blang ba ni blang ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la yang blang ba 'am gzung ba zhes bya ba la tha dad pa 'ga' zhig gis blang ba ni blang ba'o //
translated: Taking up is the taking up of something different.

original: tha dad pa med par de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni gzung ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med par de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni gzung ba ste /
translated: Grasping is the becoming of the very same thing.

original: blang ba dang gzung ba gnyis lhan cig tu smos pa'i phyir don de ltar dbye'o //
analyzed: blang ba dang gzung ba gnyis lhan cig tu smos pa'i phyir don de ltar dbye'o //
translated: The meaning is to be distinguished in this way because both taking up and grasping are mentioned together.

original: lam gyi sgra ni thams cad du phan tshun ltos pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi sgra ni thams cad du phan tshun ltos pa'o //
translated: The word “path” is used everywhere in the sense of mutual dependence.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dor zhing nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos 'dor zhing nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is the renunciation of the dharmas of the common man and the going forth.

original: ma mchis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma mchis zhes bya ba ni thams cad du sbyar ro //
translated: “There is no” is to be supplied in all cases.

original: blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa la sogs pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa la sogs pa bstan zin to //
translated: The teaching of no taking up and no putting down, etc. has been completed.

original: da ni byams pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni byams pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, love and so on and emptiness should be explained.

original: tshad med pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid de yang ji lta ba bzhin du mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad med pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid de yang ji lta ba bzhin du mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And in order to properly summarize the immeasurables and so on and emptiness,

original: bcom @20b ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang 'grib pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom @20b ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang 'grib pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Bhagavān said, “Bhagavān, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is when one does not apprehend the decrease or increase of any dharma.”

original: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang la sogs pa dang lta bas byas pa dag 'grib cing zad pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid sgom pa rnams 'phel zhing lhag par rgyas par gyur pa'i dngos po gang mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: chos gang la yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhe sdang la sogs pa dang lta bas byas pa dag 'grib cing zad pa dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa dang / stong pa nyid sgom pa rnams 'phel zhing lhag par rgyas par gyur pa'i dngos po gang mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: “Any dharma” means that one does not apprehend the decrease and exhaustion of one’s antidotes, such as anger and so on and the views, and the increase and expansion of the cultivation of the immeasurables and so on and emptiness.

original: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la 'grib pa dang 'phel ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la 'grib pa dang 'phel ba ma mchis pa'i slad du'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore the Bhagavān said, “Because nonarising does not decrease or increase.”

original: skye ba ma mchis pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Non-arising is thusness.

original: de la ni 'grib ba med 'phel ba med de /
analyzed: de la ni 'grib ba med 'phel ba med de /
translated: There is no decrease in it, no increase.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin du 'dug pa'i phyir dang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin du 'dug pa'i phyir dang 'dus ma byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it remains just as it is at all times and because it is unconditioned.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'grib pa med la gnyen po 'phel ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'grib pa med la gnyen po 'phel ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no decrease of the counteragent and no increase of the adverse factors.

original: 'gog pa la yang mi rtog pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa la yang mi rtog pas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that there is no conceptualization even in cessation, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Bhagavan, if there is no conceptualization of any dharma whatsoever,

original: rnam par bya ba'i chos skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'gag par rlom pa de lta bu yang sgom pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: rnam par bya ba'i chos skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa 'gag par rlom pa de lta bu yang sgom pa gang la yod pa ma yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: that meditation on the perfection of wisdom is the meditation in which there is no conceptualization of the cessation of the dharma of arising and the affliction of affliction.

original: de ltar gang gis dngos por rtog pa bsal nas 'bras bu la rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gis dngos por rtog pa bsal nas 'bras bu la rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having eliminated the conceptualization of entities, in order to eliminate the conceptualization of the result, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang ji ltar rang gi gnas ngan len dang / de'i kun tu rmongs pa rnams 'grib ba'am rnam par byang ba'i yon tan rnams rgyas par mi bgyid cing bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar sgom zhing sems bskyed pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang ji ltar rang gi gnas ngan len dang / de'i kun tu rmongs pa rnams 'grib ba'am rnam par byang ba'i yon tan rnams rgyas par mi bgyid cing bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar sgom zhing sems bskyed pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: Blessed One, when one does not increase the faults of one's own bad tendencies and the obscurations of those qualities that are purified, and when one cultivates in that way, Blessed One, that generation of mind is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar rgyun du sems bskyed pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du sems bskyed pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: That very generation of mind in that way is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshad med pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid bstan zin to //
analyzed: tshad med pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid bstan zin to //
translated: The immeasurables and so on and the teaching of emptiness have already been explained.

original: da ni sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa brjod pa ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Now, in order to explain the attainment of buddhahood, [the text] says Furthermore, Blessed One, when a bodhisattva great being... and so on.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin pa de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yin te @21a * //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos gang yin pa de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yin te @21a * //
translated: Those qualities of a buddha such as the powers and fearlessnesses are inconceivable qualities.

original: bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they cannot be conceived.

original: nyi tshe ba'i so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos yin te nyi tsher zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos yin te nyi tsher zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the Dharma of the limited individual and of the śrāvaka, etc., because it is engaged in the limited.

original: mi smon pa ni 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi smon pa ni 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: Non-aspiration is the absence of desire.

original: nyi tshe ba smos pa ni mi smon pas khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi tshe ba smos pa ni mi smon pas khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the limited is for the purpose of teaching the distinction of non-aspiration.

original: de ni gnyis kar rtog pa dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i lam bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyis kar rtog pa dang bral ba'i dbu ma'i lam bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the middle way, free from the duality of conceptual thought.

original: tshig gi zla bstan pa kun la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi zla bstan pa kun la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for all the teachings of the moon of the words.

original: mi smon pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi smon pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Non-aspiration is also of three kinds:

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang le lo yod pa'i phyir dang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyir dang le lo yod pa'i phyir dang mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no need, because there is laziness, and because one is incapable.

original: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das gang la smon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa tha ma nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das gang la smon pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa tha ma nyid bstan te /
translated: However, the Blessed One, in regard to what is aspired for... and so on, teaches the final kind.

original: de yang mchog yin pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid ni gtso bo dam pa bya dka' ba mtha' yas pa shin tu 'bad pas smon cing btsal bar bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang mchog yin pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid ni gtso bo dam pa bya dka' ba mtha' yas pa shin tu 'bad pas smon cing btsal bar bya ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is supreme, there is no buddhahood which is the highest goal, which is to be sought and striven for by means of infinite difficult practices and great effort.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gang gis dang ji ltar gang gi don du smon pa yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gang gis dang ji ltar gang gi don du smon pa yang rig par bya ste /
translated: The word also indicates that the one who aspires, the manner in which he aspires, and the goal for the sake of which he aspires, should be understood.

original: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir smon cing btsal byar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir smon cing btsal byar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they do not exist, they cannot be sought and striven for.

original: de ltar bsgoms na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: If one meditates in this way, it is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob pa bstan zin to //
translated: The attainment of buddhahood has been explained.

original: de ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad bsdu ba brjod par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mchog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
