analyzed: de ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad bsdu ba brjod par bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mchog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Now, in order to explain the inclusion of all the elements of purification, it is said that the Blessed One declared that the meditation on the perfection of wisdom is as follows: These dharmas are supreme, etc.

original: nye bar mi gnas shing zhes bya ba ni mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi gnas shing zhes bya ba ni mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Not present means not engaged.

original: de ston pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang stong pa nyid dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni mchog go //
analyzed: de ston pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang stong pa nyid dang byang chub kyi phyogs dang tshad med pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni mchog go //
translated: The teaching of that is as follows: “These dharmas, the perfections, emptiness, the elements leading to enlightenment, the immeasurables, etc., are supreme.

original: ser sna dang tshul khrims 'chal ba dang gnod sems dang le lo la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni tha ma'o zhes de ltar mchog dang tha ma yin par rtog pas mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna dang tshul khrims 'chal ba dang gnod sems dang le lo la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag ni tha ma'o zhes de ltar mchog dang tha ma yin par rtog pas mi gnas pa'o //
translated: These dharmas, stinginess, immorality, malice, laziness, etc., are inferior.” In this way, one does not abide in the conception of what is supreme and what is inferior.

original: de ltar ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci'i phyir yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir chos gang dag mchog dang tha mar gyur pa'i chos de dag kyang mi dmigs te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gang dag mchog dang tha mar gyur pa'i chos de dag kyang mi dmigs te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, those dharmas that are supreme and inferior are also not apprehended.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mchog gang dag bla na med pa'i don 'dren par byed pas na mchog go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mchog gang dag bla na med pa'i don 'dren par byed pas na mchog go //
translated: Those perfections, etc., that are supreme are supreme because they lead to the meaning of the unsurpassed.

original: ngan song la sogs pa 'dren par byed pas na ser sna la sogs pa ni tha @21b ma'o zhes chos de la yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ngan song la sogs pa 'dren par byed pas na ser sna la sogs pa ni tha @21b ma'o zhes chos de la yang mi dmigs so //
translated: Stinginess, etc., are inferior because they lead to the lower realms, etc. In this way, those dharmas are also not apprehended.

original: de ltar rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos mi dmigs pas mchog nyid dang / tha ma nyid du mi rtog pa gang yin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor ting nge 'dzin la rjes su gtad de ;
analyzed: de ltar rnam par byang ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos mi dmigs pas mchog nyid dang / tha ma nyid du mi rtog pa gang yin pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor ting nge 'dzin la rjes su gtad de ;
translated: Thus, the yoga of cultivating the perfection of wisdom, which is not conceptualizing the best and the worst, because of not observing the phenomena of complete purification and affliction, is entrusted to meditative stabilization.

original: brtson zhing ma bral ba'i rigs kyi bu ni chos thams cad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: brtson zhing ma bral ba'i rigs kyi bu ni chos thams cad mi dmigs so //
translated: The son of good lineage who is diligent and not separated from it does not observe any phenomena.🔽It is taught that by being taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, since all aspects of complete purification are taken hold of, all the perfections, emptiness, the immeasurables, the factors of enlightenment, and so forth are taken hold of.

original: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad yongs su zin par bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid dang tshad med pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa yongs su zin pa yin no zhes 'byung ba dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: des rnam par byang ba'i phyogs thams cad yongs su zin par bstan pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid dang tshad med pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa yongs su zin pa yin no zhes 'byung ba dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: This is consistent with that.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bzung ba bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad yongs su bzung ba bstan zin to //
translated: The taking hold of all phenomena of complete purification has been taught.

original: da ni mngon par zhen pa'i nad thams cad 'joms par byed pa brjod pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni chos gang la gang mchog ce 'am tha ma zhes mi rtog go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni mngon par zhen pa'i nad thams cad 'joms par byed pa brjod pa'i ched du bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni chos gang la gang mchog ce 'am tha ma zhes mi rtog go zhes gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to state the remedy that conquers all the diseases of adherence, the Lord said, “The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom does not conceive of any dharma as either supreme or inferior.”

original: mngon par zhen pa'i nad ces bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i nad ces bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is called the “disease of adherence?”

original: srid pa dang / longs spyod kyi dngos po phyi nang gi chos la tha ma dang / mchog tu lta bas kun tu zhen cing chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang / longs spyod kyi dngos po phyi nang gi chos la tha ma dang / mchog tu lta bas kun tu zhen cing chags pa ni mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Adherence is the attachment and clinging that views internal and external things as either supreme or inferior.

original: de nyid yun ring por dbyen dang rtsod pa dang 'gyed pa dang mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / ser sna la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir nad do //
analyzed: de nyid yun ring por dbyen dang rtsod pa dang 'gyed pa dang mi mthun pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / ser sna la sogs pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir nad do //
translated: It is a disease because it generates the harm of dissension, dispute, and discord for a long time, and because it generates stinginess and so on.

original: de thams cad 'joms par byed cing gtan nas 'byin pa ni mchog nyid dang tha ma nyid du mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang gzhan dag kyang de la 'god par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad 'joms par byed cing gtan nas 'byin pa ni mchog nyid dang tha ma nyid du mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang gzhan dag kyang de la 'god par byed pa yin no //
translated: The supreme, which destroys all of that and completely removes it, is the perfection of wisdom, which is the non-conceptualization of supreme and inferior, and also establishing others in that.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi rtog pa de nyid gtan tshigs gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi rtog pa de nyid gtan tshigs gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is that? means By what reason is that non-conceptualization?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das skye ba ma mchis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, It is because of non-arising, etc.

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos thams cad kyi bar la yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / chos thams cad kyi bar la yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Up to suchness, the limit of reality, and all dharmas means

original: bar la zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan dag kyang gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar la zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam grangs gzhan dag kyang gzung ngo //
translated: the word up to includes other synonyms of the unconditioned.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang ma skyes pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni phyi dang nang ma skyes pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: All dharmas means external and internal, the nature of non-arising.

original: de la @22a * //
analyzed: de la @22a * //
translated: In that,

original: mchog dang tha ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog dang tha ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: there is no supreme or inferior, that is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bsgoms na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bsgoms na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, when one meditates in this way, one meditates on the perfection of wisdom. This is the conclusion.

original: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa zhib brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa zhib brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the attachment to nirvana should be stated.

original: de skad ces gsol ba dang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba ni rnam pa snga ma de lta bu la bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol ba dang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ba ni rnam pa snga ma de lta bu la bya'o //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said, ... In this, thus refers to the previous form.

original: gsol pa zhes bya ba ni smras pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa zhes bya ba ni smras pa'o //
translated: The word said means spoken.

original: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase thus have I heard refers to what follows.

original: bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o ;
analyzed: bka' stsal to zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o ;
translated: The word said means spoken.

original: /'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: /'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bya ba sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: O Manjusri, the so-called dharmas of the Buddha are the dharmas of the Buddha's own nature, which are superior in every way to the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: gtso bo mchog ma yin nam zhes tshig zur gyis dris pa dang 'dir lan ni /
analyzed: gtso bo mchog ma yin nam zhes tshig zur gyis dris pa dang 'dir lan ni /
translated: The question is asked indirectly, Is not the principal one supreme?

original: bzung du ma mchis pa'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni mchog lags so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bzung du ma mchis pa'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni mchog lags so zhes gsol to //
translated: The answer is, Because they are not apprehended, the qualities of a buddha are supreme.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i gnas la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / de med na med pa yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang mi mnga'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i gnas la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / de med na med pa yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang mi mnga'o //
translated: Because of not having the discrimination of apprehending in the case of the basis of engagement and disengagement, and because of the absence of the discrimination of the apprehender when that is absent,

original: de bas na de dag ni kun rdzob tu mchog yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni kun rdzob tu mchog yin no //
translated: therefore they are supreme conventionally.

original: don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: But not ultimately,

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad stong par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: because of the statement by the Lord, “All phenomena are empty,” and so on.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All phenomena” are form and so on.

original: stong par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'o//
analyzed: stong par zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'o//
translated: “Empty” means devoid of essence.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa lags sam zhes bya ba la mngon sum du mtshan nyid gcig nyid du mnyam zhing tha mi dad par mkhyen te /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa lags sam zhes bya ba la mngon sum du mtshan nyid gcig nyid du mnyam zhing tha mi dad par mkhyen te /
translated: When this was said, the Lord said to Manjusri, So it is, so it is!🔽 And Manjusri said to the Lord, Lord, is there emptiness higher or lower,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa lags sam /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa lags sam /
translated: or is there emptiness higher or lower?🔽 And the Lord said to Manjusri, There is no emptiness higher or lower,🔽 but there is emptiness higher and lower.

original: de skad zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de de bzhin te zhes zhal gyis bzhes so //🔽'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das stong pa nyid la mchog gam /
analyzed: de skad zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de de bzhin te zhes zhal gyis bzhes so // 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das stong pa nyid la mchog gam /
translated: And the Lord, pleased with this explanation of the truth, said to Manjusri, Excellent, excellent, Manjusri!🔽 And Manjusri said to the Lord, Lord, is there emptiness higher or lower,🔽 or is there emptiness higher or lower?🔽 And the Lord said to Manjusri, There is no emptiness higher or lower,

original: tha ma zhes bgyi ba mchis sam zhes dri ba nyid lan du smras pa yin te /🔽stong pa nyid la mchog dang tha ma mchis sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris pa ni de gnyi @22b ga yang mchis pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha ma zhes bgyi ba mchis sam zhes dri ba nyid lan du smras pa yin te / stong pa nyid la mchog dang tha ma mchis sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris pa ni de gnyi @22b ga yang mchis pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but there is emptiness higher and lower.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang rigs pa smras pas dgyes nas 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang rigs pa smras pas dgyes nas 'jam dpal legs so legs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: And the Lord, pleased with this explanation of the truth, said to Manjusri, Excellent, excellent, Manjusri!🔽 And Manjusri said to the Lord, Lord, is there emptiness higher or lower,🔽 or is there emptiness higher or lower?🔽 And the Lord said to Manjusri, There is no emptiness higher or lower,🔽 but there is emptiness higher and lower.

original: 'jam dpal de de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de de bzhin te /
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is just as you have said.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zhal gyis bzhes pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni zhal gyis bzhes pa ste /
translated: This is his assent, saying, It is just as you have said.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //🔽gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin no zhes bstan nas de'i bag la nyal dang bral ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no // gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang dag pa ma yin par sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yin no zhes bstan nas de'i bag la nyal dang bral ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not otherwise.🔽 Having taught that the qualities of the Buddha are free from the conceptual thought that falsely exaggerates the apprehended object and apprehending subject, in order to teach the freedom from the latent propensities for that, he said, Mañjuśrī, are the qualities of the Buddha unsurpassed?

original: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bla na med pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bla na med pa yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di las gzhan mchog dam pa khyad par du 'phags pa med pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan mchog dam pa khyad par du 'phags pa med pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing higher, more excellent, or superior to this, it is unsurpassed.

original: dris pa dang 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba de de lta lags te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dris pa dang 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba de de lta lags te zhes gsungs te /
translated: When asked this, Mañjuśrī replied, Yes, it is so,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bla na med pa nyid lags kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bla na med pa nyid lags kyi /
translated: saying, The qualities of the Buddha are indeed unsurpassed,🔽 but nothing else is.

original: de las gzhan ni ma lags so zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni ma lags so zhes zhal gyis bzhes pa gsungs so //
translated: This is his assent.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: “Bhagavān, it is because those dharmas of the Tathāgata do not exist in the least, do not exist at all.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos de dag la bag chags kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos cung zad tsam dang phra mo tsam yang ma mchis shing mchis pa ma lags so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid kyi chos de dag la bag chags kyi mtshan nyid kyi chos cung zad tsam dang phra mo tsam yang ma mchis shing mchis pa ma lags so //
translated: Those dharmas of the nature of the Buddha do not exist in the least, do not exist at all, in the manner of imprints.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs te /
translated: Therefore, they are not apprehended.

original: rig par byar med do //
analyzed: rig par byar med do //
translated: They are not to be known.

original: rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba'i gnas skabs lta re zhig ring du zhog gi / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la de'i bag chags kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rgyu ba'i gnas skabs lta re zhig ring du zhog gi / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la de'i bag chags kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don yin no //
translated: Leave aside for a while the situation in which conceptualization operates—the meaning of the word “even” is that not even the imprints of those dharmas exist in the Buddha’s dharmas.

original: des na sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa de dag kun rdzob tu mchog nyid dang / bla na med pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kyi chos bla na med pa de dag kun rdzob tu mchog nyid dang / bla na med pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: Therefore, those unsurpassed Buddha dharmas are the supreme and unsurpassed conventional truth, the basis for the attachment to nirvāṇa.

original: yang dag par ni stong pa nyid la mchog dang tha ma nyid yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par ni stong pa nyid la mchog dang tha ma nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, in reality, emptiness does not have any high or low.

original: bla na med pa nyid dang / gong ma dang bcas pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa nyid dang / gong ma dang bcas pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa zhi ba yin no //
translated: Since there is no unsurpassed and no higher, the attachment to nirvana is pacified.

original: da ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la brtson pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sgrub pa'i @23a * //
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa la sogs pa brjod par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa la brtson pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams sgrub pa'i @23a * //
translated: Now, the Buddha’s teachings, etc., should be stated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la srung ba dang skyob pa dang sba ba mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la srung ba dang skyob pa dang sba ba mdzad do //
translated: The Bhagavān Buddhas protect, guard, and conceal the bodhisattvas who are diligent in cultivating the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la srung ba ni sgom pa 'phel ba dang / yongs su mi nyams par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de la srung ba ni sgom pa 'phel ba dang / yongs su mi nyams par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Therein, protection is the non-degeneration and increase of cultivation.

original: skyob pa ni pha rol gyi gnod pa las skyob pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa ni pha rol gyi gnod pa las skyob pa'o //
translated: Guarding is the protection from harm by others.

original: sba ba ni theg pa dman par 'phro zhing g-yeng ba med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sba ba ni theg pa dman par 'phro zhing g-yeng ba med par byed pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the prevention of distraction into the lower vehicle.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams spangs nas theg pa dman pa las 'das te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams spangs nas theg pa dman pa las 'das te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has abandoned the qualities of ordinary beings and gone beyond the Lesser Vehicle

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob par mdzad cing /🔽sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad do zhes gang la kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag mi 'byung ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin no zhes ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams thob par mdzad cing / sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad do zhes gang la kun rdzob kyi rnam par rtog pa de dag mi 'byung ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin no zhes ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes
translated: has attained the qualities of a Buddha and🔽performs the deeds of a Buddha.

original: bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The teaching that the non-occurrence of those conceptual thoughts of the conventional is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is indicated by “Moreover, Blessed One, whoever has the qualities of a Buddha” and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan zin pa'i ngo bo rnams sgrub par byed pas sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan zin pa'i ngo bo rnams sgrub par byed pas sgrub pa ste /
translated: The establishment of the entities that have been taught as the qualities of a Buddha is the establishment.

original: bsnyen par byed nges  su mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par byed nges  su mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the practice, the definite practice, the concordant practice.

original: de'i dngos po ni sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The entity of that is the establishment itself.

original: de'i don du 'jug par mi byed 'byung bar mi byed sgrub par mi byed pa'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: de'i don du 'jug par mi byed 'byung bar mi byed sgrub par mi byed pa'i bar du yin no //
translated: For the sake of that, one does not engage, does not arise, does not establish, and so forth.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams spong ba dang dor bar mi bgyid do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams spong ba dang dor bar mi bgyid do //
translated: He does not abandon or reject the qualities of an ordinary person.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'thob pa yang ma lags la zhes bya ba ni 'thob par byed pa yang ma lags pa'o ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'thob pa yang ma lags la zhes bya ba ni 'thob par byed pa yang ma lags pa'o ;
translated: Nor does he attain the qualities of a Buddha means he does not cause attainment.

original: /'dzin pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa 'am 'dzin par byed pa ma lags zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: /'dzin pa yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa 'am 'dzin par byed pa ma lags zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Nor does he grasp means he does not cause production or grasping.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa la sogs pa bstan zin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs pa la sogs pa bstan zin te /
translated: The teachings of the Buddhas, etc., have already been explained.

original: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las kyang de skad du bstan pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa nas yid la byed pa'i bar du
analyzed: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las kyang de skad du bstan pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa nas yid la byed pa'i bar du
translated: And in the Twenty-five Thousand, etc., it is taught that the Blessed Buddhas dwelling in the world systems of the ten directions, from the time when they first begin to set their mind on enlightenment,

original: byed pa de'i ji ltar dge ba'i chos 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du mi nyams par 'gyur ba dang / nga rgyal la sogs pas zil gyis mi non par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa de'i ji ltar dge ba'i chos 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar du mi nyams par 'gyur ba dang / nga rgyal la sogs pas zil gyis mi non par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to increase the virtue of that activity, and in order to prevent the degeneration of the perfection of generosity up to the knowledge of all aspects, and in order to prevent being overwhelmed by pride and so forth,

original: bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang / sba bar mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang / sba bar mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he protects, guards, and conceals.

original: bu mang pos ma'i nad bsal ba'i phyir brtson pa'i dpes sangs rgyas kyis bsrungs pa la sogs @23b pa bstan te /
analyzed: bu mang pos ma'i nad bsal ba'i phyir brtson pa'i dpes sangs rgyas kyis bsrungs pa la sogs @23b pa bstan te /
translated: The Buddha's protection and so forth are taught by the example of many sons striving to cure their mother's illness.

original: de la bu lta bu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de la bu lta bu na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: In that, the Buddha Bhagavan is like a son.

original: ma lta bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ma lta bu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is like a mother.

original: de'i nad lta bu ni mthong ba dang bsgoms bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rang rang la ji ltar yod pa dang de'i bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: de'i nad lta bu ni mthong ba dang bsgoms bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa rang rang la ji ltar yod pa dang de'i bag la nyal lo //
translated: The conceptual thoughts to be abandoned by seeing and meditation, and their latencies, are like her illness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don 'di gsal bar bstan mod kyi yi ge mangs su dogs bas ma bris so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba bstan pa'i mdo las kyang don 'di gsal bar bstan mod kyi yi ge mangs su dogs bas ma bris so //
translated: The Sūtra Teaching the Appearance of the Tathāgatas also clearly teaches this point, but fearing too many quotations, I will not write more.

original: srog gcod pa med pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa med pa nas brtsams te /
translated: From the absence of killing,🔽up to the absence of wrong views,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul la rang yang gnas shing sems can rnams dgod pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul la rang yang gnas shing sems can rnams dgod pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will explain the practice of the perfections.

original: de yang spang ba dang blang ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis bye brag tu shes shing bsams pa med par spang bar bya ba mi dge ba la sogs pa las bslang ste /
analyzed: de yang spang ba dang blang ba'i chos rnam pa gnyis bye brag tu shes shing bsams pa med par spang bar bya ba mi dge ba la sogs pa las bslang ste /
translated: Moreover, without knowing and reflecting on the two kinds of phenomena to be abandoned and to be adopted, one cannot abandon what is to be abandoned, such as nonvirtue, and adopt what is to be adopted.

original: blang bar bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i chos dge ba la sogs pa la rang gnas shing gzhan yang dgod par mi nus pas chos de dag la gdon mi za bar bsam pa dang rnam par shes par bya dgos so //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa'i chos dge ba la sogs pa la rang gnas shing gzhan yang dgod par mi nus pas chos de dag la gdon mi za bar bsam pa dang rnam par shes par bya dgos so //
translated: Since one cannot abide in oneself and establish others in the virtuous phenomena that bring about the attainment of omniscience, one must definitely reflect and understand those phenomena.

original: gang zhig dag gis dben bar bsgoms pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig dag gis dben bar bsgoms pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the cultivation of emptiness,

original: gang chos gang la yang mi sems la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽spang bar bya ba so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel ba dang blang bar bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la yang /
analyzed: gang chos gang la yang mi sems la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / spang bar bya ba so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel ba dang blang bar bya ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos gang la yang /
translated: [the Buddha] declares, “That which does not think about any dharma whatsoever,” and so on.🔽[The perfection of wisdom] is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom of one who does not think about any dharma whatsoever, whether it is related to the level of ordinary beings and so on that are to be abandoned, or to the qualities of a perfect buddha that are to be adopted.

original: dran pa'i rnam par rtog pas mi sems la myong zhing dmigs pas rnam par mi rig pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
analyzed: dran pa'i rnam par rtog pas mi sems la myong zhing dmigs pas rnam par mi rig pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so //
translated: [The perfection of wisdom] is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom of one who does not think about any dharma whatsoever, whether it is related to the level of ordinary beings and so on that are to be abandoned, or to the qualities of a perfect buddha that are to be adopted.

original: gtan tshigs bstan pas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mi sems sam zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dris te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir / 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mi sems sam zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis dris te /
translated: In order to clarify this by teaching the reason,🔽the Blessed One asks, “Mañjuśrī, do you not think about the qualities of a buddha?”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag la mi sems sam zhes tshig zur gyis bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag la mi sems sam zhes tshig zur gyis bstan te /
translated: He teaches this indirectly, [saying], “Do you not think about those qualities of a buddha?”

original: de rjes su dran pa ni nges par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su dran pa ni nges par bya dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes dgos pa'o //
translated: The necessity is that one must remember that.

original: gal te bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su grub par mthong na ni bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems lags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su grub par mthong na ni bdag sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la sems lags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: If I saw the establishment of the Buddha qualities, I would think about the Buddha qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni chos can sangs rgyas dang / de'i chos rnams la bya ste /🔽ci ste yongs su grub cing rang gi ngo bo grub par @24a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni chos can sangs rgyas dang / de'i chos rnams la bya ste / ci ste yongs su grub cing rang gi ngo bo grub par @24a * //
translated: The Buddha qualities are the Buddha, the subject, and his qualities.

original: mthong na ni sems lags so //
analyzed: mthong na ni sems lags so //
translated: If I saw the establishment, the establishment of their own nature,🔽I would think about them.

original: yongs su grub par ma mthong ba'i phyir sems par mi bgyid do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su grub par ma mthong ba'i phyir sems par mi bgyid do zhes bstan to //
translated: Because I do not see the establishment, I do not think about them.

original: de ltar yongs su ma grub pa dngos por sems par bgyid na /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su ma grub pa dngos por sems par bgyid na /
translated: Thus, if one thinks about the non-established as an entity,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: it is not the perfection of wisdom itself. In order to teach this, [the Lord] says, The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is this, etc.

original: chos gang la yang rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /🔽spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i chos can dang chos gang la yang bye brag tu rtog cing /
analyzed: chos gang la yang rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te / spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i chos can dang chos gang la yang bye brag tu rtog cing /
translated: up to “there is no dharma whatsoever that abides by way of conceptualization.”

original: rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas shing zhugs pa ma lags so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas shing zhugs pa ma lags so //
translated: One does not abide by way of conceptualization, by way of engaging in conceptualization, in any dharma whatsoever that has the nature of being abandoned or accepted.

original: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag tu rtog pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag tu rtog pa ston te /
translated: “These are the dharmas of ordinary beings” and so on teaches the specific conceptualizations.

original: 'gro ba lnga 'am drug tu so sor 'gro bas na so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga 'am drug tu so sor 'gro bas na so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: Ordinary beings are so called because they go to each of the five or six types of transmigration.

original: de dag gi chos ni so so'i skye bo'i chos te /
analyzed: de dag gi chos ni so so'i skye bo'i chos te /
translated: The dharmas of those are the dharmas of ordinary beings.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'o ;🔽/ bdag dul ba dang zhi ba dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'o ; / bdag dul ba dang zhi ba dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni nyan thos kyi chos so //
translated: They are attachment and so on.🔽“These—taming the self, pacification, complete nirvana, and so on—are the dharmas of śrāvakas.”

original: 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
analyzed: 'dzin par sgro 'dogs pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so //
translated: “These—grasping, superimposition, and so on—are the dharmas of pratyekabuddhas.”

original: stobs la sogs pa 'di dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes chos gang la yang rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma lags so //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa 'di dag ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes chos gang la yang rnam par rtog pas nye bar gnas pa ma lags so //
translated: These powers and so forth are the qualities of a perfect Buddha.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ni rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bus chos de nyid kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ni rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bus chos de nyid kyang mi dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here the reason is stated: “The son of noble family who is dedicated to yoga does not even apprehend that dharma.”

original: tha snyad gdags par 'os pa'i chos bdag la sogs pa de nyid kyang mi dmigs te mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tha snyad gdags par 'os pa'i chos bdag la sogs pa de nyid kyang mi dmigs te mi mthong ngo //
translated: That very dharma which is suitable to be designated conventionally, such as a self, is not apprehended, is not seen.

original: bdag la sogs pa gang la bstan zin pa'i ngo bo'i chos so so'i skye po'i chos zhes brjod cing bstan pa bdag de mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa gang la bstan zin pa'i ngo bo'i chos so so'i skye po'i chos zhes brjod cing bstan pa bdag de mi dmigs so //
translated: The dharma that is taught as the nature of a self and so forth, which is called the dharma of ordinary beings, that self is not apprehended.

original: slob pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa gang bag bdun no //
analyzed: slob pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa gang bag bdun no //
translated: The learner is the seven, such as the stream enterer, and so on.

original: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The nonlearner is the arhat.

original: rang sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The pratyekabuddha is of two types:

original: bse ru lta bu dang / tshogs dang spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu dang / tshogs dang spyod pa'o //
translated: the rhinoceros-like and the congregating.

original: de la bse ru lta bu ni skyes bu dam pa la brten nas rgyud yongs su smin par byed kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bse ru lta bu ni skyes bu dam pa la brten nas rgyud yongs su smin par byed kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang mi skyed pa'o //
translated: The rhinoceros-like, after relying on holy persons, ripens his continuum, but does not generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: tshe yongs su brjes nas ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / 'phags @24b pa'i lam skyed par byed cing dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ngang shin tu mthar thug pa'i rang byang chub sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: tshe yongs su brjes nas ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / 'phags @24b pa'i lam skyed par byed cing dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ngang shin tu mthar thug pa'i rang byang chub sgrub par byed do //
translated: After changing lives, he generates the factors conducive to penetrative insight and the ārya path and accomplishes the state of a solitary realizer who has fully completed the result of a śrāvaka.

original: tshogs dang spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshogs dang spyod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Also, the assemblies and conduct are of two types.

original: kha cig ni skyes bu dam pa la bsten nas rgyud yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: kha cig ni skyes bu dam pa la bsten nas rgyud yongs su smin par byed /
translated: Some, after relying on holy persons, ripen their continuums.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang skyed par byed kyi /
translated: They also generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang 'phags pa'i lam ni mi skyed do //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang 'phags pa'i lam ni mi skyed do //
translated: But they do not generate the result of a śrāvaka and the ārya path.

original: tshe yongs su brjes na sa ni 'phags pa'i lam bskyed nas shin tu mthar phyin pa'i rang byang chub mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: tshe yongs su brjes na sa ni 'phags pa'i lam bskyed nas shin tu mthar phyin pa'i rang byang chub mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: When they change their lives, they do not manifest the individual enlightenment that is the culmination of the noble path.

original: gzhan dag ni skyes bu dam pa la brten nas rgyud yongs su smin par byed nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang skyed /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni skyes bu dam pa la brten nas rgyud yongs su smin par byed nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa yang skyed /
translated: Others, having matured their mental continuums by relying on holy persons, generate the factors conducive to penetrations,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yang skyed par byed kyi shin tu mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rang byang chub ni mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yang skyed par byed kyi shin tu mthar phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rang byang chub ni mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: and generate the noble path, but do not manifest the individual enlightenment that is the culmination of the noble path.

original: tshe yongs su brjes nas ni rang byang chub de thob par byed do //
analyzed: tshe yongs su brjes nas ni rang byang chub de thob par byed do //
translated: When they change their lives, they attain that individual enlightenment.

original: rnam pa de dag gsum char yang lung las gcig tu nga rgyal la spyod pa yin par bzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gsum char yang lung las gcig tu nga rgyal la spyod pa yin par bzhag ste /
translated: All three of these types are established as being of the class of those who practice with pride,

original: nga rgyal chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nga rgyal chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have great, middling, and small pride.

original: bse ru lta bu la sogs par dbye'o //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu la sogs par dbye'o //
translated: They are classified as rhinoceros-like and so on.

original: de dag gi chos ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad du yang phan tshun ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi chos ni rang sangs rgyas kyi chos so zhes bya ba'i sgra ni thams cad du yang phan tshun ltos pa yin no //
translated: The term “their Dharma” is a mutual reference to the Dharma of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa'i chos de shin tu rab tu bdag la sogs par brjod par rung ba'i chos can de mi dmigs shing dmigs su med pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa'i chos de shin tu rab tu bdag la sogs par brjod par rung ba'i chos can de mi dmigs shing dmigs su med pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma that is called “perfect buddha” is not observed, not found, as a phenomenon that is suitable to be expressed as “it is,” “it is not,” and so on.

original: de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin no //
translated: Thus the cultivation of the selflessness of persons is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the selflessness of phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rigs kyi bu de'i rnam par rtog pa 'di snyam du dbang sgyur ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rigs kyi bu de'i rnam par rtog pa 'di snyam du dbang sgyur ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: the Bhagavān stated, “A son of noble family who is diligent in the yoga of cultivating the perfection of wisdom . . .” and so on.🔽A son of noble family should not conceptualize in this way: “I will cultivate the perfection of wisdom,” “I will actualize the knowledge of all aspects,” “I will attain the knowledge of all aspects,” “I will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood,” “I will liberate those who are not liberated,” “I will release those who are not released,” “I will bring relief to those who are not relieved,” and “I will bring parinirvāṇa to those who have not attained parinirvāṇa.”

original: mnar med pa la thug pa'i bar 'di ni 'dod pas rab tu phyi ba'i khams yin pas 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: mnar med pa la thug pa'i bar 'di ni 'dod pas rab tu phyi ba'i khams yin pas 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of desire is so called because it is distinguished by the predominance of desire, from the hells up to the world of Brahma.

original: gnas gtsang ma la sogs pa nas tshangs ris la thug pa'i bar 'di ni gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba'i khams yin pas gzugs kyi khams so //🔽'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la sogs pa nas /🔽nam mkha' @25a * //🔽mtha' yas skye mched la thug pa'i bar 'di ni gzugs med pas rab tu phye ba yin pas gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma la sogs pa nas tshangs ris la thug pa'i bar 'di ni gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba'i khams yin pas gzugs kyi khams so // 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la sogs pa nas / nam mkha' @25a * // mtha' yas skye mched la thug pa'i bar 'di ni gzugs med pas rab tu phye ba yin pas gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of form is so called because it is distinguished by the predominance of form, from the Brahmakayika gods up to Akanistha.🔽The formless realm is so called because it is distinguished by the predominance of the formless, from the sphere of infinite space up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.🔽The realm of the perfected beings is the realm of the perfected beings because it is the realm of the perfected beings.

original: rab tu yang zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdu ba ni 'dod chags zad pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa zad pas spangs pa'i khams rnams yongs su bzung ngo //
analyzed: rab tu yang zhes bya ba'i sgras bsdu ba ni 'dod chags zad pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa zad pas spangs pa'i khams rnams yongs su bzung ngo //
translated: The realm of those free from attachment is the realm of those free from attachment because it is the realm of those free from attachment.🔽The realm of those who have abandoned is the realm of those who have abandoned because it is the realm of those who have abandoned.

original: 'gog pa'i dbyings su zhes bya ba ni dngos po yongs su zad pa zhes bgyi ba rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo de lta bur mi sems so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i dbyings su zhes bya ba ni dngos po yongs su zad pa zhes bgyi ba rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo de lta bur mi sems so //
translated: In the sphere of cessation means in the complete extinction of entities.🔽Here, having suspected that, the reason is stated: Blessed One, it is because that son or daughter of good family does not think in such a way as the nature of conceptualization.

original: 'dir dogs nas gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir dogs nas gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar des zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, having suspected that, the reason is stated: Blessed One, it is because that son or daughter of good family does not think in such a way as the nature of conceptualization.

original: des zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bus so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bus so //
translated: That means the son or daughter of good family endowed with the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gog pa'i chos zad pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i chos de gang yang mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'gog pa'i chos zad pa'i rang gi ngo bo'i chos de gang yang mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see any dharma at all, the nature of the cessation of attachment and so on, the extinction of dharmas.

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all dharmas are unborn.

original: de ltar bdag med pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid sgom pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag med pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid sgom pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of the two kinds of selflessness, should be known to be of the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul la rang gnas la sems can rnams 'god pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul la rang gnas la sems can rnams 'god pa bstan zin to //
translated: The establishment of sentient beings in the way of omniscience, in which one abides oneself, has been explained.

original: da ni sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the dedication of generosity and so forth to enlightenment should be stated.

original: rab tu 'jug pa thams cad kyang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa thob pa dang yongs su spang pa'i ched yin la /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa thams cad kyang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa thob pa dang yongs su spang pa'i ched yin la /
translated: All engagements are for the sake of obtaining what is desirable and avoiding what is undesirable.🔽This dedication of generosity and so forth to enlightenment is for the sake of obtaining buddhahood and avoiding ordinary beings, respectively.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa 'di yang sangs rgyas nyid dang so so skye bo gnyis go rims bzhin du 'thob pa dang / yongs su spang ba'i ched yin no zhes de ltar rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa 'di yang sangs rgyas nyid dang so so skye bo gnyis go rims bzhin du 'thob pa dang / yongs su spang ba'i ched yin no zhes de ltar rnam par rtog pa skye'o //
translated: Such conceptualization arises.

original: de la 'dir chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dir chos thams cad ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, since all phenomena are unarisen,🔽one should cultivate the perfection of wisdom without conceptualizing the purpose, the agent, and the action.

original: dgos pa dang byed pa po dang las rnams la mi rtog par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: dgos pa dang byed pa po dang las rnams la mi rtog par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes go rims bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: In order to demonstrate this in order, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang chos gang la yang phan pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang chos gang la yang phan pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Moreover, Blessed One, if one does not see any dharma as beneficial or harmful, then one does not engage in conceptualization.”

original: 'dod pa 'am mi 'dod pa ma thob pa 'am thob pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gang la yang go rims bzhin du phan pa sgrub pa 'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'am mi 'dod pa ma thob pa 'am thob pa'i chos kyi rang gi ngo bo gang la yang go rims bzhin du phan pa sgrub pa 'am /
translated: The essence of any phenomenon, whether desirable or undesirable, that has not been obtained or has been obtained, is the basis for accomplishing benefit or for accomplishing harm.🔽

original: gnod pa sel bar yang mi bgyid cing mi @25b sgrub pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba lags so //
analyzed: gnod pa sel bar yang mi bgyid cing mi @25b sgrub pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba lags so //
translated: That is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, in which one does not accomplish benefit or remove harm with regard to any phenomenon, whether it is desirable or undesirable, whether it is obtained or not obtained.

original: phan pa ma thob pa sgrub cing gnod pa thob pa sel bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa ma thob pa sgrub cing gnod pa thob pa sel bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not accomplish benefit that is not obtained, and one does not remove harm that is obtained.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phan tshun ltos pa yin no //🔽don 'di la gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa po yang ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phan tshun ltos pa yin no // don 'di la gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa po yang ma lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The word “or” indicates an alternative.🔽The Blessed One has stated the reason for this matter: “Thus, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is not the bestower of the qualities of a Buddha.”

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa bstan zin pa'i ngo bo ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa po yang ma lags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa bstan zin pa'i ngo bo ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sbyin par bgyid pa po yang ma lags te /
translated: Thus, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, which has been taught as having the nature that has been described, is not the bestower of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: des na 'bul bar bgyid pa po ma lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na 'bul bar bgyid pa po ma lags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is not the one who offers.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams gcod par bgyid pa po lags so zhes bya ba ni sel bar byed pa po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams gcod par bgyid pa po lags so zhes bya ba ni sel bar byed pa po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the one who cuts off the qualities of ordinary beings.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mi 'gog la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don de nyid ni gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das gang so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyang mi 'gog la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don de nyid ni gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, it is not the case that one does not stop the qualities of ordinary beings, etc. This is the establishment of the text.

original: gang zhes bya ni 'di ltar zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ni 'di ltar zhes bya ste /
translated: As for one, it means in this way.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos dngos po ma skyes pa rnams mi 'gog cing zad par mi byed /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos dngos po ma skyes pa rnams mi 'gog cing zad par mi byed /
translated: One does not stop, does not cause to cease, the qualities of ordinary beings, which are non-arisen entities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos dngos po ma skyes pa rnams mi 'thob cing yod par mi byed de ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dngos po ma skyes pa rnams mi 'thob cing yod par mi byed de ;
translated: One does not obtain, does not make existent, the qualities of a Buddha, which are non-arisen entities.

original: thob par bya ba dang thob pa po rnams shin tu dngos po med po'i phyir ro zhes lan du mar bstan zin to //
analyzed: thob par bya ba dang thob pa po rnams shin tu dngos po med po'i phyir ro zhes lan du mar bstan zin to //
translated: Because the object to be obtained and the one who obtains are utterly non-existent. This has been explained many times.

original: 'dir ni yongs su bsngo ba 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni yongs su bsngo ba 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the dedication should be understood as the complete purification of the three spheres.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba bstan zin to //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba bstan zin to //
translated: The dedication of generosity and so forth to enlightenment has been explained.

original: de yan chad du mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug bstan zin te /
analyzed: de yan chad du mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug bstan zin te /
translated: From here on, the sixteen moments of the path of seeing have been explained.

original: de la bcu drug ni /
analyzed: de la bcu drug ni /
translated: In that regard, the sixteen are:

original: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag //
translated: Suchness, the buddhas,🔽Mutual non-dependence,

original: phan tshun brten pa med pa dang // rnam grangs kyis ni zhal mi bzhes //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa med pa dang // rnam grangs kyis ni zhal mi bzhes //
translated: Not being satisfied with synonyms,

original: chen po nyid dang mtshan med bcas //
analyzed: chen po nyid dang mtshan med bcas //
translated: Greatness, signlessness,🔽Immeasurability, infinity,

original: dpag med pa dang mtha' med dang // der gnas pa yi gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: dpag med pa dang mtha' med dang // der gnas pa yi gzugs la sogs //
translated: The form and so forth that abide there,🔽The definite grasping of buddhahood,🔽The absence of acceptance and rejection, and so forth,🔽The emptiness of love and so forth,🔽The attainment of buddhahood,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang dor med la sogs pa dang // byams la sogs pa stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa dang // rnam par byang kun yongs bsdus dang // mngon zhen nad kun 'joms pa dang // mya ngan 'das @26a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang dor med la sogs pa dang // byams la sogs pa stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa dang // rnam par byang kun yongs bsdus dang // mngon zhen nad kun 'joms pa dang // mya ngan 'das @26a * //
translated: The complete inclusion of all purification,🔽The destruction of all diseases of clinging,🔽Nirvana, the supreme,

original: 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrungs sogs dang // srog gcod med pa nas brtsams nas //🔽rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //🔽bdag gnas sems can 'god pa dang // sbyin ba la sogs byang chub tu //
analyzed: 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrungs sogs dang // srog gcod med pa nas brtsams nas // rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni // bdag gnas sems can 'god pa dang // sbyin ba la sogs byang chub tu //
translated: the protection by the Buddhas, etc. ,🔽the non-abandonment of sentient beings,

original: yongs su sngo bar byed pa ste ;
analyzed: yongs su sngo bar byed pa ste ;
translated: the dedication of the merit to enlightenment,

original: / lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma // zhes bya ste /
translated: and the knowledge of the path.

original: de dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa dngos po'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi dmigs pa dngos po'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the ultimate realities that are the objects of insight and serenity.🔽The path of insight has been taught in this way.

original: mthong ba'i lam de skad du bstan pa dang // thugs dgyes pa 'am zhal gyis bzhes nas /🔽legs so legs so /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de skad du bstan pa dang // thugs dgyes pa 'am zhal gyis bzhes nas / legs so legs so /
translated: The Lord was pleased and accepted it.

original: zhes lan gnyis su gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes lan gnyis su gsungs so //
translated: He said, Excellent, excellent!

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis 'di ltar chos zab mo 'di lta bu 'di zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis 'di ltar chos zab mo 'di lta bu 'di zhes bya ba la /
translated: He said, Manjusri, you have taught this profound Dharma in this way.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: The word thus means for this reason.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po'i mtha' la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid dngos po'i mtha' la bya'o //
translated: Suchness is the limit of existence, the characteristic of the object.

original: zab mo ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs kyi mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zab mo ni sgro 'dogs pa dang skur 'debs kyi mtha' dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is profound because it is free from the extremes of superimposition and negation.

original: don dam par rang gi ngo bo'i chos mthong ba'i lam 'di sems can rnams la bstan cing bshad pa zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par rang gi ngo bo'i chos mthong ba'i lam 'di sems can rnams la bstan cing bshad pa zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that this path of seeing, which is the ultimate nature of phenomena, is taught and explained to sentient beings.

original: de'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the occasion for that.

original: phyag rgya 'di gzhag go zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi chos bcu drug 'di nyid yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di gzhag go zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi chos bcu drug 'di nyid yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the seal, meaning that this path of seeing is the cause of conviction.

original: phyag rgya dang rtags yin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya dang rtags yin te /
translated: It is a seal and a sign.

original: theg pa gsum gyi tshul so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi ngo bo dag gi cha phra mo khong du ma tshud pa tshu rol nyi tshe mthong ba /
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi tshul so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi ngo bo dag gi cha phra mo khong du ma tshud pa tshu rol nyi tshe mthong ba /
translated: Sentient beings who are of the nature of those who are definite in the three vehicles see only a limited part of the subtle aspect of that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang cig shos su bye brag ma phyed pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang cig shos su bye brag ma phyed pa rnams kyis /
translated: Without distinguishing between bodhisattvas and others,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par /
translated: and are bodhisattva great beings.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis phyag rgya bzhag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir khyod kyis phyag rgya bzhag ste /
translated: You have set forth the seal of the true nature of reality in order to realize it just as it is.

original: gang dag chos 'di la 'dod pa dang seng ge sgras seng ge'i phru gu bzhin du chos thos pas mi skrag pa la sogs pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes phyag rgya 'dis nges par byed do //🔽gang dag seng ge'i sgras ri dags gzhan bzhin pa dang // ba tsha'i chu'i nang nas skyes pas chu zhim po mi 'dod pa bzhin 'di la mi 'dod cing skrag par byed pa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nam /
analyzed: gang dag chos 'di la 'dod pa dang seng ge sgras seng ge'i phru gu bzhin du chos thos pas mi skrag pa la sogs pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhes phyag rgya 'dis nges par byed do // gang dag seng ge'i sgras ri dags gzhan bzhin pa dang // ba tsha'i chu'i nang nas skyes pas chu zhim po mi 'dod pa bzhin 'di la mi 'dod cing skrag par byed pa'i nyan thos kyi theg pa pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can nam /
translated: Those who desire this Dharma and are not frightened by it when they hear it, like lion cubs at the roar of the father lion, are bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub @26b sems dpa'i theg pa pa dmigs pa can dag yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub @26b sems dpa'i theg pa pa dmigs pa can dag yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Those who are frightened by it, like other deer at the sound of the lion’s roar, or like those born in the land of salt water who do not desire the sweet water of the Ganges, should be known as followers of the Listeners’ Vehicle who are full of pride, or as followers of the Bodhisattva Vehicle who are full of conceptualization.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtags su gyur pa'i phyag rgya dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtags su gyur pa'i phyag rgya dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoid of the seal of the bodhisattva signs.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag yin te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa'i bye brag yin te /
translated: Those with manifest pride are a type of śrāvaka.

original: nyan thos kyi byang chub tsam gyis dga' zhing zhi ba phyogs gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi byang chub tsam gyis dga' zhing zhi ba phyogs gcig pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are pleased with the mere enlightenment of a śrāvaka, which is called “one-sided peace.”

original: yang na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par bzung ste /
analyzed: yang na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa par bzung ste /
translated: Or, they are considered to be of the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag ni gcig tu nga rgyal la spyod pa yin par gsung rab las gzhag go //
analyzed: de dag ni gcig tu nga rgyal la spyod pa yin par gsung rab las gzhag go //
translated: It is said in the scriptures that they are practitioners of pride.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di dag gis sangs rgyas gcig bsnyen bkur byas pa de sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di dag gis sangs rgyas gcig bsnyen bkur byas pa de sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa'o //
translated: They have not served one buddha, etc. They have served one buddha, but not just one buddha.

original: yang na sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa gang yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur byas pa gang yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Or, the meaning of “one buddha” is “one who is a buddha.”

original: de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that.

original: 'di dag gis sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur bskyed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis sangs rgyas gcig la bsnyen bkur bskyed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They have generated service to one buddha.

original: de ltar ma yin gyi 'on kyang sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin gyi 'on kyang sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin /
translated: It is not that, but rather they have served many buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskul ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskul ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They have planted roots of virtue with many buddhas.

original: skrag pa ni sngangs shing skrag pa ste /
analyzed: skrag pa ni sngangs shing skrag pa ste /
translated: Fear is terror.

original: lan 'ga' 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' 'byung ba'o //
translated: It occurs occasionally.

original: dngang ba ni rgyun du skrag pa'o //
analyzed: dngang ba ni rgyun du skrag pa'o //
translated: Dread is continuous fear.

original: dngang bar 'gyur ba ni bral yang yang byung yang byung byed pa ste /
analyzed: dngang bar 'gyur ba ni bral yang yang byung yang byung byed pa ste /
translated: One who is frightened is one who has fear, who has had fear, and who will have fear.

original: rgyun du 'dug pa'i rims dang bar du 'byung ba'i rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyun du 'dug pa'i rims dang bar du 'byung ba'i rims bzhin no //
translated: It is like a continuous fever and an intermittent fever.

original: gzhan dag na re chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag yin no zhe'o //
translated: Others say that it is the difference between small, medium, and great.

original: de dag lta bu ma yin pas mi skrag pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag lta bu ma yin pas mi skrag pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Since they are not like that, they are fearless, etc.

original: de ltar bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug thogs su bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi mjug thogs su bslab pa gsum rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i bsgom pa'i lam brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, immediately after the path of seeing, which is included in the pure attitude, the path of meditation, which is included in the pure training, should be mentioned.

original: chung ba'i chung ba la sogs lam //
analyzed: chung ba'i chung ba la sogs lam //
translated: The small of the small, etc.

original: sa dgu la ni rnam par dag //
analyzed: sa dgu la ni rnam par dag //
translated: are purified on the nine stages.

original: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i //🔽dri ma dag gi gnyen po yin //
analyzed: chen po'i chen po la sogs pa'i // dri ma dag gi gnyen po yin //
translated: The antidote to the great of the great, etc.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: defilements.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas sa gnyis pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas sa gsum pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa'i bye brag gi @27a * //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas sa gnyis pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas sa gsum pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnam par dag pa'i bye brag gi @27a * //
translated: Therein, the second stage is by the purity of superior morality, the third stage is by the purity of superior mind, and the fourth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom.🔽The fifth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom, the sixth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom, the seventh stage is by the purity of superior wisdom, and the eighth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom.🔽The ninth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom, and the tenth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom.

original: phyir 'od 'phro ba la sogs pas brgyad gzhag go //
analyzed: phyir 'od 'phro ba la sogs pas brgyad gzhag go //
translated: The tenth stage is by the purity of superior wisdom.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden bas thob par bya ba yin pas 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kun 'byung ba'i bden bas thob par bya ba yin pas 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The Tathāgata’s stage is not mentioned here because it is to be attained by the truth of the origin of the Tathāgata’s wisdom.

original: de las gzhan dgu ni rim bzhin ston te /
analyzed: de las gzhan dgu ni rim bzhin ston te /
translated: The other nine are taught in order.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba bsgrub pa'i phyir bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher ston par spobs lags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba bsgrub pa'i phyir bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya cher ston par spobs lags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: In order to accomplish the permission of the Blessed One, it is said: “I am confident in teaching extensively the perfection of wisdom.”

original: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan ba tsam pas lhag par spobs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgya cher zhes bya ba ni gong du bstan ba tsam pas lhag par spobs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Extensive means that he is more confident than just what was taught above.

original: 'jam dpal spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'jam dpal spobs par gyis shig ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase Mañjuśrī, be confident shows the permission of the Blessed One.

original: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa gsum mo //
translated: There, the training in superior morality is the three perfections beginning with generosity.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the one that goes everywhere.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The training in superior mind is the perfection of meditation.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The training in superior wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di drug kho nas sems can gyi don dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di drug kho nas sems can gyi don dang nyon mongs pa spangs pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sentient beings' aims and the elimination of afflictions are accomplished by just these six.

original: thabs la sogs pa bzhi ni 'di dag nyid kyi grogs yin te /
analyzed: thabs la sogs pa bzhi ni 'di dag nyid kyi grogs yin te /
translated: The four beginning with method are the companions of just these.

original: 'di ltar sbyin ba la sogs pas yongs su zin pa'i sems can gyi tshogs rnams thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la sbyor bar byed pas thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i grogs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin ba la sogs pas yongs su zin pa'i sems can gyi tshogs rnams thabs la mkhas pas dge ba la sbyor bar byed pas thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i grogs yin no //
translated: The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.

original: mthong ba'i chos la nyon mongs pa lhag par che ba'i phyir sgom pa rgyun du mi nus shing khams dman ba la lhag par mos pas lhag pa'i bsam ba nyam chung bas dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir nang du sems🔽'jog mi nus pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub mi nus pa rnams bsod nams cung zad tsam dag byas te 'dug pa de dag tshe phyi mar nyon mongs pa chung bar yid kyis smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la nyon mongs pa lhag par che ba'i phyir sgom pa rgyun du mi nus shing khams dman ba la lhag par mos pas lhag pa'i bsam ba nyam chung bas dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsam gtan yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir nang du sems🔽'jog mi nus pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab mngon par sgrub mi nus pa rnams bsod nams cung zad tsam dag byas te 'dug pa de dag tshe phyi mar nyon mongs pa chung bar yid kyis smon lam btab bo //
translated: The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the training in superior mind, because it causes the bodhisattva to attain concentration and wisdom.🔽The perfection of vigor is the friend of the

original: nyon mongs pa chung ba des na brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung ba des na brtson 'grus rtsom nus par 'gyur te /
translated: Because of the small afflictions, one is able to undertake effort.

original: de bas na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi grogs @27b yin no //
analyzed: de bas na smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus kyi grogs @27b yin no //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of vows is the companion of effort.

original: gang gi tshe skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas lhag pa'i bsam ba nyam chung ba bzlog ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas lhag pa'i bsam ba nyam chung ba bzlog ste /
translated: When, by relying on the good person, listening to the holy Dharma, and proper mental attention, one turns away from the weakness of superior intention,

original: gzugs kyi khams su lhag pa'i bsam ba stobs dang ldan pa nyid thob pa'i phyir /
