analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su lhag pa'i bsam ba stobs dang ldan pa nyid thob pa'i phyir /
translated: and obtains the strength of superior intention in the form realm,

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi grogs yin no //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gtan gyi grogs yin no //
translated: the perfection of strength is the companion of meditative absorption.

original: ye shes gang gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab sgrub nus par 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i grogs yin no //
analyzed: ye shes gang gis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab sgrub nus par 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i grogs yin no //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the companion of this perfection of wisdom, by which one is able to accomplish supramundane wisdom.

original: de las gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas ;
analyzed: de las gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas ;
translated: From among those, with regard to the second,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang gi gnas pa mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang gi gnas pa mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, “That which is the non-apprehension of the abiding of any dharma,” and so on.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de de la gang chos gang gi zhes bya ba ni gnas pa po'i chos gzugs la sogs pa gang yin ba de dag gi'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid de de la gang chos gang gi zhes bya ba ni gnas pa po'i chos gzugs la sogs pa gang yin ba de dag gi'o //
translated: Here, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is the characteristic of the purity of the training in superior morality. In that regard, “of any dharma” refers to those dharmas of form, etc. that are the abiders.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la gnas pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la gnas pas gnas pa'o //
translated: “Abiding” means dwelling in this, so it is abiding.

original: bslab pa 'di nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: bslab pa 'di nyid la bya ste /
translated: This should be taken as the training.

original: rjes su bsgrub pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyis sgrub ba ni de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su bsgrub pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyis sgrub ba ni de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The accomplishment of those with the nature of subsequent practice is the engagement in that.

original: de mi dmigs pa ni mi mthong ba'o//
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa ni mi mthong ba'o//
translated: The non-apprehension of that is not seeing.

original: mi gnas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Non-abiding is also twofold:

original: ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / gnod sems la sogs pa log par sgrub pa dang mi sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / gnod sems la sogs pa log par sgrub pa dang mi sgrub pa ste /
translated: wrong practice and non-practice of stinginess, immorality, malice, and so on.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: That also is non-apprehension.

original: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyi ga ma yin pa rnams mi dmigs pa gang yin ba de sgom pa 'di yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyi ga ma yin pa rnams mi dmigs pa gang yin ba de sgom pa 'di yin par bzhed do //
translated: This meditation is the non-apprehension of the antidote, the adverse factors, and neither of these.

original: de nas de mi dmigs pa 'di yang ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de nas de mi dmigs pa 'di yang ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Then, why is this non-apprehension?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i slad du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mi gnas pa'i slad du zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because all phenomena, such as form, do not endure.

original: ma skyes pa rnams ni gnas par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams ni gnas par mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable that the non-arisen endure.

original: sa gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang lhag par dmigs pa'i slad du nye bar mi gnas pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das gang chos gang la yang lhag par dmigs pa'i slad du nye bar mi gnas pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With regard to the third ground, the Bhagavān says, “That which does not abide due to the non-apprehension of any dharma,” and so on.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin @28a * //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid yin @28a * //
translated: Here, the perfection of wisdom is the characteristic of the purity of the training in the higher mind.

original: no ; / de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: no ; / de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dngos po'i chos gang la yang lhag par dmigs pa'i slad du yul du bya ba'i phyir nye bar mi gnas 'jug pa ma lags so //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos gang la yang lhag par dmigs pa'i slad du yul du bya ba'i phyir nye bar mi gnas 'jug pa ma lags so //
translated: It does not abide in order to make any existent thing an object, in order to make it an object of special observation.

original: 'dir de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas dogs te /
analyzed: 'dir de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya bas dogs te /
translated: Here, why is that?

original: gtan tshigs dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reason is asked, and the Blessed One said, “It is like this,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni dmigs pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni dmigs pa ma mchis shing /
translated: Because all dharmas are without observation,

original: dmigs pa stong pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa stong pa yin te /
translated: and observation is empty.

original: ma skyes pa rnams la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa rnams la yul dang yul can gyi dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of object and subject is not tenable for the unarisen.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “Thus, this meditation,” and so on, concluding.

original: de nyid sems mi dmigs par sgom pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid sems mi dmigs par sgom pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the meditation on the non-observation of mind,

original: dmigs pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs par sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no mind apart from the aspect of observation.

original: de yang dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du yod pa ma yin yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du yod pa ma yin yang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that also is not existent like a gandharva city, because it appears.

original: don dam par de mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: don dam par de mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid sgom pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa yin par bzhed do //
translated: The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is considered to be the cultivation of the identity that is not perceived ultimately.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba sa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba sa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third stage is called “the purity of the training in the higher mind.”

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni sa lhag ma rnams yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni sa lhag ma rnams yin no //
translated: The distinctive feature of the purity of the training in the higher wisdom is the remaining stages.

original: de las bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de las bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas / bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In this regard, with regard to the fourth stage,🔽it is said, “Moreover, Blessed One, when bodhisattvas practice the perfection of wisdom, they should contemplate the following: ‘Form is impermanent.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Moreover” means another aspect of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'od 'phro can gyis 'di ni chos kyi dbyings la kun tu 'dzin pa nyid med pa'i don rtogs pas /
analyzed: 'od 'phro can gyis 'di ni chos kyi dbyings la kun tu 'dzin pa nyid med pa'i don rtogs pas /
translated: Since the one with light rays realizes the meaning of the absence of grasping to the realm of phenomena,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i rmongs pa dang chos la sred pa'i rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i rmongs pa dang chos la sred pa'i rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len gyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: the antidote to the obscurations of craving meditative absorption, the obscurations of craving phenomena, and their negative tendencies.

original: de ltar na re zhig chos la sred pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig chos la sred pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir gang la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, in order to demonstrate the absence of craving for the Dharma, he says: “Even the qualities of a Buddha are not manifest to him.

original: kyang gi sgras ni de dag gi ched du 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'dod par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni de dag gi ched du 'jug pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'dod par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The word “even” is used because he is engaged in their pursuit, and it is in order to demonstrate that he is desirous of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mngon du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdun na 'dug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang mngon du mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mdun na 'dug pa ma yin te /
translated: “Even the qualities of a Buddha are not manifest” means that they are not present before him.

original: chos thams cad dngos po ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po ma yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he sees all things as insubstantial.

original: 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa rang sangs rgyas kyi chos @28b rnams mngon du lta ga la 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa rang sangs rgyas kyi chos @28b rnams mngon du lta ga la 'gyur zhes sbyar ro //
translated: How could the qualities of a Pratyekabuddha, which are not to be desired, be manifest?

original: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang mngon du mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgom pa gang la zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi chos rnams kyang mngon du mi 'gyur na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgom pa gang la zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no //
translated: “Even the qualities of a Śrāvaka are not manifest” and so on is related to “in which meditation.”

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni spong ba ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams lta smos kyang ci 'tshal zhes bya ba ni spong ba ste /
translated: This is the rejection.

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyi dngos po mngon du 'gyur ba lta re zhig zhog gi / smos su yang med do zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyi dngos po mngon du 'gyur ba lta re zhig zhog gi / smos su yang med do zhes bya ba ni kyang gi sgra'i don yin no //
translated: Put aside for a moment the manifestation of the entities of the qualities of ordinary beings, there is not even any mention of them. This is the meaning of the word even.

original: chos la sred pa med pa bstan nas /
analyzed: chos la sred pa med pa bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the absence of craving for dharmas,

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa med par ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de sgom pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa med par ston to //
translated: the absence of craving for meditative absorption is taught by Moreover, Blessed One, the cultivation of that perfection of wisdom... and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de sgom pa ni zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i gnyen po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de sgom pa ni zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa'i gnyen po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The cultivation of that perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of the antidote to craving for meditative absorption.

original: sgom pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gnas nas te /
analyzed: sgom pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni gnas nas te /
translated: The cultivation that is based on... is based on the abode.

original: re zhig nyi tshe ba'i chos mngon du byed pa lta zhog gi / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: re zhig nyi tshe ba'i chos mngon du byed pa lta zhog gi / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yang mngon du mi byed do //
translated: For the time being, let alone the realization of the limited Dharma, they do not even realize the inconceivable Dharma of the Buddhas.

original: yang gi sgras sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis ma khyab pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams bsam gyis ma khyab pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa yang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “even” should be seen as indicating that they do not even realize the thought that the Dharma of the Buddhas is inconceivable.

original: mngon du mi byed pa ni snyoms par 'jug pas yul du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon du mi byed pa ni snyoms par 'jug pas yul du mi byed pa ste /
translated: “They do not realize” means that they do not take it as an object through meditative concentration,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their craving for meditative concentration has been cut off.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos thams cad la rnam par me rtog pa'i slad du lags par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams chos thams cad la rnam par me rtog pa'i slad du lags par rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Blessed One, this cultivation of the perfection of wisdom by the bodhisattva great beings should be known as the non-discrimination of all dharmas.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par mi rtog par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos rnams la rnam par mi rtog par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be seen that it is in order to be without conceptualization with regard to the dharmas of the Perfectly accomplished Buddha, etc.

original: chos dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sred pa spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: in order to abandon craving for the dharmas and meditative concentration.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang sgom pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sa lnga pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang sgom pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sa lnga pa ston to //
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, on the basis of which cultivation...

original: sgom pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni thob nas so //
analyzed: sgom pa gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni thob nas so //
translated: On the basis of which cultivation means: having attained.

original: mthong ba ma mchis pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba ma mchis pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the manner of non-seeing means: in the manner of non-apprehension of all dharmas.

original: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos su mthong zhing shes so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i chos thams cad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos su mthong zhing shes so //
translated: All dharmas connected with ordinary people, etc. are seen and known as the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos thun @29a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos thun @29a * //
translated: All dharmas are the inconceivable dharmas of the Buddha.

original: mong ma yin pa rmad du byung ba'i chos yin par mthong ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyud tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mong ma yin pa rmad du byung ba'i chos yin par mthong ba de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i rgyud tha dad pa med par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom. This is the characteristic of the realization that the continuum of afflictions and purification is not different.

original: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mi sgra gces bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas brgya stong mang po la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa lags te /
analyzed: gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mi sgra gces bya ba la sogs pa la sangs rgyas brgya stong mang po la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa lags te /
translated: Those who, having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, do not tremble, and so on, have attended upon many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas.

original: mnyes par bgyis pa dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes par bgyis pa dang ldan pa ni sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur bgyis pa'o //
translated: Attending upon the Buddhas is having the possession of pleasing them.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mi skrag pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas mi skrag pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Those who, having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom included in the path of cultivation, do not tremble, and so on.

original: mi skrag pa la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi skrag pa la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: Not trembling, and so on, have been explained.

original: thos pa la skrag pa med pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas brgya stong mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pas lhag par mos pa ni shin tu yang sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin te ;
analyzed: thos pa la skrag pa med pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas brgya stong mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pas lhag par mos pa ni shin tu yang sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa yin te ;
translated: The superior aspiration of those who are not afraid of hearing about the perfections, etc. is due to their having served many hundreds of thousands of buddhas.

original: de dag gi thugs mnyes par mdzad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag gi thugs mnyes par mdzad pa yin gyi /
translated: They have pleased the minds of those buddhas,

original: gzhan dag ni nyan pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni nyan pa la sogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but others have not, because it is not proper for them to hear, etc.

original: ji skad du sngar sangs rgyas rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du sngar sangs rgyas rnams la lhag par bya ba byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it was said above, “they have done what needed to be done with regard to the buddhas, etc.”

original: gal te bsgoms pa'i brtsams pa yongs su rdzogs par thos pa la skrag pa med pa la sogs pa'i bsngags pa ston pa skabs su ci bab ce na /
analyzed: gal te bsgoms pa'i brtsams pa yongs su rdzogs par thos pa la skrag pa med pa la sogs pa'i bsngags pa ston pa skabs su ci bab ce na /
translated: If the praise of not being afraid of hearing about the perfections, etc. is appropriate for one who has completed the practice of meditation, why is it mentioned here?

original: de la bshad pa /
analyzed: de la bshad pa /
translated: The author of the commentary explains:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la ni nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas kyi grogs dang nyam chung ba dang phra ba dang rnam pa gsum yang dag par bcom mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la ni nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas kyi grogs dang nyam chung ba dang phra ba dang rnam pa gsum yang dag par bcom mo //
translated: On the bodhisattva stages, the bodhisattva has completely destroyed the three kinds of subtle propensities of the passions: the subtle, the very subtle, and the extremely subtle.

original: de la dang po nas lnga pa'i bar du ni mthun bar nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas kyi grogs yang dag par bcom pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po nas lnga pa'i bar du ni mthun bar nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas kyi grogs yang dag par bcom pa'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: The first to the fifth stages are the occasion of the complete destruction of the assistance of the proclivities of the passions.

original: drug pa dang / bdun pa gnyis kyi gnas skabs su ni mthun par nyam chung ba bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa dang / bdun pa gnyis kyi gnas skabs su ni mthun par nyam chung ba bcom pa yin no //
translated: The sixth and seventh stages are the occasion of the destruction of the weakness of the assistance.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum gyi gnas skabs su ni mthun par phra ba bcom pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum gyi gnas skabs su ni mthun par phra ba bcom pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The eighth and so on are the occasion of the destruction of the subtlety of the assistance.

original: sa lnga pa bstan nas sangs rgyas mang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas skabs gzhan bstan to //
analyzed: sa lnga pa bstan nas sangs rgyas mang po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnas skabs gzhan bstan to //
translated: After the teaching of the fifth stage, the other occasions are taught, beginning with “having worshipped many Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du sa bdun pa bstan nas de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bdun pa bstan nas de nas yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ” Similarly, after the teaching of the seventh stage, “then again” and so on is stated.

original: sa bcu pa bstan pa la ni skabs rdzogs pa yin no zhes dgongs @29b pa'o ;
analyzed: sa bcu pa bstan pa la ni skabs rdzogs pa yin no zhes dgongs @29b pa'o ;
translated: In the teaching of the tenth stage, the occasion is complete.

original: / de skad du sa la 'jug pa las kyang /
analyzed: / de skad du sa la 'jug pa las kyang /
translated: Thus it is said in the Avatiira:

original: sa lnga gnyis dang gsum dag la //
analyzed: sa lnga gnyis dang gsum dag la //
translated: On the five stages, the two, and the three,

original: nyon mongs grogs dang nyam chung dang // phra ba zad pa'i 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs grogs dang nyam chung dang // phra ba zad pa'i 'dod pa yin //
translated: the subtle, and the friends of the afflictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag zad //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag zad // ces gsungs so //
translated: The Tathagatas have destroyed them.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa drug pa ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzhan yang gang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa drug pa ston to //
translated: The Blessed One also teaches the sixth stage with the words, “Moreover, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in the perfection of wisdom, does not see any dharma whatsoever that is defiled or purified.”

original: 'dir lugs dang mi thun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir lugs dang mi thun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to realize the dependent origination that is contrary to the system and not contrary to the system,

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yod pa ma yin par mthong ;
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba 'am rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang yod pa ma yin par mthong ;
translated: he sees that there is no dharma whatsoever that is defiled or purified.

original: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum rten cing /
analyzed: de dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum rten cing /
translated: Those three kinds of defilement are the defilement of afflictions, the defilement of action, and the defilement of birth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i chos kyi dngos po dang bdag la sogs pa gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'i chos kyi dngos po dang bdag la sogs pa gang yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: He does not see any entity of a defiled dharma or a purified dharma, such as a self, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba yang skyed do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang skyed do //
translated: And he generates purification.

original: gang zag dang / chos la mngon par zhen pa ngan song ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rmongs pa dang gnas ngan len la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: gang zag dang / chos la mngon par zhen pa ngan song ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rmongs pa dang gnas ngan len la sogs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
translated: The absence of observation and non-apprehension of the person and phenomena as truly existent, which are free from the stains of the afflictions of the lower realms, such as delusion and negative tendencies, is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags te zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa lags te zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: This is taught by the phrase is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bsgoms na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar bsgoms na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: Bhagavan, when cultivated in this way... and so forth is the conclusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de ni so so'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa bdun pa ston te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de ni so so'i skye bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa bdun pa ston te /
translated: Bhagavan, the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom is not the cultivation of ordinary beings... and so forth teaches the seventh ground.

original: 'di ni rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma med par gnas pa yin la tha dad pa nyid med pa'i don rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtsol ba dang bcas shing mtshan ma med par gnas pa yin la tha dad pa nyid med pa'i don rtogs pa yin te /
translated: This is the stage of effortful abiding in the absence of signs, and it is the realization of the meaning of non-difference.

original: tha dad pa nyid kyi rgyu dang mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid kyi rgyu dang mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the causes and signs of difference are not observed.

original: de nyid ston pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de ni tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de ni tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi don rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: The teaching of that is as follows: That meditation on the perfection of wisdom is characterized by the realization of the meaning of non-difference.

original: so so'i skye bo nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang phan tshun tha dad du mi bgyid cing bye brag tu mi byed de //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang phan tshun tha dad du mi bgyid cing bye brag tu mi byed de //
translated: From ordinary beings up to perfect Buddhas, one does not make distinctions or differentiate them.

original: yang na 'dir tha dad du byed de mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dir tha dad du byed de mtshan ma'o //
translated: Or, here one makes distinctions, which are signs.

original: de mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba lags so //
analyzed: de mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni ring du song ba'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom ba lags so //
translated: That which does not do that is the meditation on the perfection of wisdom with the nature of having gone far.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la zhes bya ba la @30a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la zhes bya ba la @30a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta... and so on.

original: sogs pas sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba ston te /
analyzed: sogs pas sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba ston te /
translated: This teaches the eighth ground, the Immovable.

original: 'dir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thog pas dma' ba med pa dang ma thob pa med pa'i don rtogs shing mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa 'byung ba dang mtshan ma la yang dbang nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thog pas dma' ba med pa dang ma thob pa med pa'i don rtogs shing mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa lhun gyis grub pa 'byung ba dang mtshan ma la yang dbang nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Here, because of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, the realization of the meaning of “there is nothing lower” and “there is nothing not attained,” and the spontaneous accomplishment of the attention to signlessness, and the attainment of mastery over signs,

original: de dag thams cad bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /🔽'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas zhes dris te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis / 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas zhes dris te /
translated: in order to teach all of these, the Blessed One asked,🔽“Mañjuśrī, how many Tathāgatas have you served?”

original: gang khyod kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang khyod kyis bsnyen bkur byas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi tshad ji tsam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and asked, “How many Tathāgatas have you served?”

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i sems dang sems las byung ba ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pas de dag ma skyes pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang sgyu ma'i skyes bu'i sems dang sems las byung ba ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pas de dag ma skyes pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: and the noble Mañjuśrī taught that they are non-arisen, saying, “The mind and mental factors of an illusory person,” and so on.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi skyes bu ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu'o //
translated: An illusory person is a person who is the nature of an illusion.

original: de ni re zhig gtan ma skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: de ni re zhig gtan ma skyes pa yin na /
translated: If it is not produced at all,

original: de'i sems dang sems las byung ba lta shin tu yang ma skyes na 'gag pa lta ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de'i sems dang sems las byung ba lta shin tu yang ma skyes na 'gag pa lta ci zhig yod //
translated: then mind and mental factors are not produced at all. How could they cease?

original: bsnyen bkur bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin du ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya ba'i sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin du ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha who is to be worshipped is also like that, not produced.

original: bsnyen bkur byed pa yang ma skyes pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed pa yang ma skyes pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The one who worships is also not produced. In order to teach this,

original: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes dris so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, have you not entered into the Buddha’s Dharma?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ni sangs rgyas kyi chos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos ni sangs rgyas kyi chos te /
translated: The Dharma of the Buddhas is the Dharma of the Buddhas,

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the powers and the fearlessnesses.

original: de 'am de dag la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'am de dag la lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not engage spontaneously in that or those,

original: rgyun gyis sa ma yang dag par ma zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun gyis sa ma yang dag par ma zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par ma zhugs sam zhes bya ste /
translated: the one who has not entered into the Buddha’s Dharma through continuity is said to have not entered into the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: 'di ltar bsnyen bkur ma skyes par smra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsnyen bkur ma skyes par smra'o //
translated: Thus, he says that worship is not produced.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang // sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba la sogs pa yin na bya ba de dag mi byed na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang // sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyong ba la sogs pa yin na bya ba de dag mi byed na /
translated: If it is right to engage in the qualities of a buddha, then one should serve the buddhas, one should develop living beings, one should purify a buddha-land, one should purify the bodhisattva practices, and so on.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes dgongs pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gang sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos de gang yang dmigs su ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni yang dag par zhugs pa po bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs @30b pa'i bdag nyid rtag pa dang phung po la sogs pa'i
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes dgongs pa'o // bcom ldan 'das gang sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa'i chos de gang yang dmigs su ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni yang dag par zhugs pa po bsnyen bkur byed pa la sogs @30b pa'i bdag nyid rtag pa dang phung po la sogs pa'i
translated: But if one does not perform those actions, how can one be said to engage in the qualities of a buddha?🔽Lord, is it that the quality of engaging in the qualities of a buddha is not apprehended at all?

original: mtshan nyid mi rtag pa mi dmigs pas mi 'thad pa kho na yin par ston to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi rtag pa mi dmigs pas mi 'thad pa kho na yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that it is not at all tenable to apprehend the quality of engaging in the qualities of a buddha as having the nature of serving the buddhas, and so on, as permanent, or as having the nature of the aggregates, and so on, as impermanent.

original: 'dis ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa na rtsol ba'i rmongs pa spangs pa dang mtshan ma la dbang ba'i rmongs pa spangs pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mtshan ma med pa yid la byed pa na rtsol ba'i rmongs pa spangs pa dang mtshan ma la dbang ba'i rmongs pa spangs pa yang bstan to //
translated: This also shows the abandonment of the delusion of effort and the abandonment of the delusion of mastery with respect to signs when one attends to signlessness.

original: gal te bsnyen bkur bya ba la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams yang dag par zhugs pa med na /
analyzed: gal te bsnyen bkur bya ba la bsnyen bkur byed pa rnams yang dag par zhugs pa med na /
translated: If those who are to be served are not engaged in serving,🔽then Mañjuśrī, in whom do those buddha qualities exist?”

original: 'jam dpal 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag su la yod ces dris pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal 'o na sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag su la yod ces dris pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis gsol pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Blessed One, they exist in you.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bgyi ba de dag ces bya ba 'dis bstan pa'i mngon sum du mdzad pa de dag gi ming yang ji ltar yang ma mchis te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos zhes bgyi ba de dag ces bya ba 'dis bstan pa'i mngon sum du mdzad pa de dag gi ming yang ji ltar yang ma mchis te /
translated: “Those so-called buddha qualities” shows that even the names of those who have actualized the teachings do not exist at all.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa ni rig par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa ni rig par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since they cannot be perceived, they cannot be known.

original: 'dis ni chos dang chos can ma skyes par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos dang chos can ma skyes par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the dharma and the person are unborn.

original: sa dgu pa la ni ston par mdzad pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa thob bo //
analyzed: sa dgu pa la ni ston par mdzad pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa thob bo //
translated: On the ninth stage, he attains the unobstructed analytical knowledges.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du thogs pa med par ston pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du thogs pa med par ston pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be tenable that he teaches without obstruction just as he wishes.

original: de nyid 'dir ston pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis chags pa med pa nyid rnyed dam zhes tshig zur gyis dres pa dang / de'i lan du bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid chags pa ma mchis pa nyid lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'dir ston pa ni 'jam dpal khyod kyis chags pa med pa nyid rnyed dam zhes tshig zur gyis dres pa dang / de'i lan du bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid chags pa ma mchis pa nyid lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the Teacher asks Mañjuśrī, “Have you attained nonattachment?” and Mañjuśrī replies, “Blessed One, if I myself were nonattached, what would there be for me to attain that is nonattached?”

original: bdag nyid chags pa ma mchis pa nyid lags na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid chags pa ma mchis pa nyid lags na zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “If I myself were nonattached” means that all things have the characteristic of nonattachment.

original: de bas na yang lan cig chags pa ma mchis pa thob par bgyir ci mchis /
analyzed: de bas na yang lan cig chags pa ma mchis pa thob par bgyir ci mchis /
translated: “What would there be for me to attain that is nonattached?” means that there is nothing to attain that is nonattached.

original: de ni shes bya la chags pa'i dri ma med pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes bya la chags pa'i dri ma med pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “That is the wisdom that is free from the stain of attachment to objects of knowledge.

original: sa bcu pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod ci byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gam zhes dris te gal te bdag nyid chags pa med pa yin par khas len na zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod ci byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gam zhes dris te gal te bdag nyid chags pa med pa yin par khas len na zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: In order to divide the tenth stage, he asks, Mañjuśrī, are you seated at the site of awakening? If he accepts that he is without attachment, that is the intention.

original: de skad dris pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' brtson par bgyis na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa de nyid ston to //
analyzed: de skad dris pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' brtson par bgyis na bcom ldan 'das nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sa de nyid ston to //
translated: When asked that, he teaches that very stage with If I were to strive for the limit of reality, Bhagavān, you yourself... and so on.

original: de yang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa can zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob cing mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba @31a * //
analyzed: de yang dgos pa yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa can zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob cing mngon par shes pa chen po la kun tu rmongs pa dang / gsang ba @31a * //
translated: Moreover, he has attained śamatha and vipaśyanā that have the complete accomplishment of the purpose as their object and has abandoned the confusion about the great superknowledges and the confusion about engaging in subtle secrets.

original: phra mo la 'jug pa'i kun tu rmongs pa spangs pa yin te gang gis phyin ci log thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas ngan len gyi tshogs spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phra mo la 'jug pa'i kun tu rmongs pa spangs pa yin te gang gis phyin ci log thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas ngan len gyi tshogs spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he has abandoned the collection of the characteristics of all errors and the bad states,

original: 'di chos kyi sku yongs su thob po zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di chos kyi sku yongs su thob po zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: it is said that he has attained the dharmakāya.

original: bag la nyal lhag ma tsam lus pa ni gang spangs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal lhag ma tsam lus pa ni gang spangs pas shin tu rnam par dag pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The remaining latent impressions are what is to be abandoned, and by abandoning them, one becomes a Tathāgata, who is completely pure.

original: byang chub kyi snying po zhes bya ba 'di ni byang chub kyang yin snying po yang yin pas byang chub kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po zhes bya ba 'di ni byang chub kyang yin snying po yang yin pas byang chub kyi snying po'o //
translated: The “seat of enlightenment” is the seat of enlightenment because it is both enlightenment and a seat.

original: gnas ngan len rnam gsum spangs pa ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rnam gsum spangs pa ni byang chub bo //
translated: Enlightenment is the abandonment of the three kinds of negative reflex actions.

original: de yang pags pa la yod pa lta bu dang / sha la yod pa lta bu dang / rus pa la yod pa lta bur dbye'o //
analyzed: de yang pags pa la yod pa lta bu dang / sha la yod pa lta bu dang / rus pa la yod pa lta bur dbye'o //
translated: Moreover, it is divided into that which is like skin, that which is like flesh, and that which is like bone.

original: de la chos dang gang zag la mngon bar zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len la sogs pa rab tu dag pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams sgro btags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir pags pa la yod pa lta bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la chos dang gang zag la mngon bar zhen pa'i kun du rmongs pa dang / ngan song ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i kun tu rmongs pa dang / de'i gnas ngan len la sogs pa rab tu dag pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams sgro btags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir pags pa la yod pa lta bu nyid yin no //
translated: The obscurations that are the antitheses of the purification of the latter, such as the addictions of the evil destinies, are like the skin because they are external to the nature of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: mtshan ma la dbang ba'i kun tu rmongs pa dang de'i gnas ngan len la sogs pas brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi bstan par gyur pa'i phyir sha la yod pa lta bu
analyzed: mtshan ma la dbang ba'i kun tu rmongs pa dang de'i gnas ngan len la sogs pas brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi bstan par gyur pa'i phyir sha la yod pa lta bu
translated: The obscurations that are the antitheses of the three stages of the eighth, etc., which are due to the addictions of the control of signs and their negative reflex actions, etc., are like the flesh because they are not manifest in the nature of the mental consciousness.

original: yin no // bag chags ni sa bon du gyur pa nyid kyis kun gzhi la gnas pa'i phyir rus pa la yod pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yin no // bag chags ni sa bon du gyur pa nyid kyis kun gzhi la gnas pa'i phyir rus pa la yod pa lta bu yin no //
translated: The instinct is like the bones because it is located in the storeconsciousness, being a seed.

original: pags pa la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pas ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bdun yin no //
analyzed: pags pa la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pas ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bdun yin no //
translated: The seven stages beginning with the stage of bright insight are due to the elimination of the inauspicious tendencies that are as if they were on the skin.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum ni sha la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa gsum ni sha la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pa'o //
translated: The three stages beginning with the eighth stage are due to the elimination of the inauspicious tendencies that are as if they were in the flesh.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rus pa la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rus pa la yod pa lta bu'i gnas ngan len spangs pa ste /
translated: The stage of the Tathāgata is due to the elimination of the inauspicious tendencies that are as if they were in the bones.

original: des na byang chub 'di mchog yin pa'i phyir snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byang chub 'di mchog yin pa'i phyir snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this enlightenment is called the core because it is the best.

original: de thob par byed pa'i sa gzhi yang de'i sgra yin bar gdul bya rnams de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i sa gzhi yang de'i sgra yin bar gdul bya rnams de ltar mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ground that causes one to attain that is also called its core, because those to be trained conceive of it in that way.

original: de la byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs te /
translated: There, the one who is seated at the core of enlightenment,🔽who is renowned as having conquered the demons, is not present.

original: bdud bcom pa dang ldan par grags pa dag bzhugs pa mi mnga' na ci bdag kyang mchis par bgyid dam /
analyzed: bdud bcom pa dang ldan par grags pa dag bzhugs pa mi mnga' na ci bdag kyang mchis par bgyid dam /
translated: How can I be present?

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' brtson par bgyis na zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje'i @31b gdan la 'dug pa la sogs pa phyin ci log yin bar bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' brtson par bgyis na zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje'i @31b gdan la 'dug pa la sogs pa phyin ci log yin bar bstan te /
translated: By this he shows that sitting on the vajra seat and so forth are erroneous.

original: don dam par ni gdan dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni gdan dang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: For ultimately, there is no sitting on a seat, going, coming, and so forth.

original: des na phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku ni gang du yang bzhugs pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des na phyin ci log thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku ni gang du yang bzhugs pa la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma Body, which is characterized by the abandonment of all error, does not exist as any kind of dwelling and so forth.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de dag gi tshig bla dags zhes yang dag pa'i mtha'i sgra'i don dris pa dang lan du /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de dag gi tshig bla dags zhes yang dag pa'i mtha'i sgra'i don dris pa dang lan du /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he asks about the meaning of the term limit of reality, and in reply

original: bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bgyi ba de ni 'jig tshogs kyi tshig bla dags lags so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bgyi ba de ni 'jig tshogs kyi tshig bla dags lags so zhes gsol to //
translated: he says, Blessed One, that which is called the limit of reality is a term for the perishable collection.

original: 'jig tshogs dang yang dag pa'i mtha' gnyis ni phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gal bas shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang yang dag pa'i mtha' gnyis ni phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gal bas shin tu tha dad pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: The two, the perishable collection and the reality limit, are contradictory because of having the character of error and non-error, and so it is not reasonable that they be identical, because they are very different.

original: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to teach that,

original: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
translated: it was asked, “Mañjuśrī, what do you think when you say that?”🔽In reply,

original: lan du ; bcom ldan 'das 'jig tshogs de ni ma mchis pa ste zhes gsol to //
analyzed: lan du ; bcom ldan 'das 'jig tshogs de ni ma mchis pa ste zhes gsol to //
translated: “Blessed One, that perishable collection does not exist.”

original: sgro 'dogs shing yongs su brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs shing yongs su brtags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a superimposition and a conceptualization.

original: med pa ni mu stegs can dang nyan thos kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag go snyam pa'i yul rang dbang can gyi bdag dang phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni mu stegs can dang nyan thos kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag go snyam pa'i yul rang dbang can gyi bdag dang phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The non-existent is the object of the independent self imagined by the tīrthikas and śrāvakas, and it has the character of the aggregates and so on.

original: rang dbang can gyi bdag la sogs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa ni med pa nyid du rigs na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kho na ji ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang dbang can gyi bdag la sogs pa ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir mu stegs can gyis yongs su brtags pa ni med pa nyid du rigs na phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kho na ji ltar med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Since the independent self and so on are not perceived, it is reasonable that they do not exist, as imagined by the tīrthikas. But how can the characteristics of the aggregates and so on be nonexistent?

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs ma lags pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs ma lags pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The perishing collection is not.”

original: da ltar byung ba'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid du bdag dang gzhan gyis nges par ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid du bdag dang gzhan gyis nges par ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its present intrinsic reality is not ascertained by self or other.

original: rgyu gang nas kyang de ni mi 'pho la 'bras bu gang du yang rnam par 'pho pa yang ma lags so //
analyzed: rgyu gang nas kyang de ni mi 'pho la 'bras bu gang du yang rnam par 'pho pa yang ma lags so //
translated: It does not transfer from any cause, nor does it transfer to any result.

original: des na dus gsum mi dmigs pas de ltar yongs su brtags pa'i lus chos can ni 'jig tshogs ma yin bar grub bo //
analyzed: des na dus gsum mi dmigs pas de ltar yongs su brtags pa'i lus chos can ni 'jig tshogs ma yin bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since the three times are not perceived, the body that is imagined in that way is established as not being the perishing collection.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa gang yin pa yod pa ma yin pa 'jig tshogs dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa gang yin pa yod pa ma yin pa 'jig tshogs dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid de ni yang dag pa'i mtha' yin te /
translated: The equality of the perception and nonperception of the perishing collection, which does not exist in that way, is the perfect end.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the unmistaken nature.

original: 'di nyid chos kyi sku yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid chos kyi sku yin no //
translated: This is the Dharma Body.

original: bsgom pa'i lam bstan zin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam bstan zin te /
translated: The path of cultivation has been explained.

original: de'i dmigs @32a * //
analyzed: de'i dmigs @32a * //
translated: Its object is the limit of reality,

original: pa ni dngos po'i mtha' dang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams yin no //
analyzed: pa ni dngos po'i mtha' dang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan rnams yin no //
translated: the image with conceptualization, and the image without conceptualization.

original: sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dmigs pa ni mthar phyin par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir dgos pa yongs su grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i dmigs pa ni mthar phyin par gnas pa yin pa'i phyir dgos pa yongs su grub pa yin no ;
translated: The object of the tenth stage and of the Tathāgata is the perfected state, because it is the ultimate establishment.

original: / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam 'bras bur gyur pa gnyis kyi 'og tu /
analyzed: / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam 'bras bur gyur pa gnyis kyi 'og tu /
translated: Then again, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said this to the Blessed One, and so on. After the path of seeing and the path of cultivation, which are the two results,

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa mos pa gsum bstan pa'i skabs la bab ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa mos pa gsum bstan pa'i skabs la bab ste /
translated: the time has come to explain the three kinds of aspiration that are their causes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod pa'i rjes la lam mkhyen pa la sogs pa ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brjod pa'i rjes la lam mkhyen pa la sogs pa ston pa bzhin no //
translated: and after the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of paths, etc.

original: gang yang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan dang / de dang rjes su mthun par brgyad stong pa rgya cher 'grel pa las kyang mos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin bar bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan dang / de dang rjes su mthun par brgyad stong pa rgya cher 'grel pa las kyang mos pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin bar bstan to //
translated: Also, the Ornament of Clear Realization and the commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines in accordance with it teach that interest is the path of meditation.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te 'di ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te 'di ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: That is not reasonable, because the Definitive Commentary on the Intention teaches:

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: “On the level of practicing with interest, there are the perfections.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bdun la ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bdun la ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel ba'o //
translated: On the seven, beginning with the Joyous, there is the increase of the perfections.

original: brgyad pa la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa la sogs pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o //
translated: On the eighth and so forth, there are the great perfections.”

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang de bzhin gshegs pa bdun skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa la sogs pa'i mdo las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod dang de bzhin gshegs pa bdun skye ba 'byung ba bstan pa la sogs pa'i mdo las rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be understood from the noble Aksayamatinirdesa, the Bodhisattvapitaka, and the Sutra Teaching the Appearance of the Seven Tathagatas.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: And also the Madhyantavibhanga states:

original: dbang po dang ni stobs rnams la //
analyzed: dbang po dang ni stobs rnams la //
translated: The faculties and powers

original: nges 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: nges 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
translated: are the two sets of factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa la 'jug pa dang / sa la 'jug pa dang / bstan pa rgyas pa la sogs pa las kyang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang / theg pa chen po bsdus pa dang / theg pa chen po'i chos mngon pa la 'jug pa dang / sa la 'jug pa dang / bstan pa rgyas pa la sogs pa las kyang rig par bya ste /
translated: And likewise, it should be understood from the Bodhisattvabhumi, the Mahayanasa. graha, the Abhisamayanarayana, the Bodhisattvabhumi, the Vastudharaṇi, etc.

original: 'phros pa gtang ngo //
analyzed: 'phros pa gtang ngo //
translated: The digression is concluded.

original: mos pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mos pa de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: That faith is threefold:

original: rang gi don dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don dang ste gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: rang gi don dang / rang dang gzhan gyi don dang ste gzhan gyi don to //
translated: for one's own benefit, for the benefit of oneself and others, and for the benefit of others.

original: de la rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas de dag ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba lags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de la rang gi don gyi dbang du byas nas de dag ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba lags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: Among them, from the point of view of one's own benefit, it is said that they are certain to become enlightened.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are certain to become enlightened in unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: shes @32b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: shes @32b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di thos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: lam gnyis kyi mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa gong du gsungs pa 'di thos pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam gnyis kyi mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa gong du gsungs pa 'di thos pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Having heard this teaching of the perfection of wisdom, the characteristic of the two paths, which was taught above, is to make it present through the knowledge that arises from hearing.

original: mos pa ni 'di ni de kho na yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin cing khong du chud nas rang gi don gyi ched du sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: mos pa ni 'di ni de kho na yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par 'dzin cing khong du chud nas rang gi don gyi ched du sgrub par byed do //
translated: Faith is to ascertain and understand that this is the way it is, not otherwise, and to practice for the sake of one's own goal.

original: mi skrag pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi skrag pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Fearlessness, etc. have been explained.

original: nges pa ni gdon mi za bar byang chub kyi snod du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni gdon mi za bar byang chub kyi snod du gyur pa'o //
translated: Certainty is to become an unquestionable vessel for enlightenment.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'dir ni byang chub thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du shin tu bstan la /
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub thob par byed pa'i thabs kyi rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du shin tu bstan la /
translated: Here, the essence of the means for attaining enlightenment is taught just as it is.

original: de thos nas yang dag par khong du chud pa'i sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes kyi gnas skabs dang / go rims bzhin du skrag pa dang / dngang ba dang dngang bar 'gyur ba med pas na mos pa yid la byed pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de thos nas yang dag par khong du chud pa'i sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / rjes kyi gnas skabs dang / go rims bzhin du skrag pa dang / dngang ba dang dngang bar 'gyur ba med pas na mos pa yid la byed pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Having heard it, one is not frightened, terrified, or seized with horror, respectively, in the situations of the preparation, the actual action, and the conclusion, and so one has the powerful mental attention of devotion.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa la de las gong nas gong du yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag las rim gyis goms pa yod na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa la de las gong nas gong du yongs su gyur pa'i bye brag las rim gyis goms pa yod na shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should understand that, without doubt, the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action out of faith, who is endowed with the mental attentions, who is engaged in the cultivation of the transcendences, and who is engaged in the cultivation of the mental attentions, is in the process of establishing the instinct for the concordant and evolutionary results, and is gradually progressing to the state of complete purification, through the differences in the process of purification.

original: de bas na de ni nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that the bodhisattva is certain.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the aims of self and other,🔽they are close to enlightenment.

original: de dag ni byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub la nye bar gyur pa lags so zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po gsum pa /
translated: The Stages of the Path to Enlightenment

original: 'dis ni rang gi don la mos pa'i 'bras bu nges par gyur ba yin pas 'di khyad par du gsungs te ;
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi don la mos pa'i 'bras bu nges par gyur ba yin pas 'di khyad par du gsungs te ;
translated: This is a special mention of the result of devotion to one's own aim, since it is certain.

original: /'di ltar 'di la ni gzhan gyi don yod pa'i phyir dang / byams pa la sogs pa lhag par che ba dang ldan zhing bdag tu 'dzin pa yang snga ma bas chung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: /'di ltar 'di la ni gzhan gyi don yod pa'i phyir dang / byams pa la sogs pa lhag par che ba dang ldan zhing bdag tu 'dzin pa yang snga ma bas chung ba nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, since there is the aim of others here, and since love, etc. are possessed in a greater degree, and since the grasping of self is less than before,

original: des na de byang chub la nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de byang chub la nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: therefore, he is near to enlightenment.

original: gtan tshigs gang gis she na /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gis she na /
translated: By what reason?

original: bcom ldan 'das gang chos de dag rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang chos de dag rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Lord has said, He who realizes those dharmas...

original: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes so //
translated: Enlightenment is the knowledge of destruction and of non-arising.

original: mchog ni dam pa'o //
analyzed: mchog ni dam pa'o //
translated: Supreme is the highest.

original: 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said:🔽The knowledge of destruction and of non-arising

original: dri ma rnams ni zad pa dang // mi skye shes pa byang chub bstan //🔽zad pa med dang mi skye'i phyir //
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni zad pa dang // mi skye shes pa byang chub bstan // zad pa med dang mi skye'i phyir //
translated: is taught as enlightenment.
Because of the absence of destruction and of non-arising,

original: rims bzhin du de rtogs bya //
analyzed: rims bzhin du de rtogs bya //
translated: one should realize them in order.

original: gang chos zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang ba rnams so //
analyzed: gang chos zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor snang ba rnams so //
translated: That which is called “phenomenon” is the individual appearances of form, etc.

original: de dag rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: “Realizing those” is thorough knowledge as it is.

original: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthun pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mthun pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “realizing” has the sense of “in accordance with.”

original: byang chub de nyid mos pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa nyid du yod pas na nye bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub de nyid mos pa yid la byed pa'i dmigs pa nyid du yod pas na nye bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: That enlightenment itself is proximate because it exists as the object of mental attention that is devoted to it.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the benefit of others,

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that “they should be seen as buddhahood.”

original: byams pa la sogs pa 'phel bas gzhan gyi don la mos pa gcig tu yid la byed pa che ba dang ches che bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / rang gi don yid la byed pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa 'phel bas gzhan gyi don la mos pa gcig tu yid la byed pa che ba dang ches che bar gyur pa'i phyir dang / rang gi don yid la byed pa kun tu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the increase of love, etc., there is the mental attention of devotion to the benefit of others, which becomes greater and greater, and because of the non-occurrence of mental attention to one’s own benefit.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang / phrin las las zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang / phrin las las zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “should be seen as buddhahood itself” is the cause, and the phrase “in terms of activity” should be understood as the result.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa yid la byed pa rgyu dang gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu dang gnyis yod du zin kyang 'on kyang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa yid la byed pa rgyu dang gzhan gyi don byed pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu dang gnyis yod du zin kyang 'on kyang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Although there are two—the mental activity of conviction in the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause, and the characteristic of the result, which is the performance of benefit for others—still, it is not a real entity.

original: mos par byed pa dag la sangs rgyas su blta ba mi rigs so zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: mos par byed pa dag la sangs rgyas su blta ba mi rigs so zhes dogs pa la /
translated: In response to the doubt that it is not reasonable to see the buddhas in those who are cultivating conviction,

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de ni dam par na skye ba ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su sangs rgyas zhes bgyi ba de ni dam par na skye ba ma mchis pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: the text says, “The term ‘buddha’ is a designation for the ultimate non-arising.”

original: dngos su skye ba med pa dang skye ba med par shes pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas yin te /
analyzed: dngos su skye ba med pa dang skye ba med par shes pa med pa'i tshig bla dgas yin te /
translated: It is a designation for the non-arising of real entities and for the non-arising of the cognition of non-arising.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa de dag gis 'di la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa de dag gis 'di la yod pa yin no //
translated: For those who have conceptual thoughts, it exists.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni lhag mthong yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa ni lhag mthong yin no //
translated: The object of the reflection of conceptualization is insight.

original: zhi gnas la ltos nas ni rnam par mi rtog pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas la ltos nas ni rnam par mi rtog pa yang yin te /
translated: In relation to serenity, it is non-conceptual,

original: de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its object is the reflection of non-conceptualization.

original: de bas na de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni sangs rgyas nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they should be viewed as Buddhahood.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bshad zin to //
translated: The factors of enlightenment have been explained.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa brjod pa brtson ba ni de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la sring mo dmigs pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa brjod pa brtson ba ni de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la sring mo dmigs pa med pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The statement of their object is: Then the sister, through non-objectification...

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa nas so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa nas so //
translated: Then means immediately after.

original: yang gi sgra ni tshig gi rgyan no //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni tshig gi rgyan no //
translated: The word again is an ornament of the verse.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po la brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po la brjod do //
translated: Non-objectification is said to be for the great bodhisattvas.

original: 'og nas @33b 'chad pa 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'og nas @33b 'chad pa 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: What is explained below is addressed as follows:

original: de dag ni so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnams la lhag par dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnams la lhag par dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not focus on the virtues and nonvirtues of ordinary beings and so on.

original: dmigs par mi bgyid do //
analyzed: dmigs par mi bgyid do //
translated: They do not focus on them.

original: de ston pa ni gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ston pa ni gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mos te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The teaching of that is “Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom, aspire to it…” and so on.

original: de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni bshad zin to //
translated: That has already been explained.

original: 'dir dogs pa la gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir dogs pa la gtan tshigs su bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here, the reason for the doubt is stated with “Bhagavan, it is because…” and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: “Nonapprehending” is the predicate.

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni don la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni don la sogs pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i chos can no //
translated: “All phenomena” is the subject, which appears as the entities of objects and so on.

original: ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma mchis pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Because they do not exist” is the reason.

original: 'di grub pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di grub pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The proof of that has already been explained earlier,

original: phyis kyang rgyas par ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang rgyas par ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: and later it will be taught extensively.

original: da ni mos pa rnam pa gsum la yang bstod pa dang rab tu bstod pa dang bsngags par bya ba'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: da ni mos pa rnam pa gsum la yang bstod pa dang rab tu bstod pa dang bsngags par bya ba'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to praise, praise well, and extol the three kinds of devoted interest, the Lord says to the Venerable Subhuti, “Just so, just so!

original: 'dir sh'a ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa ni 'dir sngar smos pa nyid kyis na sngar zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa yongs su gyur pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir sh'a ra dva ti'i bu la bka' stsal pa ni 'dir sngar smos pa nyid kyis na sngar zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa yongs su gyur pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag mngon du ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the Lord says to Subhuti because he was mentioned earlier, because he had previously assented, and because he had not yet manifested the transformation-result of devoted interest in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will surely become Buddhas!

original: mos pa'i sems bskyed pa kho na dag phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa yin par khyod kyis shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni bzang po'i dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / zhi ba'i shugs dang / 'jam dpal la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: mos pa'i sems bskyed pa kho na dag phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa yin par khyod kyis shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni bzang po'i dpal gzhon nur gyur pa dang / zhi ba'i shugs dang / 'jam dpal la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that the roots of virtue of those who have generated the mind of faith are fully ripened, like those of Bhadrapāla, the youth, Śāntendriya, Mañjuśrī, and so on.
