original: spyi bos len pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa shin tu yongs su smin pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi bos len pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa shin tu yongs su smin pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Taking it on the head means having the distinction of extremely ripened faith and so on.

original: de la 'dir bstod pa ni de dang de dag ni sbyin bdag dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir bstod pa ni de dang de dag ni sbyin bdag dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Here, the praise is they become excellent givers and so on.

original: de dang de dag ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i tshul gyis bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de dang de dag ni zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba gzhan rnam par bcad pa'i tshul gyis bstod pa'o //
translated: Here, they is a praise by way of excluding other applications.

original: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa ni zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa dang / chos kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There, giving is threefold by the distinctions of material things, fearlessness, and the Dharma.

original: @34a * // de'i phyir tshig gsum dang go rims bzhin sbyar ro //
analyzed: @34a * // de'i phyir tshig gsum dang go rims bzhin sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, they are connected in order with the three phrases.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po bshad pa bzhin du gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po bshad pa bzhin du gnas skabs kyi bye brag tu gzhag ste /
translated: Or else, they are established as different stages, according to the explanation of the perfections, the proximate perfections, and the great perfections.

original: de la sbyin bdag dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la sbyin bdag dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la ni pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin no //
translated: Therein, one becomes a holy donor on the stage of action in faith, according to the perfections.

original: sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bdun la yin te /
analyzed: sbyin bdag khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bdun la yin te /
translated: One becomes an especially exalted donor on the seven stages beginning with the stage of joy,

original: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin no //🔽sbyin bdag chen por 'gyur ba ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bzhin no // sbyin bdag chen por 'gyur ba ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: according to the proximate perfections.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa gong ma bzhi'i tshe yin te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa gong ma bzhi'i tshe yin te /
translated: One becomes a great donor on the four higher stages beginning with the eighth stage, because of the attainment of acquiescence in the non-arising of dharmas.

original: skad cig ma gcig la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' med pa 'byam klas pa dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' med pa 'byam klas pa dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa dang tshad med pa la sogs pa thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: In a single instant, in order to accomplish all the perfections, the immeasurables, and so on, in the infinite, limitless world systems of the ten directions.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa chen po bzhin no //
translated: Like the great perfections.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de dang de dag ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de dang de dag ni tshul khrims phun sum tshogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Śāriputra, those are the perfections of morality, etc.

original: tshul khrims ni sdom pa dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sdom pa dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Morality is threefold, distinguished by the vows, gathering virtuous dharmas, and working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de bas na tshig gsum dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na tshig gsum dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is connected with the three phrases.

original: yang na gnas skabs kyi bye brag yin te /
analyzed: yang na gnas skabs kyi bye brag yin te /
translated: Or, it is a distinction of stages.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As before.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i 'bras bu la ltos nas de dang mthun pa'i tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyi lam rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i 'bras bu la ltos nas de dang mthun pa'i tshul khrims kyi yon tan gyi lam rnyed par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: In relation to the result of definite release, the path of the qualities of morality that accords with that is attained.

original: de dang de dag ni bzod pa'i mchog dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba las /
analyzed: de dang de dag ni bzod pa'i mchog dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba las /
translated: These are the supreme patience, and so on at length.

original: bzod pa yang sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bzod pa yang sdug bsngal dang du len pa dang / gnod pa la ji mi snyam pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Patience is threefold: patience in withstanding suffering, patience in enduring injuries, and patience in investigating the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus kyang go cha dang / dge ba la sbyor ba dang / sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang go cha dang / dge ba la sbyor ba dang / sems can gyi don la sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Exertion is threefold: armor-like exertion, exertion in application to virtue, and exertion in application to the welfare of beings.

original: bsam gtan ni zhi zhing rab tu zhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan ni zhi zhing rab tu zhi ste /
translated: Meditation is tranquil and very tranquil.

original: rnam par mi rtog cing nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur pa bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog cing nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi gnyen por gyur pa bde bar gnas pa'i bsam gtan dang / yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don mngon par sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: It is meditation on the blissful abiding that is the antidote to the afflictions and suffering, meditation on the clear manifestation of excellences, and meditation on the clear manifestation of the welfare of beings.

original: shes rab ni bden pa gnyis dang / sems can gyi don la @34b dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: shes rab ni bden pa gnyis dang / sems can gyi don la @34b dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Wisdom is threefold: wisdom in the two realities, and wisdom in the clear manifestation of the welfare of beings.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: drug po de dag bslab pa'i dngos //
analyzed: drug po de dag bslab pa'i dngos //
translated: These six are the actual trainings.

original: re re la yang rnam pa gsum //🔽sbyin pa la sogs rnam dag ni //
analyzed: re re la yang rnam pa gsum // sbyin pa la sogs rnam dag ni //
translated: Each has three aspects.🔽The five perfections other than giving

original: lnga dang bdun te gzhan dag yin //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lnga dang bdun te gzhan dag yin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: are the purity of giving, etc.

original: de bas na kun la yang dngos po ma yin par gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na kun la yang dngos po ma yin par gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since they are not real entities, the word “highest” is applied to all of them.

original: dam pa'i sgra sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i sgra sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word “highest” means “supreme.”

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni dmigs pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni dmigs pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Unsurpassed wisdom” means “without objective support.”

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: “Endowed” means “connected.”

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “One becomes” means “one certainly becomes.”

original: bstod pa 'di ni spro ba rgyas par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstod pa 'di ni spro ba rgyas par byed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This praise has the nature of expanding enthusiasm.

original: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la rnam pa thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la rnam pa thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: “Endowed with the highest of all aspects” means that the aspects are the elements leading to enlightenment, the immeasurables, etc.,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la thug pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa la thug pa'i bar yin no //
translated: up to the aspects of the knowledge of all the modes.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “supreme” is used because they are extremely pure.

original: rnam pa'i mchog de dag thams cad ldan zhing 'brel pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mchog de dag thams cad ldan zhing 'brel pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhing 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are endowed with all those supreme aspects and are connected with the knowledge of all aspects.🔽In some editions of the sutra, the following passage is found:

original: glegs bam kha cig las gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mos te //
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig las gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thos nas mos te //
translated: “Those who, having heard this perfection of wisdom,🔽are not frightened, not terrified, not fearful,

original: mi skrag mi dngang dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dang / de dag ni skrag pa med par sems can rnams la rab tu ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi skrag mi dngang dngang bar mi 'gyur ba de dang / de dag ni skrag pa med par sems can rnams la rab tu ston par 'gyur /
translated: they will teach it to beings without fear.

original: 'chad par 'gyur zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur zhes 'byung ste /
translated: They will explain it.”

original: des na gzhan gyi don la mos pa gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don la mos pa gsal ba yin te /
translated: This passage makes clear the interest in the welfare of others.

original: de drug ni bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: de drug ni bsngags pa yin no //
translated: These six are praise.

original: bstod pa dang rab tu bstod pa dang / bsngags pa 'di dag gi bye brag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bstod pa dang rab tu bstod pa dang / bsngags pa 'di dag gi bye brag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between praise, eulogy, and acclaim?

original: yon tan brjod pa ni bstod pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan brjod pa ni bstod pa'o //
translated: Eulogy is the expression of good qualities.

original: don gyi gzugs brnyan la sogs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas bsngags par byed pa'i bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: don gyi gzugs brnyan la sogs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas bsngags par byed pa'i bsngags pa ste /
translated: The praise that is praise in terms of abandoning the reflected image of the object, etc.

original: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las bstan to //
analyzed: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las bstan to //
translated: is taught in the Twenty-five Thousand and other works.

original: dmigs pa med par bstan pa'i dmigs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par bstan pa'i dmigs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the object of the teaching of non-apprehension,

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis don gyi dbang ci zhig mthong nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas dris so //
translated: Manjusri asked, “What is the meaning that you have seen, etc.?”

original: dris pa'i lan du /
analyzed: dris pa'i lan du /
translated: In reply,

original: gal te bdag byang chub tu zhugs na ni shes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rang dang yang dag pa'i byang chub dang yang dag par zhugs pa dang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir /🔽'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhi gnas @35a * //
analyzed: gal te bdag byang chub tu zhugs na ni shes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rang dang yang dag pa'i byang chub dang yang dag par zhugs pa dang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir / 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa zhi gnas @35a * //
translated: Subhuti said, “If I had entered into enlightenment, etc.

original: dang ; lhag mthong rnam par dag pa mthar phyin par bstan to //
analyzed: dang ; lhag mthong rnam par dag pa mthar phyin par bstan to //
translated: ” He taught the perfection of the insight and serenity that have as their object the mixed dharmas, because the thoughts of self, of perfect enlightenment, of perfect entry, and of desire do not arise.

original: 'dir dogs pa'i lan du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang lags pa de byang chub nyid do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir dogs pa'i lan du 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang lags pa de byang chub nyid do zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response to this doubt, it is said that “the youthful Manjushri is enlightenment itself.”

original: chos thams cad byang chub las tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad byang chub las tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that all phenomena are not a different nature from enlightenment.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: de bzhin nyid dang byang chub dang // mya ngan 'das dang gnas gyur la //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang byang chub dang // mya ngan 'das dang gnas gyur la //
translated: Suchness, enlightenment, nirvana, and transformation

original: chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rtogs pa yis //
translated: are the realization of all phenomena.

original: gzhol dang 'bab dang bab par gyur //
analyzed: gzhol dang 'bab dang bab par gyur //
translated: They are inclined, inclined toward, and inclined toward that.

original: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong 'di //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ni lhag mthong 'di //
translated: This serenity and insight

original: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa yin //
translated: are the objective reference of the integrated Dharma.

original: dang po dang ni gsum pa dang // tha ma gnyis la go rims bzhin //
analyzed: dang po dang ni gsum pa dang // tha ma gnyis la go rims bzhin //
translated: The first, the third, and the last two,

original: 'jug dang rab tu 'thob pa dang // de yi mthar phyin rgyal bas dgongs //
analyzed: 'jug dang rab tu 'thob pa dang // de yi mthar phyin rgyal bas dgongs //
translated: in order, are the intention of the Victor regarding engagement, attainment, and the perfection of that.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis re zhig bdag gi rang gi ngo bo dang chos thams cad kyang byang chub las tha dad ma yin par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis re zhig bdag gi rang gi ngo bo dang chos thams cad kyang byang chub las tha dad ma yin par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should cultivate the realization that one’s own nature and all phenomena are not different from enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo ni phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo ni phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The essence of enlightenment will be taught later.

original: 'dir dgyes nas legs so legs so zhes lan gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir dgyes nas legs so legs so zhes lan gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Here, he said “Excellent, excellent” twice, out of delight.

original: dgyes pa'i gtan tshigs su 'jam dpal khyod zab mo zab pa'i gnas 'di lta bu 'di ston pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dgyes pa'i gtan tshigs su 'jam dpal khyod zab mo zab pa'i gnas 'di lta bu 'di ston pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The reason for his delight is stated: “Mañjuśrī, you have taught this profound subject matter.”

original: zab mo zab pa zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: zab mo zab pa zhes bya ba ni sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang bral ba rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: “Profound” is twofold: it is free from the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni phyogs la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni phyogs la bya'o //
translated: “Subject matter” refers to the topic.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni byang chub dang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba ni byang chub dang tha dad pa med pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: “Such as this” refers to the essence of enlightenment, which is not different from the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs par gyur pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs par gyur pa bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “This” refers to the subject matter that is the object of observation of the bodhisattva’s meditative stabilization.

original: nges par ston pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'am nges pa las ston pa'o ;
analyzed: nges par ston pa zhes bya ba ni nges pa'am nges pa las ston pa'o ;
translated: “Taught” means that it is taught from the perspective of certainty.

original: /'di ltar khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa ste /
analyzed: /'di ltar khyod ni sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa ste /
translated: Thus, you have served the victors of the past.

original: mi dmigs par tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa lta zhig ces bya ba ni thabs su gyur pa'i rnam pa gang gis ji ltar khyod sngon gyi rgyal ba 'brug gi sgra dbyangs la sogs pa la bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: mi dmigs par tshangs par spyod pa yun ring du spyad pa lta zhig ces bya ba ni thabs su gyur pa'i rnam pa gang gis ji ltar khyod sngon gyi rgyal ba 'brug gi sgra dbyangs la sogs pa la bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: The phrase for a long time, without apprehending anything, you have practiced pure conduct refers to the aspect that is the means by which you have previously engaged in the perfection of wisdom.

original: nyan pa dang len pa dang 'dzin pa dang ston pa la sbyor ba'i rnam pa gtso bor byas te /
analyzed: nyan pa dang len pa dang 'dzin pa dang ston pa la sbyor ba'i rnam pa gtso bor byas te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the principal aspect of the practice of listening, receiving, holding, and teaching.

original: dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs pa bsgrubs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge pa'i rtsa ba bskyed pa la sogs pa bsgrubs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase you have accomplished the generation of roots of virtue and so forth refers to this.🔽The phrase you have attained the purity of the realm of phenomena refers to the perfection of wisdom, which is the purity of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad bdag med cing mi dmigs par tshangs pa byang chub ste gang dang ldan bas bcom ldan 'das tshangs pa @35b zhes brjod pa de'i don du gang gis spyod pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de yun ring po bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi🔽bye ma 'bum phrag grangs med pa bdun snyed du 'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med cing mi dmigs par tshangs pa byang chub ste gang dang ldan bas bcom ldan 'das tshangs pa @35b zhes brjod pa de'i don du gang gis spyod pa bsgom pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de yun ring po bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi🔽bye ma 'bum phrag grangs med pa bdun snyed du 'am /
translated: The phrase you have attained the purity of the realm of phenomena refers to the perfection of wisdom, which is the purity of the realm of phenomena.

original: dus ring por spyod pa lta zhig de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: dus ring por spyod pa lta zhig de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: khyod kyis ston par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod kyis ston par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: you would not be able to teach.

original: de bas na de lta bur 'gyur ba'i 'dod pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas rnams la bya ba sgom pa la sogs pa bya dgos so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bur 'gyur ba'i 'dod pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas rnams la bya ba sgom pa la sogs pa bya dgos so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who desire to be like that should perform the duties to the Buddhas, such as meditation, and so on.

original: de la rlom sems spong bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la rlom sems spong bar byed pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the elimination of conceit is

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag mi dmigs pa spyod pa lags na ni chos thob pa nyid du 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te bdag mi dmigs pa spyod pa lags na ni chos thob pa nyid du 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Blessed One, if one practices without apprehending a self, then one will attain the Dharma.”🔽The elimination of non-apprehension is

original: chos spyod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid bdag la sogs pa thob pa nyid du rnyed pa nyid du 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya bas mi dmigs pa sel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos spyod par byed pa'i mtshan nyid bdag la sogs pa thob pa nyid du rnyed pa nyid du 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya bas mi dmigs pa sel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “One will attain the very attainment of the Dharma, which is characterized by practicing the Dharma.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te bdag mi dmigs par spyod pa lags na ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te bdag mi dmigs par spyod pa lags na ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: “If one practices without apprehending a self.”

original: mi dmigs par spyod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bstan te /
analyzed: mi dmigs par spyod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bstan te /
translated: That which is practiced without apprehension is taught in that way.

original: 'dis ni dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: This indicates the object.

original: des na dmigs pa dang spyod pa gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa dang spyod pa gnyis phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the object and the conduct are mutually exclusive,

original: spyod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams lhag par dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar mdor bstan pa de
analyzed: spyod pa byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de dag ni so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams lhag par dmigs par mi 'gyur ba lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar mdor bstan pa de
translated: it is said that this Dharma, which has the characteristic of conduct, does not exist.

original: dag rgyas par bstan cing chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa shin tu bsal ba'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod kyis nga'i nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag mthong ngam zhes dris te /
analyzed: dag rgyas par bstan cing chos can gyi rnam par rtog pa shin tu bsal ba'i phyir 'jam dpal khyod kyis nga'i nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa 'di dag mthong ngam zhes dris te /
translated: The above was taught in brief, but now it is taught in detail, and in order to completely eliminate the conception of a subject, the Buddha asks, “Mañjuśrī, do you see my perfect śrāvakas?”

original: gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro zhing mchog tu sems rnam par grol ba 'byor pa mthong ngam zhes dris pa dang / gsol pa /
analyzed: gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro zhing mchog tu sems rnam par grol ba 'byor pa mthong ngam zhes dris pa dang / gsol pa /
translated: He asks, “Do you see those who follow what they have heard from others and are liberated in mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das mthong lags so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mthong lags so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Mañjuśrī replies, “Blessed One, I do see them.”

original: ji ltar ci 'dra bar mthong zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rnam pa 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ci 'dra bar mthong zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i rnam pa 'dri ba ste /
translated: This is an inquiry into the aspect of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i rnam pa gang yin ci 'dra ba zhes dris pa dang ; bcom ldan 'das ji ltar so so'i skye bor mi mthong ba dang zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rnam pa gang yin ci 'dra ba zhes dris pa dang ; bcom ldan 'das ji ltar so so'i skye bor mi mthong ba dang zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavån replied, “I do not see the ordinary worldling, and so on up to I do not see the arhat.

original: so sor 'gro bas nas so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: so sor 'gro bas nas so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The ordinary worldling is so called because he goes to each and every place.

original: slob pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa nas dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa la thug pa'i bar du bdun yin te /
analyzed: slob pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa nas dgra bcom pa la 'jug pa la thug pa'i bar du bdun yin te /
translated: The learner is the seven from the stream-enterer to the candidate for arhatship.

original: bslab par bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has something to learn.

original: @36a * // mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: @36a * // mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: The non-learner is the arhat.

original: bslab pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has completed his learning.

original: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnams la gcig pu'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang de las gzhan pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir de dag ma mthong ngo snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnams la gcig pu'i ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang de las gzhan pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir de dag ma mthong ngo snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: I do not see the ordinary worldling, the learner, or the one who has completed his learning, because I do not apprehend their individual natures, and because I do not see anything else arising from them.

original: mthong ba ma mchis ma mthong ba yang ma mchis pa de ltar mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang ma mthong bar rnam par rtog pa med par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: To say I see thus, meaning I see without the discrimination of seeing and not seeing, is the same as saying I see without the discrimination of seeing and not seeing.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //

original: yi ge kha cig las 'di ltar zhes mi 'byung gi bar du zhes 'byung ba de ni mthong ba'i rnam par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las 'di ltar zhes mi 'byung gi bar du zhes 'byung ba de ni mthong ba'i rnam par ston pa yin no //
translated: In some texts, the phrase “up to” does not occur, but only “thus.” That is a way of showing the vision.

original: mang du zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: mang du zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: “ Many” refers to the ordinary person.

original: nyung du zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: nyung du zhes bya ba ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'o //
translated: “ Few” refers to the learner and the adept.

original: dul ba yang zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba dang bral bas dul ba 'am dge ba bye brag tu gyur pas dul ba'o //
analyzed: dul ba yang zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba dang bral bas dul ba 'am dge ba bye brag tu gyur pas dul ba'o //
translated: “ Tamed” refers to the tamed one who is free from nonvirtue, or the tamed one who has a special virtue.

original: de las gzhan pa ni ma dul ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni ma dul ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the untamed one.

original: mang nyung gi tshad dang / dul ba dang ma dul ba'i bye brag tu yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: mang nyung gi tshad dang / dul ba dang ma dul ba'i bye brag tu yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: “ One does not see a difference in the amount, or in being tamed or untamed” up to that point.

analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang nyan thos kyi 'khor mthong ba bstan nas byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dris pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Having shown the vision of the retinue of ordinary people and śrāvakas, he asked about the retinue of bodhisattvas, and Mañjuśrī said,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i chos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the dharma called ‘bodhisattva’ is also thus and so forth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
translated: The practice of the bodhisattvas is fourfold:

original: go cha dang rab tu zhugs pa dang tshogs dang nges par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: go cha dang rab tu zhugs pa dang tshogs dang nges par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: armor, setting out, the collections, and definite emergence.

original: de la go cha lta bu sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yod pas byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba ji ltar yang rnam pa gang gis kyang mi @36b mthong ste /
analyzed: de la go cha lta bu sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas / 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yod pas byang chub sems dpa'o zhes bya ba ji ltar yang rnam pa gang gis kyang mi @36b mthong ste /
translated: Regarding that, the practice that is like armor is as follows:🔽Here, the bodhisattva is not seen in any way at all, since the bodhisattva exists only as an intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de'i chos can la rnam par bltas na mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de'i chos can la rnam par bltas na mi dmigs so zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: When one looks at the dharmin of the bodhisattva, it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar gang byang chub kyi ched du yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa dang / de bzhin du gang de'i tshogs la spyod pa dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub cing nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i chos dngos po ji ltar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa bdag gis mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar gang byang chub kyi ched du yang dag par rab tu zhugs pa dang / de bzhin du gang de'i tshogs la spyod pa dang / gang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub cing nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i chos dngos po ji ltar yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa bdag gis mthong ngo zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, one who has set out for enlightenment, and likewise one who practices its requisites, and one who is fully enlightened and delivers beings—one does not see any such thing as a real entity, in any way.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam par rtog pa 'di yang bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la rnam par rtog pa 'di yang bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel this conceptualization of the Tathāgata,🔽Mañjuśrī asked, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, have you seen the Tathāgata Śākyamuni or any other in any way?”

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa 'am gzhan la ji ltar mthong zhes dris pa dang / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu glang po che zhog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa 'am gzhan la ji ltar mthong zhes dris pa dang / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu glang po che zhog shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, put down that elephant!”

original: glang po che ni klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: glang po che ni klu'i rgyal po rgya mtsho la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Elephants” are the nāga kings Sāgara and so on.

original: de dag ni lo thog dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu skom pas gdungs pa rnam par 'joms par byed pa bdud rtsi'i ro 'bebs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin no //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyang srid pa dang longs spyod la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa rgyun gcod cing lha'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i bde pa'i rgyur gyur pa dge ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i ro 'bebs pa thun mong ma yin
analyzed: de dag ni lo thog dang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu skom pas gdungs pa rnam par 'joms par byed pa bdud rtsi'i ro 'bebs pa thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin no // bcom ldan 'das kyang srid pa dang longs spyod la mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa rgyun gcod cing lha'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i bde pa'i rgyur gyur pa dge ba'i lo tog phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i chos kyi bdud rtsi'i ro 'bebs pa thun mong ma yin
translated: They are the uncommon cause for the rain of the taste of the nectar that completely destroys the drought that torments those who are afflicted by thirst, the cause for the abundant harvest of crops and fruit.

original: pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The Bhagavān is also the uncommon cause for the rain of the taste of the nectar of the Dharma that creates the abundant harvest of virtue, the cause for the happiness of the lord of the gods and so on, the cause for severing the craving that delights in existence and resources.

original: de dang chos mthun pas klu chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pas klu chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the great nāga because he is similar to that.

original: de zhog shig ces bya ba ni ma bskul cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zhog shig ces bya ba ni ma bskul cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Do not release it” means do not incite it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i blo la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku snang ba nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo'i blo la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku snang ba nyid la bya ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is said to be the appearance of the Tathāgata’s body in the minds of beings to be tamed.

original: de nyid de bzhin nyid gsungs pas na ston pa po nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin par nges pa'i tshig gi don srid pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin nyid gsungs pas na ston pa po nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin par nges pa'i tshig gi don srid pa yin te /
translated: Since it is said to be thusness, it is the characteristic of the teacher himself.

original: rtsol zhing sgrol ba la sogs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dga' ba la yang brtson pa mi 'phrogs pas na /
analyzed: rtsol zhing sgrol ba la sogs pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dga' ba la yang brtson pa mi 'phrogs pas na /
translated: The meaning of the term is existence, because the superior intention to strive and liberate arises, and because one is not robbed of one's delight in striving.

original: glang po che chen po dang chos mthun pa'i phyir /🔽glang po che chen po ni bcom ldan 'das sam /
analyzed: glang po che chen po dang chos mthun pa'i phyir / glang po che chen po ni bcom ldan 'das sam /
translated: Because it is similar to a great elephant,

original: cang shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: cang shes pa la bya'o //
translated: a great elephant is either the Bhagavān or a thoroughbred.

original: de bskul ba ni dpyod pa'i dpyang thag la gdags pa ste /
analyzed: de bskul ba ni dpyod pa'i dpyang thag la gdags pa ste /
translated: That which is urged is tied to the rope of analysis.

original: 'di dgag pa ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i don la spro ba bskyed pa dang / @37a * //
analyzed: 'di dgag pa ni 'og nas 'chad pa'i don la spro ba bskyed pa dang / @37a * //
translated: Its prohibition is to generate enthusiasm for the meaning to be explained below,

original: gus pa dang rna ba gtod pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa dang rna ba gtod pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and to generate respect, focus the ears, and so on.

original: de bas na de ni sangs rgyas kyi dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de ni sangs rgyas kyi dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to realize the state of buddhahood,

original: dpyod par byed pa ni 'jam dpal sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dpyod par byed pa ni 'jam dpal sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The one who analyzes is the one who asks, What is the meaning of the term 'Manjusri Buddha'?

original: brjod par bya ba gang yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba gang yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the meaning of the term 'Manjusri Buddha'?

original: dris pa'i lan du btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dris pa'i lan du btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ces bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response, he says, Venerable Shariputra, what is the meaning of the term 'self'?

original: de la bdag ces bya ba de ni skye ba med pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba de ni skye ba med pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes gsol to //
translated: To that, he says, The term 'self' is the term for non-arising.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The entity called 'self' does not exist,

original: 'di ltar bdag 'di'i dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te med kyang yongs su brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag 'di'i dngos po cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te med kyang yongs su brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this self has no entity whatsoever. It does not exist, but it is imputed.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag 'di dang mtshungs par bstan nas khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag 'di dang mtshungs par bstan nas khyad par gyi gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Venerable Shariputra, it is so, and so on. Having taught that the self is similar to that, in order to teach the reason for the distinction, he says,

original: yang 'di lta ste sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang 'di lta ste sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Again, it is said, Thus, this so-called 'Buddha' is...

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dngos po med pa nyid du rnam pa gzhan gyis sdud par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba dngos po med pa nyid du rnam pa gzhan gyis sdud par byed do //
translated: Here, by thus, he includes the non-existence of the so-called Buddha in another way.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word again has the meaning of in another way.

original: gzhi ni dngos po la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi ni dngos po la bya ste /
translated: The basis is to be understood as the entity.

original: 'di ltar rtsol ba dang / dngos po dang / mtshan gzhi dang / gnas dang yongs su skyob pa rnams ni gzhi'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsol ba dang / dngos po dang / mtshan gzhi dang / gnas dang yongs su skyob pa rnams ni gzhi'i tshig yin no //
translated: Thus, effort, entity, basis of characteristics, abode, and protection are terms for the basis.

original: gzhi med pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i tshig bla dgas la bya ste /
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i tshig bla dgas so zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa'i tshig bla dgas la bya ste /
translated: The term without basis is to be understood as the term without entity.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa'i ngag 'di ni dngos po la brjod par grags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas zhes brjod pa'i ngag 'di ni dngos po la brjod par grags pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, this statement Buddha is not known to refer to an entity.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni tshig gis shes par bya dka' ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni tshig gis shes par bya dka' ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: “Buddhahood” is difficult to know through words, and so on.

original: 'di ltar de ni tshig gis sam ngag gis shes par khong du chud par bya dka' zhing sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni tshig gis sam ngag gis shes par khong du chud par bya dka' zhing sla ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is difficult to know, to understand, through words, through speech, and it is not easy.

original: gzhan la bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la bstan par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: It cannot be shown to others.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: The intention here is this:

original: ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / ngag dang de snang ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de las phyis rnam par rtog pa dang / bzhi po de dag ni rang rig pa tsam du @37b zad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngag kun nas slong bar byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / ngag dang de snang ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / de las phyis rnam par rtog pa dang / bzhi po de dag ni rang rig pa tsam du @37b zad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The conceptualization that motivates speech, the speech, the ear consciousness that appears as that, and the subsequent conceptualization from that—these four are mere self-awareness.

original: rang las gzhan pa dang ni gang du yang gang gi tshe ji ltar yang 'brel pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa dang ni gang du yang gang gi tshe ji ltar yang 'brel pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no connection whatsoever between anything other than itself and anything else.

original: de bas na tshig gis ni 'gal la ji ltar yang rtogs par mi byed na /
analyzed: de bas na tshig gis ni 'gal la ji ltar yang rtogs par mi byed na /
translated: Thus, since words contradict and do not cause understanding in any way,

original: gang gi phyir tshig gis sangs rgyas so zhes shes par bya sla bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig gis sangs rgyas so zhes shes par bya sla bar 'gyur /
translated: Why? Because it is easy to understand that the Buddha is to be known by means of words.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The term “Buddha” is a mere indication,

original: chos thams cad kyang tshig gis shes par bya sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang tshig gis shes par bya sla ba ma yin no //
translated: for all dharmas are not to be known by means of words.

original: dngos po'i yang dag pa nyid bstan pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i byis pa rnams sgra dang don rtogs pa dang / rtogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'di la log pa'i nga rgyal byed pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dngos po'i yang dag pa nyid bstan pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i blo dang ldan pa'i byis pa rnams sgra dang don rtogs pa dang / rtogs par byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'di la log pa'i nga rgyal byed pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The fools who are averse to the teaching of the reality of things are merely indulging in false pride when they claim that the word and its referent are the characterized and the characteristic.

original: rab rib can rnams kyis zla ba gnyis su mthong ba na /
analyzed: rab rib can rnams kyis zla ba gnyis su mthong ba na /
translated: When those with eye disease see two moons,

original: zla ba gnyis rtogs pa dang / rtogs par byed par byas pa bzhin no //🔽bdag gis brjod du med pa grub pa las /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis rtogs pa dang / rtogs par byed par byas pa bzhin no // bdag gis brjod du med pa grub pa las /
translated: they claim that the two moons are the characterized and the characteristic.🔽I have already extensively established this point in my Establishment of the Inexpressible.

original: don 'di rgyas par gtan la phab zin pas 'dir gzhung mang du dogs nas ma spros so //
analyzed: don 'di rgyas par gtan la phab zin pas 'dir gzhung mang du dogs nas ma spros so //
translated: Fearing excessive length, I will not elaborate here.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tshig kyang rgyud thams cad la nges pa med par gsal la rab tu so sor snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang 'di ni tshig go zhes brtag cing dpyad de gtan la dbab par dka' ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tshig kyang rgyud thams cad la nges pa med par gsal la rab tu so sor snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang 'di ni tshig go zhes brtag cing dpyad de gtan la dbab par dka' ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a word is clear and appears individually to all mindstreams without certainty, and its own nature is difficult to determine by investigating and analyzing, thinking, “This is a word.”

original: mi nus te /
analyzed: mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible.

original: 'di dang ni rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bor gtogs pa'i tshig dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / so sor snang ba rtog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dang ni rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bor gtogs pa'i tshig dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / so sor snang ba rtog par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to a word that belongs to the nature of conceptualization, and because it does not conceptualize what appears individually.🔽What need is there to mention the Buddha?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba lta ci smos te zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig las shin tu ring zhing tha dad par bstan te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba lta ci smos te zhes bya ba 'dis ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig las shin tu ring zhing tha dad par bstan te /
translated: This shows that the word “Buddha” is very far from and different from a word,

original: so so rang gis rig pa nyid yin pas na gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa nyid yin pas na gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the individual’s own knowledge and is not the domain of others.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes de skad smra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes de skad smra ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here, the other reason is stated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is the meaning of the word ‘buddha’?”

original: gang yang dag par ma grub pa ni rgyu de med na de las 'ongs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang dag par ma grub pa ni rgyu de med na de las 'ongs par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not established is not tenable as having come from that cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma skyes pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is unborn.

original: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa ni dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa ni dri za'i grong khyer bzhin du skye bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has not come from anywhere is not tenable as arisen, like a gandharva city.

original: ma skyes na ji ltar 'gag ste 'gag pa'i sngon rol du skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes na ji ltar 'gag ste 'gag pa'i sngon rol du skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is unborn, how can it cease? Because arising is prior to cessation.

original: gang chos gang dang yang mi ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba @38a * //
analyzed: gang chos gang dang yang mi ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba @38a * //
translated: It is not associated with any dharma at all.

original: dang gnas pa dang / 'phel ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba dang zad pa dang 'jig pa gang yang rung ba re re 'am /
analyzed: dang gnas pa dang / 'phel ba dang yongs su 'gyur ba dang zad pa dang 'jig pa gang yang rung ba re re 'am /
translated: Arising, enduring, increasing, transforming, exhausting, and disintegrating, each or all of them,

original: 'dus pa dang mi ldan zhing ma 'brel ba de'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa dang mi ldan zhing ma 'brel ba de'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the designation for what is not assembled and not connected.

original: sngar ni tshig la dngos po med par bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni tshig la dngos po med par bstan to //
translated: Previously, it was taught that words do not exist as things.

original: da ni don la ngag med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni don la ngag med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that meaning is not speech,

original: 'di la tshig dbyer med pa ci yang med la tshig med pa ste btsun pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di la tshig dbyer med pa ci yang med la tshig med pa ste btsun pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Here, there is no word at all that is indivisible, and there is no word that is divisible.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di la tshig 'dis rtogs par byed pa don khong du chud par byed pa'i tshig rjod par byed pa'i bye brag ci yang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di la tshig 'dis rtogs par byed pa don khong du chud par byed pa'i tshig rjod par byed pa'i bye brag ci yang med do //
translated: In this, the Blessed Buddha has no words whatsoever that express the distinctions of the speech that causes the understanding of the meaning that is to be understood.

original: tshig dbyer med pa tshig gi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig dbyer med pa tshig gi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest indivisible word, nor is there a general characteristic of words.

original: de bas na tshig med pa ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na tshig med pa ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “There is no word.”

original: 'di la tshig gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'di la tshig gi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since the general and specific characteristics of words do not exist here,

original: bcom ldan 'das la tshig gis thog du mi phebs brjod du mi rung ba de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas glo bur ba ming rjod par byed pa sgro btags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la tshig gis thog du mi phebs brjod du mi rung ba de la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas glo bur ba ming rjod par byed pa sgro btags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is not to be approached by way of words, and it is not proper to say of him, “The word ‘Buddha’ is a mere adventitious designation, a mere name, a mere expression.”

original: skabs mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: skabs mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The section is concluded.

original: skabs kyang ci zhe na /
analyzed: skabs kyang ci zhe na /
translated: What is the section?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the vision of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir btsun ba shar dva ti'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa tshol bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btsun ba shar dva ti'i bu de bzhin gshegs pa tshol bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, “The one who wishes to seek the Tathāgata should seek the self.”

original: mthong ba dang dran pa dang brjod pa dag gis tshol zhing rjes su 'brang bar 'dod pas bdag btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang dran pa dang brjod pa dag gis tshol zhing rjes su 'brang bar 'dod pas bdag btsal bar bya'o //
translated: The one who wishes to seek and follow the Tathāgata by way of vision, recollection, and expression should seek the self.

original: don de nyid phyis gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: don de nyid phyis gsal bar byed do //
translated: This meaning is clarified later.

original: 'di gnyis 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the connection between these two?

original: gang gi de skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi de skad bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of saying this?

original: de'i phyir / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ces bya ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig bla dgas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu bdag ces bya ba de ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig bla dgas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, this so-called self is a synonym for buddha.

original: bdag ni nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du gtan med pa yin la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni de lta bu ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du gtan med pa yin la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni de lta bu ma yin pa yin no //
translated: The self is utterly nonexistent, like a sky flower, but the Blessed Buddha is not like that.

original: de ji ltar bdag ces bya ba sangs rgyas kyi tshig bla dgas yin par 'dod ce na ;
analyzed: de ji ltar bdag ces bya ba sangs rgyas kyi tshig bla dgas yin par 'dod ce na ;
translated: How can it be asserted that the so-called self is a synonym for buddha?🔽Therefore, it is taught:

original: de'i phyir ji ltar bdag ces bya ba shin tu med cing mi dmigs pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang shin tu med cing mi dmigs so zhes gsungs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar bdag ces bya ba shin tu med cing mi dmigs pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang shin tu med cing mi dmigs so zhes gsungs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Just as the so-called self is utterly nonexistent and unobservable, so too the Buddha is utterly nonexistent and unobservable.

original: bdag ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir shin tu mi dmigs so //
translated: The self is utterly unobservable because it does not exist.

original: sangs rgyas kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir shin tu yod @38b pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang ma skyes pa'i phyir shin tu yod @38b pa ma yin te /
translated: The Buddha is utterly nonexistent because he is unborn.

original: mi dmigs shing brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs shing brjod par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //
translated: Up to: unobservable and inexpressible.

original: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag ces bya ba /
translated: How is the so-called self

original: tshig gi rgyu mtshan /
analyzed: tshig gi rgyu mtshan /
translated: The reason for the words.

original: chos gang ltar yang tshig gis brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing brjod du mi rung ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang /
analyzed: chos gang ltar yang tshig gis brjod par bya ba ma yin zhing brjod du mi rung ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang /
translated: Just as any phenomenon is not to be expressed by words and cannot be expressed, so also the Buddha

original: chos gang ltar yang tshig gis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gang ltar yang tshig gis brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: is not to be expressed by words as any phenomenon.

original: tshig gi yul ma yin pa nyid dang / shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gi yul ma yin pa nyid dang / shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude that he is not the domain of words and not the domain of consciousness,

original: gang la ci yang brjod cing smra ba sgrogs pa med pa de sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la ci yang brjod cing smra ba sgrogs pa med pa de sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called the Buddha, in whom there is no utterance, no speech, no proclamation of anything whatsoever.

original: shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid bstan pa'i ched du /
analyzed: shes pa'i yul ma yin pa nyid bstan pa'i ched du /
translated: In order to teach that he is not the domain of consciousness,

original: bdag ces bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dgas de ni shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i gzhi'i tshig bla dgas de ni shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The word ‘self’ is not an easy thing to understand.”

original: 'di ni gsal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal lo //
translated: This is clear.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshig gi don gyi rjes la byang chub bstan pa'i skabs gzhan bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshig gi don gyi rjes la byang chub bstan pa'i skabs gzhan bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make another section teaching the enlightenment that follows the meaning of the words of the Buddha,🔽it is said,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Bhagavān...

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis las dang po pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa rnams kyis 'tshal bar 'gyur ba /🔽ma lus pa khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis las dang po pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa rnams kyis 'tshal bar 'gyur ba / ma lus pa khyad par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu /
translated: How is it that beginners who have newly entered the vehicle will understand?

original: de 'dra ba mi ston to zhe na lan du /🔽kho bo ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa byas pa rtogs par 'gyur ba dag gis kyang shes par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'dra ba mi ston to zhe na lan du / kho bo ni ji ltar dgra bcom pa byas pa rtogs par 'gyur ba dag gis kyang shes par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: I do not teach such aspects that would lead to the realization of the entirety of the Mahāyāna.🔽In response, he says, “I do not teach such aspects that would lead to the realization of the entirety of the Mahāyāna, which even those who have attained the state of an arhat would understand.”

original: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis byas pa rtogs pa can yongs su nyams pa med pa'i chos can gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa dag gis kyang shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu rnam pa de 'dra ba'i chos mi ston mi 'chad do
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa gang gis byas pa rtogs pa can yongs su nyams pa med pa'i chos can gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa dag gis kyang shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu rnam pa de 'dra ba'i chos mi ston mi 'chad do
translated: How is it that those who have attained the state of an arhat who are irreversible and have the quality of being liberated from both aspects would understand? I do not teach such aspects that would lead to the realization of the entirety of the Mahāyāna.

original: // theg pa chen po las byang chub ni rnam pa mang du brjod la /
analyzed: // theg pa chen po las byang chub ni rnam pa mang du brjod la /
translated: In the Mahayana, enlightenment is described in many ways.

original: 'phags pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyi khri lnga stong pa las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Twenty-five Thousand:

original: sangs rgyas kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir dang / 'di sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin pa dang / byang chub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir dang / 'di sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin pa dang / byang chub ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Enlightenment is so called because of the Buddha’s manifest, complete enlightenment, because it is the Buddha’s, and because it is the realization of the reality of the uncompounded.

original: ming gi ngo bo tsam du zad do //
analyzed: ming gi ngo bo tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just a mere name.

original: ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pa'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Enlightenment is so called because of the realization of name and sign.

original: 'dus ma byas yang dag pa'i don ni byang chub ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas yang dag pa'i don ni byang chub ces bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The reality of the uncompounded is called enlightenment.”

original: de la sangs rgyas kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du @39a * //🔽byas nas kho bo ni ji ltar sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang du @39a * // byas nas kho bo ni ji ltar sus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the phrase “because of the Buddha’s manifest, complete enlightenment” refers to the characteristic of enlightenment.🔽In the passage that begins “I do not see any other single thing,” the Buddha is speaking from the point of view of the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa des kyang shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa des kyang shes par 'gyur /
translated: “Any other single thing” refers to something else that is very special.

original: bye brag shes par 'gyur ba de lta bur mi ston to //
analyzed: bye brag shes par 'gyur ba de lta bur mi ston to //
translated: but it does not teach that in such a way as to be understood in its literal sense.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs ci yin snyam du dogs pa la de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub ni sus kyang ma shes zhes gsungs te khyad par du ma shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs ci yin snyam du dogs pa la de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub ni sus kyang ma shes zhes gsungs te khyad par du ma shes pa'o //
translated: Here, in order to remove the doubt as to what the reason is, he says: “enlightenment is not known by anyone” — it is not known in its special sense.

original: sus kyang mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sus kyang mngon par rdzogs par ma rtogs zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “No one has realized it” — because of the realization of sameness.

original: ma mthong ba ni mig gis so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mig gis so //
translated: “Not seen” — by the eye.

original: ma thos pa ni rna bas so //
analyzed: ma thos pa ni rna bas so //
translated: “Not heard” — by the ear.

original: ma dran pa ni yid kyis ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma dran pa ni yid kyis ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not cognized” — by the mind, because of non-experience.

original: ma skyes pa ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pas ma bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni rgyu rkyen tshogs pas ma bskyed pa'o //
translated: “Not produced” — not produced by the convergence of causes and conditions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dang bral bas na ma bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dang bral bas na ma bkag pa yin te /
translated: And precisely because of that, “it is not stopped” — because of the absence of that.

original: gang zhig rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skye ba de nyid de dang bral na 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu rkyen tshogs pa las skye ba de nyid de dang bral na 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: That which is produced from the convergence of causes and conditions is stopped when that is absent,

original: rol mo'i rgyud kyi sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rol mo'i rgyud kyi sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a musical instrument, etc.

original: ma smras pa ni gzhan la tshig gis so //
analyzed: ma smras pa ni gzhan la tshig gis so //
translated: “Not spoken” — to others, by means of words.

original: ma bstan pa ni dpe nye bar bya ba la sogs pa 'di lta bu ma bstan to //
analyzed: ma bstan pa ni dpe nye bar bya ba la sogs pa 'di lta bu ma bstan to //
translated: The unexpressed is this kind of unexpressed example and so on.

original: skyed par byed pa dang dpe shes par byed pa bkag pa de dag gis ni 'dis sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i byang chub kyi don 'di gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang dpe shes par byed pa bkag pa de dag gis ni 'dis sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin no zhes bya ba'i byang chub kyi don 'di gsal ba yin no //
translated: By the negation of the producer and the example-maker, this clarifies the meaning of enlightenment, “it is of the Buddhas.”

original: ming gi ngo bo tsam gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: ming gi ngo bo tsam gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: From the point of view of the mere nature of the name,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub ni 'di lta bu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub ni 'di lta bu ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Lord said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, enlightenment is like this…” and so on.

original: byang chub kyi dngos po ni de lta bu ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi dngos po ni de lta bu ste /
translated: The entity of enlightenment is like this.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: byang chub de yang dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub de yang dngos po ma yin no //
translated: That enlightenment is also not an entity.

original: de'i phyir ming tsam yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming tsam yin /
translated: Therefore, it is a mere name.

original: 'di ltar ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pa byang chub yin mod ce na /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming dang mtshan ma rtogs pa byang chub yin mod ce na /
translated: If one thinks, “It is indeed enlightenment that realizes the name and sign,”

original: de'i phyir byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then for that reason, the Lord said, “One does not fully awaken to enlightenment through enlightenment…” and so on.

original: byed par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: byed par gyur pa 'am /
translated: It is not the case that it is made into an agent,

original: byed pa por gyur pa'i byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya /
analyzed: byed pa por gyur pa'i byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya /
translated: The enlightenment that is the agent does not fully awaken to the non-existence of an entity that is enlightenment.

original: ming ngam mtshan ma gang yang med de /
analyzed: ming ngam mtshan ma gang yang med de /
translated: There is no name or sign at all.

original: de yang byang chub bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub bzhin du dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because, like enlightenment, it does not exist as an entity.

original: ming dang mtshan ma de nyid bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyang byang chub kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma de nyid bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyang byang chub kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that name and sign, it is said: “Enlightenment does not fully awaken to enlightenment.

original: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The non-existence of an entity does not fully awaken to the non-existence of an entity.”

original: dngos po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not an entity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming @39b dang mtshan ma rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ming @39b dang mtshan ma rtogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In consideration of the realization of name and sign,

original: byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽byed par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: byang chub kyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽byed par gyur pa 'am /
translated: it is said: “Enlightenment does not fully awaken to enlightenment.🔽The non-existence of an entity does not fully awaken to the non-existence of an entity.”🔽The enlightenment that is the agent does not fully awaken to the non-existence of an entity that is enlightenment.

original: byed par gyur pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ming ngam mtshan ma ci yang med de /
analyzed: byed par gyur pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba ming ngam mtshan ma ci yang med de /
translated: There is no name or sign whatsoever of a bodhisattva who has become one who has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood with respect to the basic field of phenomena.

original: de yang byang chub bzhin du dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang byang chub bzhin du dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is just like enlightenment, because it is a non-entity.

original: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pas dngos po med pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: A non-entity is not able to manifestly and perfectly awaken to a non-entity.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyang byang chub kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyang byang chub kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “Enlightenment does not awaken to enlightenment,” and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo la yang byang chub cing mngon par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la yang byang chub cing mngon par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that its own essence is enlightened and realized.

original: bstan zin pa'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris te /
analyzed: bstan zin pa'i don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pa dris te /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning that has been taught, Mañjuśrī asked, “Bhagavān, the basic field of phenomena,” and so on.

original: lha'i bu la sogs pa'i bdud gnod par byed pa bcom pa dang ldan pas stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rgyu dbyings don dam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas sam /
analyzed: lha'i bu la sogs pa'i bdud gnod par byed pa bcom pa dang ldan pas stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos kyi rgyu dbyings don dam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas sam /
translated: The ultimate realm, which is the cause of the qualities such as the powers and fearlessnesses, is fully enlightened, is not non-manifested.

original: mngon du ma byas sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris so //
analyzed: mngon du ma byas sam zhes tshig zur gyis dris so //
translated: This is the indirect question.

original: 'dir lan ni btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lan ni btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de ni ma yin no //
translated: The answer here is: “No, Venerable Śāradvatīputra.”

original: gtan tshigs su 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings nyid bcom ldan 'das yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings nyid bcom ldan 'das yin te /
translated: The reason is: “The ultimate realm itself is the Blessed One.

original: de la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no entity that is not included in it.”

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhal gyis bzhes nas 'chad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni zhal gyis bzhes nas 'chad par byed pa ste /
translated: If the Blessed One accepts and explains with “The ultimate realm,” etc.,

original: ci ste chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin par gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste chos kyi dbyings mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin par gyur na /
translated: if the ultimate realm were fully enlightened,

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe 'am de bas na gang skye ba med pa'i dbyings 'dus ma byas pa nyid de dang 'gal bar 'gyur te gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe 'am de bas na gang skye ba med pa'i dbyings 'dus ma byas pa nyid de dang 'gal bar 'gyur te gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, at that time, or because of that, the unconditioned realm of non-arising would be contradicted, or harmed.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i yang dag pa'i don nyid brtan por bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings de nyid byang chub po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i yang dag pa'i don nyid brtan por bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings de nyid byang chub po zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to firmly establish the very meaning of the unconditioned, it is said that very realm of phenomena is enlightenment.

original: chos kyi dbyings de nyid byang chub ces bya bar /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings de nyid byang chub ces bya bar /
translated: That very realm of phenomena is called enlightenment.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni bsgom par bya ba yin /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni bsgom par bya ba yin /
translated: The realm of phenomena is what is to be cultivated.

original: byang chub ni thob par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub ni thob par bya ba yin te /
translated: Enlightenment is what is to be attained.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa 'di gnyis ji ltar dbyer med pa yin zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa 'di gnyis ji ltar dbyer med pa yin zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, how are these two, which are cause and effect, inseparable?

original: chos kyi dbyings ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes @40a * //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni dngos po med pa'i phyir ro zhes @40a * //
translated: Because the realm of phenomena is non-existent.

original: gsungs te / dngos po zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: gsungs te / dngos po zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: What is called existent is an existent thing.

original: de ma byung ba 'am med pa gang yin pa de dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: de ma byung ba 'am med pa gang yin pa de dngos po med pa'o //
translated: That which has not arisen or does not exist is non-existent.

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba gang gi phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba gang gi phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The word because is understood.

original: re zhig chos kyi dbyings ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig chos kyi dbyings ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the realm of the Dharma.🔽The word awakening is a term for the absence of intrinsic identity in all things.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi tshig bla dgas te zhes bya ba des ni byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba de ni byang chub kyi tshig bla dgas te zhes bya ba des ni byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: This shows the intrinsic identity of awakening.

original: de bas na dngos po med pa dang / chos thams cad med pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dang / byang chub gnyis tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po med pa dang / chos thams cad med pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings dang / byang chub gnyis tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the absence of entities and the absence of all things are inseparable, the realm of the Dharma and awakening are not different.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa ni de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi grongs su 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa ni de ni chos kyi dbyings kyi grongs su 'gro ba'o zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is also shown by the words It is included in the realm of the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad med pa'i ngo bo byang chub gang yin pa de nyid shes pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po yin pas de ni chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro zhing brjod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa'i ngo bo byang chub gang yin pa de nyid shes pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po yin pas de ni chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro zhing brjod pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since awakening is the absence of the intrinsic identity of all things, it is the intrinsic identity of knowledge. Therefore, it is included in the realm of the Dharma. It is said to be included in the realm of the Dharma.

original: 'dir dogs pa la gtan tshigs su chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dir dogs pa la gtan tshigs su chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, in order to resolve doubts, he says, “Because all phenomena are…”

original: chos thams cad tha dad pa med cing mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad tha dad pa med cing mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no //
translated: All phenomena are undifferentiated and have one characteristic.

original: gtan tshig ma grub po snyam pa dang / lan ni sangs rgyas kyi yul du zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshig ma grub po snyam pa dang / lan ni sangs rgyas kyi yul du zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: If you think that the reason is not established, the response is “Because it is the domain of the wisdom of the buddhas.”

original: mthar phyin pa phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du'o //
