analyzed: mthar phyin pa phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du'o //
translated: It is the domain of the wisdom of the buddhas, which has reached the culmination of non-erroneous wisdom.

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Because” means “for what reason.”

original: des 'di skad du gang sna tshogs pa nyid du yang dag pa ma yin par kun brtags pa de ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin par bstan to //
analyzed: des 'di skad du gang sna tshogs pa nyid du yang dag pa ma yin par kun brtags pa de ni 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul yin par bstan to //
translated: This is what he is saying: “That which is falsely imagined to be manifold is shown to be the domain of deluded consciousness.”

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tha dad pa med ces bya ba de ni rnam par rig pa med pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni tha dad pa med par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tha dad pa med ces bya ba de ni rnam par rig pa med pa'o zhes gsungs pa ni tha dad pa med par ston pa yin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, ‘undifferentiated’ means ‘without representation.’” This is the teaching of non-differentiation.

original: bye brag tu shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu shes pa ni rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: Specific cognition is representation.

original: de gang la med pa de ni rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de gang la med pa de ni rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: That which does not exist in that way is non-representation.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par shes par mi nus pa ste zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su rnam par rig pa med pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam par shes par mi nus pa ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: “That which is called non-representation is not able to be cognized.”

original: rang dang gzhan la shes par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la shes par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is not able to be cognized by oneself or others.

original: rgyus bskyed pa'i 'dus byas su 'am de las bzlog pa 'dus ma byas su rnam par rig par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyus bskyed pa'i 'dus byas su 'am de las bzlog pa 'dus ma byas su rnam par rig par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is not able to be cognized as conditioned by being produced from causes or as unconditioned by being the opposite of that.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa yang bzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa yang bzung ngo //
translated: The word “also” includes permanence, impermanence, and so on.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phan tshun gnyi ga la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni phan tshun gnyi ga la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word “also” indicates mutual dependence on both.

original: de ltar sangs @40b rgyas kyi yul tha dad pa med pa de la 'dus byas la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag rnam par rig pa gang yang med pa des na de rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs @40b rgyas kyi yul tha dad pa med pa de la 'dus byas la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag rnam par rig pa gang yang med pa des na de rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: Thus, in that undifferentiated domain of the buddhas, there is no representation at all of the distinctions of the aspects of conditioned phenomena and so on. Therefore, it is non-representation.

original: de ltar yul can gyi chos sna tshogs med par bstan nas yul gyi chos kyang sna tshogs med par bstan pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni rnam par rig pa med pa ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yul can gyi chos sna tshogs med par bstan nas yul gyi chos kyang sna tshogs med par bstan pa'i phyir chos thams cad ni rnam par rig pa med pa ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Having thus taught that the various subjective phenomena do not exist, he teaches that the various objective phenomena do not exist, saying: All phenomena are non-apprehensible.

original: 'dir dogs pa la gtan tshigs su 'di ltar gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni dngos po gang la gnas te /
analyzed: 'dir dogs pa la gtan tshigs su 'di ltar gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ni dngos po gang la gnas te /
translated: Here, the reason for the doubt is this: because all phenomena, such as form, do not exist as things that are established,

original: rnam par gnas pa byas te /
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa byas te /
translated: that is, as things that are set up,

original: rnam par rig par 'gyur ba rnam par shes par 'gyur ba bdag dang gzhan khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i skye ba 'byung ba bdag yod par thob par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig par 'gyur ba rnam par shes par 'gyur ba bdag dang gzhan khong du chud par 'gyur ba'i skye ba 'byung ba bdag yod par thob par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: as things that are apprehended, that is, as things that are cognized, as things that are understood as self or other, as things that are born, as things that are attained as self.

original: de dag ni de kho na'i don gyi tshul gyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de kho na'i don gyi tshul gyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: These are the aspects of the mode of the meaning of reality.

original: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa bstan zin to //
translated: The aspects of the mode of the teaching have been explained.

original: da ni de'i chos brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de'i chos brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the aspects of the mode of the teaching will be explained.

original: dgongs pa'i tshul gyi rnam pa ni de la so so'i skye bo'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa'i tshul gyi rnam pa ni de la so so'i skye bo'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: The aspects of the mode of the teaching are as follows: The phenomena of ordinary beings are as follows:

original: mtshams med pa zhes bya ba ni mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa zhes bya ba ni mi bzad pa'o //
translated: The term “immeasurable” means “unbearable.”

original: de la zhugs pa rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la zhugs pa nyid du bstan pas /
analyzed: de la zhugs pa rnams ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid la zhugs pa nyid du bstan pas /
translated: Those who engage in them are taught to be engaged in the inconceivable itself.

original: mtshams med pa rnams byang chub kyi rang bzhin yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams byang chub kyi rang bzhin yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the immeasurables are taught to be the nature of enlightenment.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la kyang gi sgras ni de las gzhan pa'i mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dge ba rnams dang / so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi rang bzhin nyid yin par blta bar bya'o zhes 'dir thun mong yin par bshad de /
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la kyang gi sgras ni de las gzhan pa'i mi dge ba rnams dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / dge ba rnams dang / so so'i skye bo dang slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi rang bzhin nyid yin par blta bar bya'o zhes 'dir thun mong yin par bshad de /
translated: “ Those” refers to the other nonvirtuous, indeterminate, and virtuous phenomena, as well as the phenomena of ordinary beings, those in training, and those beyond training. All of these should be seen as the nature of enlightenment. This is explained here in a general way.

original: 'og nas mjug sdud pa'i tshig gis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'og nas mjug sdud pa'i tshig gis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Later, it will be summarized in the concluding verses.

original: bye brag tu 'chad pa ni so so'i tshig gis 'chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bye brag tu 'chad pa ni so so'i tshig gis 'chad par 'gyur te /
translated: The specific explanation will be given in the individual verses.

original: de bas na gang dag mtshams med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na gang dag mtshams med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Those who engage in the immeasurables” and so on.

original: mtshams med pa la zhugs pa ni mtshams med pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams med pa la zhugs pa ni mtshams med pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Those who engage in heinous acts are those who are abiding in heinous acts.🔽They are said to be those who engage in the inconceivable.

original: de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo ni bstan pa la ma zhugs pa dang / zhugs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa'o zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo ni bstan pa la ma zhugs pa dang / zhugs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Ordinary beings are twofold: those who have not entered the teaching and those who have entered the teaching.

original: bstan pa la zhugs pa yang 'dul ba las 'gal bar byed pa dang / mi 'gal bar byed pa dang rnam pa gnyis so //🔽de @41a * //🔽rim gyis bstan pa'i phyir mtshams med pa la zhugs pa ma gsod pa la sogs pa byed par zhugs pa de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la zhugs pa yang 'dul ba las 'gal bar byed pa dang / mi 'gal bar byed pa dang rnam pa gnyis so // de @41a * // rim gyis bstan pa'i phyir mtshams med pa la zhugs pa ma gsod pa la sogs pa byed par zhugs pa de dag ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa ste /
translated: Those who have entered the teaching are also twofold: those who act in contradiction to the Vinaya and those who do not act in contradiction to the Vinaya.🔽In order to explain this in stages, those who engage in heinous acts are those who engage in killing their mother and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don rnam par sgrogs pa'i byed pa ni gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽bsam par mi nus pa 'am /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don rnam par sgrogs pa'i byed pa ni gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa de dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te / bsam par mi nus pa 'am /
translated: They are those who engage in the inconceivable.

original: bsam par mi 'os pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam par mi 'os pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable is that which cannot be conceived or that which is not suitable to be conceived.

original: de la zhugs pa de dag ni yang dag pa la zhugs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa de dag ni yang dag pa la zhugs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Those who have entered into that are those who have entered into reality.

original: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa dang / skye ba med pa'i bar du yin te der zhugs pa'o ;
analyzed: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa dang / skye ba med pa'i bar du yin te der zhugs pa'o ;
translated: Reality is non-erroneous, up to non-arisen, and they have entered into that.

original: / mtshams med pa yang phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa yin par blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: / mtshams med pa yang phyin ci ma log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa yin par blta bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is considered that the heinous acts are also to be viewed as reality because they are non-erroneous.

original: 'dir dgongs nas yang dag pa'i don dgrol ba'i gtan tshigs su btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni dbyer med pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs nas yang dag pa'i don dgrol ba'i gtan tshigs su btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni dbyer med pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, with that in mind, the Venerable Śāradvatīputra said, “Reality is the basis of non-division.”

original: dbyer med pa ni yang dag par dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni yang dag par dbyer med pa ste /
translated: Non-division is non-division in reality.

original: gnas med pa la sogs pa nas byung ba med pa la thug pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: gnas med pa la sogs pa nas byung ba med pa la thug pa'i bar ro //
translated: It is from the absence of a basis up to the absence of arising.

original: de'i gzhi ni gnas sam ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni gnas sam ngo bo ste /
translated: The basis of that is the basis or nature.

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa'i bar du yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa'i bar du yin te /
translated: It is from suchness up to nirvana.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the Bodhisattva Collection.

original: dbyer med pa'i gzhi de dag yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i gzhi de dag yang dag pa yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Since those bases of inseparability are real, they are to be expressed by the term “inconceivable.”

original: de la zhugs pa de dag ni gang mtshams med pa la zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa de dag ni gang mtshams med pa la zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who enter into that are those who enter into the heinous acts, that is, the meaning of the term.

original: gal te de lta na bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa bzhin du mtshams med pa byed pa rnams kyang mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de lta na bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa bzhin du mtshams med pa byed pa rnams kyang mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur /
translated: If that is so, then just as those who enter into the inconceivable will attain high status and liberation, why won’t those who commit heinous acts also attain high status and liberation?

original: chos gcig la zhugs pa rnams 'bras bu tha dad par ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos gcig la zhugs pa rnams 'bras bu tha dad par ci'i phyir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would those who enter into one phenomenon have different results?

original: de'i phyir gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan zhing rjes su 'brel pa de dag mtho ris brgya byin la sogs par bsten cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan zhing rjes su 'brel pa de dag mtho ris brgya byin la sogs par bsten cing /
translated: Therefore it says, “Those who possess the inconceivable” and so on. Those who possess and are connected to the inconceivable are supported by high status, such as Śakra,

original: 'gro ba kho na ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba kho na ma yin no //
translated: It is not only beings who go.

original: mtho ris smos pas 'khor los sgyur ba dang / tshangs pa la sogs par bsten pa yang mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris smos pas 'khor los sgyur ba dang / tshangs pa la sogs par bsten pa yang mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of the heavens also indicates that one goes to the heavens, to the wheel-turning kings, to Brahma, and so on.

original: ngan song ni dmyal ba la sogs @41b pa'o ;
analyzed: ngan song ni dmyal ba la sogs @41b pa'o ;
translated: The miserable realms are the hells, and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid de /
translated: Nirvana is perfect complete Buddhahood.

original: de dag tu 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag tu 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: One does not go to those places.

original: mtho ris dang byang grol dang ngan song la sogs par 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du snang ba de dag ni rmongs pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa yin gyi yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol dang ngan song la sogs par 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid du snang ba de dag ni rmongs pa rnams kyi 'khrul pa yin gyi yang dag pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The appearances of the characteristics of going to the heavens, to liberation, to the miserable realms, and so on, are the confusion of the ignorant. They are not reality.

original: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs ci yod /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: mtshams med pa byed pa ni ngan song du 'gro la /
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa ni ngan song du 'gro la /
translated: One who commits the heinous acts goes to the miserable realms.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa ni mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par byed par snang ngo snyam du sems pa de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa ni mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par byed par snang ngo snyam du sems pa de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since it is thought that the inconceivable is the cause of attaining high status and definite goodness, it is said that the inconceivable does not exist as a cause or noncause.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'dus ma byas te /
translated: The inconceivable is unconditioned.

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa rnams te /🔽de dag ni las kyis 'gro ba dang de zad pas mi 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mya ngan las 'das pa la thug pa rnams te / de dag ni las kyis 'gro ba dang de zad pas mi 'gro ba ste /
translated: Suchness and so on up to nirvana

original: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar kun tu brtags pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang mi 'gro bar kun tu brtags pa yod pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: are not causes of going to cyclic existence through karma and of not going to cyclic existence through the exhaustion of karma.🔽They are not at all imagined to be causes or noncauses.

original: nye bar gnas pa ma yin 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa ma yin 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore they do not exist as causes or noncauses.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa yin par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'bras bu yod pa ma yin pa kun brtags pa yin par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Since the inconceivable is the nature of nonarising, how could it be imagined to be a cause or noncause?

original: nye bar gnas par 'gyur mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du zhes tha mar smos pa la bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa thams cad ston par byed do //
analyzed: nye bar gnas par 'gyur mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du zhes tha mar smos pa la bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa thams cad ston par byed do //
translated: The word “up to” in the phrase “up to nirvana” indicates all the synonyms of thusness.

original: 'dul ba'i chos las 'gal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i chos las 'gal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to acting in contradiction to the Dharma of the Vinaya,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang dag ltung ba'i rtsa ba bzhi la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang dag ltung ba'i rtsa ba bzhi la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Buddha said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, those who abide in the four roots of downfalls . . .”

original: mi gsod pa la sogs te /🔽phas pham pa'i ltung ba bzhi la gnas pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi gsod pa la sogs te / phas pham pa'i ltung ba bzhi la gnas pa de dag kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: and so on.🔽Abide in the four defeats, such as killing.🔽The word “also” in the phrase “those who abide in the four defeats, such as killing”

original: kyang gi sgras dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la sogs pa la nan tan byed pas 'dug par byed cing gnas pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la sogs pa la nan tan byed pas 'dug par byed cing gnas pa bsdu'o //
translated: includes those who abide in the remaining defeats and so on, and who are expelled from the community.🔽Abide in the rootless.

original: rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la rtsa ba ni 'jig tshogs dang pham pa'i ltung ba bzhi byung ba'o /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la rtsa ba ni 'jig tshogs dang pham pa'i ltung ba bzhi byung ba'o /
translated: The root is the arising of the four defeats of the view of the transitory collection.

original: // mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la gnas pa ni yang dag pa yin par kun tu rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: // mi gnas pa zhes bya ba la gnas pa ni yang dag pa yin par kun tu rtog pa la'o //
translated: “Non-abiding” is a conceptual discrimination of abiding as real.

original: de gnyis ma skyes pa'i phyir de gnyis ni byang chub dang mnyam pa yin par shes so //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang byang chub kyi rtsa ba med @42a * //
analyzed: de gnyis ma skyes pa'i phyir de gnyis ni byang chub dang mnyam pa yin par shes so // byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las kyang byang chub kyi rtsa ba med @42a * //
translated: Because those two are non-arisen, they are known to be equal to enlightenment.

original: pa dang ; gnas pa med par gsungs so //
analyzed: pa dang ; gnas pa med par gsungs so //
translated: In the Bodhisattva Canon, it is also said that enlightenment is without root and without abode.

original: 'dir rtsa ba med pa'i tshig gis ni gnyi ga'i bye brag yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir rtsa ba med pa'i tshig gis ni gnyi ga'i bye brag yin par bstan to //
translated: Here, the word “rootless” indicates the distinction of both.

original: 'og nas kyang rtsa ba med pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba de ni gnas pa med pa'i dge slong gi tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang rtsa ba med pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba de ni gnas pa med pa'i dge slong gi tshig bla dgas so zhes gsungs te /
translated: And later on, it says, “The one called a rootless monk is a monk without abode.”

original: tshig gnyi ga smos pas ni 'dir rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig gnyi ga smos pas ni 'dir rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: By mentioning both words, here there is a distinction.

original: gang yang rung ba cig smos na ni gnyi ga bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba cig smos na ni gnyi ga bstan pa yin te /
translated: If either one is mentioned, both are indicated,

original: bya ba dang dngos po'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang dngos po'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the words “action” and “thing.”

original: de bas na de dag kyang rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de dag kyang rtsa ba med pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub la gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, they are also based on the rootless. This means that they are based on enlightenment.

original: rtsa ba byung ba la gnas pa dag ji ltar byang chub la gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtsa ba byung ba la gnas pa dag ji ltar byang chub la gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are those based on the rootless based on enlightenment?

original: de'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu skye ba med pa la rtsa ba 'am rtse mo zhes bya bar 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu skye ba med pa la rtsa ba 'am rtse mo zhes bya bar 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, there is no desire to call the rootless the root or the peak.

original: 'di ltar skye ba med pa 'dus ma byas pa la ni rtsa ba zhes bya ba bdag go snyam pa'i blo dang rtse mo chos kyi rnam par rtog pa yod par 'dod cing khas len pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba med pa 'dus ma byas pa la ni rtsa ba zhes bya ba bdag go snyam pa'i blo dang rtse mo chos kyi rnam par rtog pa yod par 'dod cing khas len pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, in the unconditioned rootless, there is no desire or acceptance to call the root the mind of self or the peak the conceptualization of phenomena.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa de gnyis yod na ni skye ba med pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa de gnyis yod na ni skye ba med pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If those two unreal things exist, then there would not be non-arising.

original: des na rtsa ba med pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid la mi gnas shing rlom sems dang bral ba'i dge slong gi tshig bla dgas te /
analyzed: des na rtsa ba med pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu rtog pa khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i bdag nyid la mi gnas shing rlom sems dang bral ba'i dge slong gi tshig bla dgas te /
translated: Therefore, the so-called rootless monk does not abide in the nature of the mind and mental factors of the three realms, which is an incorrect imagination, and is a designation for a monk who is free from conceit.

original: rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: He is a speaker.

original: 'dis ni rtsa ba byung ba dang byang chub mnyam pa nyid yin par blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtsa ba byung ba dang byang chub mnyam pa nyid yin par blta bar bya ba yin no zhes bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: By this, it should be understood that the arising of the roots and the equality of enlightenment are to be seen.

original: da ni rta dang rgod ma dang / ba lang dang glang zhes bya ba'i tshul ltar de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba'i dbang du byas nas rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya ba de ni lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rta dang rgod ma dang / ba lang dang glang zhes bya ba'i tshul ltar de las gzhan pa'i ltung ba'i dbang du byas nas rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya ba de ni lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in the manner of a horse, a mare, a cow, and an ox, with regard to the downfalls that are different from those, it is said that the so-called arising of disputes is a superimposition, etc.

original: rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i ltung ba byas pa byung ba ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i ltung ba byas pa byung ba ste /
translated: The so-called arising of disputes is the arising of a committed downfall that becomes a basis for dispute.

original: dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Because it is not pure,

original: gnas par bya ba ma yin pas ji ltar rang rang gi las rnams kyis rnam par sbyang dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas par bya ba ma yin pas ji ltar rang rang gi las rnams kyis rnam par sbyang dgos pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not to be established, it is necessary to purify it by means of one's own actions.

original: rtsod pa'i gnas pa ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas pa ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is a site of dispute because it is unborn.

original: byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is the essence of enlightenment,🔽it is said:

original: de ni lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas so zhes @42b gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni lhag par sgro 'dogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dgas so zhes @42b gsungs te /
translated: That is the designation of the superimposition of the special.

original: gang la lta bas byas pa'i rtog pa sgro 'dogs pa de lhag pa khongs su ma gtogs pa rnam par mi gnas pa de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang la lta bas byas pa'i rtog pa sgro 'dogs pa de lhag pa khongs su ma gtogs pa rnam par mi gnas pa de ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The special is that which is not included within, that which does not abide, and that is the characteristic of the perfect enlightenment of the gnosis of equality.

original: de'i tshig bla dgas yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshig bla dgas yin no //
translated: It is the designation of that.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la lhag par mos pa la sogs pas byang chub kyi spyod pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid lhag par sgro 'dogs pa la lhag par mos pa la sogs pas byang chub kyi spyod pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: In the context of the practice of enlightenment, through the superimposition of the special, which is the characteristic that was just taught, through the special conviction, and so on,

original: spyod cing byed pa ni sbyin gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyod cing byed pa ni sbyin gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: one practices and acts as an object of generosity.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the complete purity of the three spheres and because it is pure.

original: de las gzhan pa ni sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang len pa rnams dmigs pa dang dri ma can yin pa'i phyir ma dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni sbyin pa dang sbyin pa po dang len pa rnams dmigs pa dang dri ma can yin pa'i phyir ma dag pa yin te /
translated: The other is impure because the gift, the giver, and the recipient are objectified and defiled.

original: sbyin gnas dam pa dag par 'gyur bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin gnas dam pa dag par 'gyur bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not capable of purifying the highest field of merit.

original: de ltar na 'di ni dgongs pa ston pa'i gzhi blo gros shin tu gnas pas yongs su zhus pa dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni dgongs pa ston pa'i gzhi blo gros shin tu gnas pas yongs su zhus pa dang rjes su mthun par gyur pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the basis of the teaching of the intention, which is consistent with the question of Susthitamatidevaputra.

original: 'di yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ltar dag pa de ni phyis rnam par sbyang du med do //
analyzed: 'di yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ltar dag pa de ni phyis rnam par sbyang du med do //
translated: This is also the complete purity of the three spheres, which is pure in that way and is not subsequently purified.

original: lha'i bu 'di las dgongs nas 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: lha'i bu 'di las dgongs nas 'di skad du ston te /
translated: With this in mind, the Lord taught as follows:

original: gang zhig stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa de ni 'jig rten ni sbyin gnas su gyur pa dang de shin tu rab tu byung ba yin pas de sbyang dgos pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ste
analyzed: gang zhig stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dad pas byin pa yongs su spyod pa de ni 'jig rten ni sbyin gnas su gyur pa dang de shin tu rab tu byung ba yin pas de sbyang dgos pa ma yin no zhes 'byung ste
translated: One who uses the offerings of faith in a world system of three billion world systems is not one who needs to be purified, because he is a worthy recipient of offerings in the world and he is fully ordained.

original: / de ni khyad par du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: / de ni khyad par du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a special teaching.

original: nyi ma bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma bzhin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is like the sun.

original: 'dir dgos pa la gtan tshigs su 'di ltar lhag par sgro 'dogs pa de ni mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir dgos pa la gtan tshigs su 'di ltar lhag par sgro 'dogs pa de ni mnyam pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, the reason for the need is stated in this way: “because of the equality of the superimposition.

original: mnyam pa ni rnam par thar pa gsum gyi mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid yin pa de nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa ni rnam par thar pa gsum gyi mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa nyid yin pa de nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod las rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: Equality is equality through the equality of the three doors of liberation. That should be understood in detail in the Bodhisattva Canon.

original: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa de ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: lhag par sgro 'dogs pa de ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The superimposition has been explained above.

original: da ni yongs su smin par byed pa la zhugs pa nyid kyi chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni yongs su smin par byed pa la zhugs pa nyid kyi chos kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, in terms of the Dharma of one who has entered into ripening,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dge slong dad pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dge slong dad pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a monk who has faith, etc.

original: las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa dang ldan pa'i dad pa can de ni @43a * //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la sogs pa la mngon par yid ches pa dang ldan pa'i dad pa can de ni @43a * //
translated: He who has faith that is endowed with clear faith in action and result, the truths, the jewels, etc.

original: dad pas byin pa spyad pa'i 'os ma yin te /
analyzed: dad pas byin pa spyad pa'i 'os ma yin te /
translated: is not a fit recipient for using what is given through faith.

original: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas sems kyi rgyud dri ma can du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i dri mas sems kyi rgyud dri ma can du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of his mind is defiled by the stain of the concepts of action and result, etc.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dge slong ma dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dge slong ma dad pa yin te /
translated: The opposite of that is a monk who has no faith.

original: de ni dad pas byin pa spyad pa'i 'os yin te /
analyzed: de ni dad pas byin pa spyad pa'i 'os yin te /
translated: He is a fit recipient for using what is given through faith.

original: sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of his mind is pure by nature.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rung ba can gyi dge slong ni zhes bya ba la rung ba ni 'dul ba las bslab pa bcas pa gsungs pa bzhin byed pa dang bcas pa de las mi 'da' ba gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rung ba can gyi dge slong ni zhes bya ba la rung ba ni 'dul ba las bslab pa bcas pa gsungs pa bzhin byed pa dang bcas pa de las mi 'da' ba gang yin ba'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, a monk who is suitable is one who is suitable for the training, who practices in accordance with the precepts that have been laid down in the monastic code, and who does not transgress them.

original: 'di yang dad pa dang ldan pa bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang dad pa dang ldan pa bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: And this should be understood as being like the one who has faith.

original: de ni rgyu dang 'bras bur phye ste /
analyzed: de ni rgyu dang 'bras bur phye ste /
translated: This is the analysis into cause and effect.

original: mi slob ba'i chos kyi dbang du byas nas khrid pa yang dag par ma bcom ba'i dge slong ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi slob ba'i chos kyi dbang du byas nas khrid pa yang dag par ma bcom ba'i dge slong ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With reference to the qualities of one beyond training, he says, “A monk who is not defeated, etc.”

original: srid par khrid par byed pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: srid par khrid par byed pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving leads to existence.

original: de ni yul thob pa dang ma thob pa nyid pas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ni yul thob pa dang ma thob pa nyid pas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: It is twofold, in terms of the objects that are obtained and those that are not obtained.

original: de la thob pa'i yul la brten pa des mi skyo zhing ma thob pa yang tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de la thob pa'i yul la brten pa des mi skyo zhing ma thob pa yang tshol bar byed do //
translated: In this regard, one who is based on the objects that are obtained does not become weary of them, and one who is based on those that are not obtained seeks them.

original: yul la yid byung ba med pa'i ngo bo dang / yul tshol bar byed pa de yang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas de dang de dag tu phung po'i rgyun khrid par byed pas khrid par zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: yul la yid byung ba med pa'i ngo bo dang / yul tshol bar byed pa de yang 'gro ba dang / skye gnas de dang de dag tu phung po'i rgyun khrid par byed pas khrid par zhes sbyar te /
translated: And because it leads the stream of aggregates to those and those birthplaces, it is connected with leading.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thob pa dang spangs par bya ba'i phyir rgyug par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa thob pa dang spangs par bya ba'i phyir rgyug par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means running in order to obtain the pleasant and abandon the unpleasant.

original: yid 'byung ba'i gags su gyur pa dang / yul tshol bar byed pa'i dgra de dag bcom pas /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i gags su gyur pa dang / yul tshol bar byed pa'i dgra de dag bcom pas /
translated: Because those obstacles to disgust and enemies who search for objects have been destroyed,

original: dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: he is an arhat.

original: phung po'i rgyun zag pa zad pas /
analyzed: phung po'i rgyun zag pa zad pas /
translated: Because the stream of aggregates has exhausted defilements,

original: zag pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called one who has exhausted defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa bcom bas dge slong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom bas dge slong ngo //
translated: Because he has destroyed afflictions, he is a bhikṣu.

original: de dag yang dag par bcom ba de nyid khrid par byed pa yang dag par ma bcom pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par bcom ba de nyid khrid par byed pa yang dag par ma bcom pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: That very destruction of them is taught by this, which is called the correct destruction of that which is to be led.

original: dgongs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dgongs pa gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the intention,

original: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dris so //
translated: he asked, Mañjuśrī, what do you think when you say that?

original: 'di snyam bsams te /
analyzed: 'di snyam bsams te /
translated: He thought this:

original: srid par khrid par byed pa ma bcom na /
analyzed: srid par khrid par byed pa ma bcom na /
translated: If the guide to existence is not destroyed,

original: ji ltar zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zag pa zad pa /
translated: how can there be the destruction of the defilements?

original: dgra bcom pa'i dge slong nyid yin /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dge slong nyid yin /
translated: How can there be the state of a monk who is an arhat?

original: yang dag par bcom na yang /
analyzed: yang dag par bcom na yang /
translated: But if it is destroyed,

original: ji ltar srid par khrid pa yang dag par ma bcom pa nyid yin zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srid par khrid pa yang dag par ma bcom pa nyid yin zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: how can the guide to existence not be destroyed?

original: ji lta ba bzhin bcom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin bcom pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the destruction of the guide to existence just as it is,

original: mnyam pa nyid la yang dag par bcom @43b pa med /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la yang dag par bcom @43b pa med /
translated: it is said that “there is no destruction of the equality of existence and peace,

original: khrid par byed pa de nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khrid par byed pa de nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the guide to existence is itself equality.”

original: mnyam pa nyid chos kyi dbyings de la /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid chos kyi dbyings de la /
translated: In the realm of reality, which is equality,

original: yang dag par bcom pa med pa ni gang gis ji ltar yang dag par rgyun bcad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bcom pa med pa ni gang gis ji ltar yang dag par rgyun bcad pa med pa'o //
translated: there is no destruction, because there is no interruption of anything whatsoever.

original: 'di ltar sna tshogs nyid kyis ni bcom pa dang / 'joms par byed pa la khyab par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sna tshogs nyid kyis ni bcom pa dang / 'joms par byed pa la khyab par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the guide to existence is pervaded by diversity,

original: sna tshogs nyid dang mi mthun pa yang mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid dang mi mthun pa yang mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: and equality is incompatible with diversity.

original: de ltar sna tshogs nyid log par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar sna tshogs nyid log par gyur na /
translated: When diversity is reversed,

original: khyad par bya ba bcom pa rang yang ldog par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: khyad par bya ba bcom pa rang yang ldog par 'gyur bas /
translated: In particular, the one who has destroyed the object to be destroyed will also cease to exist.

original: yang dag par bcom pa med pa mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par bcom pa med pa mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the equality of the absence of true destruction is the equality of the absence of true origination.

original: gzhan yang 'das pa ni 'gags pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa ni ma thob pa'i phyir dang / da ltar byung ba ni stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir 'joms pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa ni 'gags pa'i phyir dang / ma 'ongs pa ni ma thob pa'i phyir dang / da ltar byung ba ni stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir 'joms pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, the past is not a destroyer because it has ceased, the future is not a destroyer because it has not been obtained, and the present is not a destroyer because it is equal in strength.

original: de bas na don dam par gang gzhom par bya ba dang / 'joms par byed pa gang yang mnyam pa nyid la bsam du med do //
analyzed: de bas na don dam par gang gzhom par bya ba dang / 'joms par byed pa gang yang mnyam pa nyid la bsam du med do //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, neither the object to be destroyed nor the one who destroys it is to be imagined in equality.

original: 'joms pa de la khyab par byed pa'i sna tshogs nyid dang / mi mthun pa mnyam pa nyid ni khrid par byed pa la yod par mjug bsdu zhing ma grub pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'joms pa de la khyab par byed pa'i sna tshogs nyid dang / mi mthun pa mnyam pa nyid ni khrid par byed pa la yod par mjug bsdu zhing ma grub pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude that the diversity of the pervader and the equality of the opposite exist in the one who is led, and in order to completely abandon nonestablishment,

original: khrid par byed pa de nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: khrid par byed pa de nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said that the one who is led is also equality.

original: 'dir ni khrid par brjod pa mnyam pa nyid bsten pas ni khrid pa'i mi mnyam ba'i ngo bo sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni khrid par brjod pa mnyam pa nyid bsten pas ni khrid pa'i mi mnyam ba'i ngo bo sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, the statement “is led” is the removal of the unequal nature of the led.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is equality.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni snga phyi sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni snga phyi sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: “ Also” is a conjunction.

original: de nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni khrid par byed pa brjod ma thag pa mtshon par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni khrid par byed pa brjod ma thag pa mtshon par ston par byed do //
translated: “ That itself” shows the indication of the just-mentioned “is led.”

original: des na 'di skad du /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, this is taught:

original: skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid mthong ba kho na yang dag par dgra bcom pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba med par mnyam pa nyid mthong ba kho na yang dag par dgra bcom pa nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: “The very seeing of the equality of non-arising is the very state of being a perfect buddha.”

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyis kyang /
translated: Also, the master Nāgārjuna says:

original: gnas dang bcas pa'i sems yod la //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa'i sems yod la //
translated: When the mind is present with its abode,

original: nyon mongs dug chen cis mi 'byung //
analyzed: nyon mongs dug chen cis mi 'byung //
translated: why would the great poison of the afflictions not arise?

original: tha mal 'dug pa 'am nyon mongs pa'i //
analyzed: tha mal 'dug pa 'am nyon mongs pa'i //
translated: Whether one is in a normal state or

original: sbrul gdug rnams kyis zin par 'gyur //
analyzed: sbrul gdug rnams kyis zin par 'gyur //
translated: is seized by the poisonous snakes of the afflictions,

original: sdug ces pa las chags pa 'byung //
analyzed: sdug ces pa las chags pa 'byung //
translated: from “beautiful” there is attachment,

original: de las bzlog pas 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas 'dod chags bral //
translated: and from the opposite, there is freedom from attachment.

original: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar dben bar //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu ltar dben bar //
translated: Like an illusory person, he is empty.

original: mthong na mya ngan 'das par 'gyur //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mthong na mya ngan 'das par 'gyur // zhes bshad do //
translated: When he is seen, there is nirvana.

original: phung po la sogs pa yang dag par ma skyes pa rnams la /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa yang dag par ma skyes pa rnams la /
translated: The aggregates and so on, which are not really produced,

original: mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bsgoms @44a * //
analyzed: mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bsgoms @44a * //
translated: are meditated upon as being without conceptualization and so on,🔽and attachment and so on are thereby pacified.

original: pas ; 'dod chags la sogs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pas ; 'dod chags la sogs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: nyan thos rnams theg pa chen po la 'dzud par dgongs nas /🔽dgongs pa'i tshul la dgongs te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams theg pa chen po la 'dzud par dgongs nas / dgongs pa'i tshul la dgongs te /
translated: With the intention of introducing the śrāvakas to the Mahāyāna,

original: de skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: the Buddha taught that in a manner that is interpretable in meaning.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i mi slob pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas nas ;
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i mi slob pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas nas ;
translated: From the perspective of the qualities of the nonlearners, which are the result,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'jigs pa las ma rgal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'jigs pa las ma rgal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the Buddha said, “Venerable Śāriputra, those who have not crossed over the fearsome” and so on.

original: nyan thos rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis khams gsum la skrag nas /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis khams gsum la skrag nas /
translated: The śrāvakas, frightened by the suffering of birth and so on in the three realms,

original: rang gi lam bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las brgal te 'bras bu thob pa de la /
analyzed: rang gi lam bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las brgal te 'bras bu thob pa de la /
translated: cultivate their own path and thereby cross over the fearsome and attain the result.

original: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dgongs pa dris pa dang lan du /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci las bsams te de skad smra zhes dgongs pa dris pa dang lan du /
translated: Mañjuśrī, thinking of what did you say that?

original: de'i 'jigs pa cung zad tsam yang med na /
analyzed: de'i 'jigs pa cung zad tsam yang med na /
translated: He replied, If there is not even the slightest fear of that,

original: ci zhig las brgal bar 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci zhig las brgal bar 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: what is there to be refuted?

original: re zhig 'jigs pa chen po 'am /
analyzed: re zhig 'jigs pa chen po 'am /
translated: For now, let alone a great fear,

original: 'bring lta zhog gi /'jigs pa cung zad cam yang phra mo tsam yang med de /
analyzed: 'bring lta zhog gi /'jigs pa cung zad cam yang phra mo tsam yang med de /
translated: or even a middling fear, there is not even the slightest, not even the subtlest fear,

original: de'i skye ba la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i skye ba la sogs pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because birth, etc., are not born.🔽Therefore, what is there to be refuted?

original: de bas na ci zhig las brgal bar 'gyur gang zhig gang du ji ltar yang zhes bya bar yang bstan par bya ba yin no //🔽'dis ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phags pa'i bden pa bsgoms pas /
analyzed: de bas na ci zhig las brgal bar 'gyur gang zhig gang du ji ltar yang zhes bya bar yang bstan par bya ba yin no // 'dis ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'phags pa'i bden pa bsgoms pas /
translated: This is also taught by what, where, and how?

original: dgra bcom pa'i gang zag 'di khams gsum las 'das te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i gang zag 'di khams gsum las 'das te /
translated: This shows that this person who is an arhat, having transcended the three realms,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas so zhes bya ba 'di thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas so zhes bya ba 'di thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: abides in nirvana is all just a false superimposition.

original: // / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Chapter 4🔽

original: da ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos bshad pa skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'jam dpal ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes sh'a ri'i bus dris so //
analyzed: da ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos bshad pa skabs dbye ba'i phyir 'jam dpal ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can zhes bya ba de gang gi tshig bla dgas zhes sh'a ri'i bus dris so //
translated: Now, in order to explain the Dharma of the bodhisattvas, Śāriputra asks, What is the meaning of 'Mañjuśrī, the one who has patience with the unborn'?

original: ma skyes pa la 'am ma skyes pa rtogs pa la bzod pa ni bzod pa dang du len pa dang / 'dod pa 'di las yod pas ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'am ma skyes pa rtogs pa la bzod pa ni bzod pa dang du len pa dang / 'dod pa 'di las yod pas ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Patience with the unborn or the realization of the unborn is accepting and desiring this, and because of that, he is called the one who has patience with the unborn.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gang gis mig dang gzugs dang / de'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos cung zad tsam yang phra rab tsam yang ma bskyed de /🔽skye bar blos ma mthong ba brtags pa ste /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gang gis mig dang gzugs dang / de'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i chos cung zad tsam yang phra rab tsam yang ma bskyed de / skye bar blos ma mthong ba brtags pa ste /
translated: Śāradvatīputra, he who does not generate even the slightest, not even the most subtle, of phenomena such as the eye, form, and their consciousness,

original: ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i bzod pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: and who does not see the arising of phenomena with the mind, is called 'the one who has patience with the unborn.'

original: 'di man chad ni bslab pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'di man chad ni bslab pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid lam gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: From here on, in terms of the path, the characteristics of the three trainings are explained.

original: 'jam dpal dge slong ma dul ba zhes @44b bya ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal dge slong ma dul ba zhes @44b bya ba de zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said, Mañjuśrī, the monk called 'Untamed' ... and so on.

original: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa la de skad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgra bcom pa la de skad ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the Arhat called that?

original: de'i phyir ma dul ba ni 'dul la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma dul ba ni 'dul la /
translated: Therefore, it is said, The untamed is tamed,

original: dul ba ni mi 'dul ba yin te /
analyzed: dul ba ni mi 'dul ba yin te /
translated: and the tamed is untamed.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la bsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ma dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang 'bral ba 'am /🔽log par dul ba rnams bslab pa dang gdams ngag rjes su sbyin pa rnams kyis 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la bsams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ma dul ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang 'bral ba 'am / log par dul ba rnams bslab pa dang gdams ngag rjes su sbyin pa rnams kyis 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, thinking of this, it is said, Here ... and so on.🔽Here, untamed means those who are devoid of taming or are wrongly tamed, and those who are tamed are tamed by the precepts and instructions.

original: dul ba ni mi 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i tshul can sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur 'debs kyi mtha' dang bral ba gang yin pa de dag 'dul bar mi byed pa ste //
analyzed: dul ba ni mi 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i tshul can sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur 'debs kyi mtha' dang bral ba gang yin pa de dag 'dul bar mi byed pa ste //
translated: The tamed are untamed means those who are of the nature of purity, free from the extremes of superimposition and denial, are not tamed.

original: lus dang ngag dang / yid sdom pa'i bdag nyid kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa mi dmigs pa la dgongs te de skad smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang / yid sdom pa'i bdag nyid kyi lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa mi dmigs pa la dgongs te de skad smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he speaks with the intention of nonapprehension of the training in superior morality, which has the nature of restraint of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar byas na 'di'i blo gros shin tu gnas pas zhus pa las /🔽lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bslab pa gsum mi dmigs pas ;
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'di'i blo gros shin tu gnas pas zhus pa las / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bslab pa gsum mi dmigs pas ;
translated: If this is done, then it is in accord with the statement in the Sūtra of the Questions of Suviśuddhamati:🔽“The three trainings in superior morality, etc., are nonapprehended.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum yin no zhes 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum yin no zhes 'byung ba dang rjes su mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: The three trainings in superior morality, etc., are nonapprehended.”

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu lhag pa'i sems la spyod do zhes bya ba de ni so so'i skye bo'i tshig bla dgas so zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / spyod pa rnams dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu lhag pa'i sems la spyod do zhes bya ba de ni so so'i skye bo'i tshig bla dgas so zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / spyod pa rnams dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, to say ‘one practices superior mind’ is a designation for an ordinary person,” because the training in superior mind and the practices are apprehended.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs su 'di ltar de lhag par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs su 'di ltar de lhag par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, the reason is stated: “It is because one is superior to that.”

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma brnyes pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma brnyes pa la /
translated: Thus, because the training in higher wisdom is not attained by all the Buddhas,

original: so so'i skye bo de dag lhag par byed cing gnas par byed de //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo de dag lhag par byed cing gnas par byed de //
translated: those ordinary beings surpass it and abide in it.

original: mnyam pa nyid bor na sems dang gzhan la yang rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid bor na sems dang gzhan la yang rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: If one abandons equality, one should also understand it in other minds.

original: don gyis na sems dang spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin bar gsungs so //
analyzed: don gyis na sems dang spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yin bar gsungs so //
translated: In fact, it is said to be the training in higher wisdom of the non-apprehension of mind and practice.

original: yang dag par bshad pas rangs na /
analyzed: yang dag par bshad pas rangs na /
translated: If one is delighted by the correct explanation,

original: 'jam dpal khyod kyis dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ji lta ba de bzhin du smras pa de legs so legs so zhes bya bas /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod kyis dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ji lta ba de bzhin du smras pa de legs so legs so zhes bya bas /
translated: Mañjuśrī, you have spoken like an Arhat whose defilements are exhausted. Excellent, excellent!

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gleng slong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gleng slong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it introduces the training in higher wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag ni shes rab kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag ni shes rab kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because right speech is the result of wisdom.

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
translated: The phrase Arhat whose defilements are exhausted refers to the aggregate of liberation.

original: ji ltar de bzhin du smras pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i ye @45a * //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin du smras pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i ye @45a * //
translated: Just as it is said means just as it is said in the scriptures.🔽

original: shes mthong bas so //
analyzed: shes mthong bas so //
translated: Just as it was said means by the vision of the knowledge of liberation.

original: 'dis ni shes rab 'bras bu dang dgongs pa dang bcas pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes rab 'bras bu dang dgongs pa dang bcas pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this he shows wisdom together with its fruit and its intention.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang theg pa chen po la gzud par dgongs nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyis kyang theg pa chen po la gzud par dgongs nas /
translated: Noble Mañjuśrī, intending to lead them into the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa spang bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa spang bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show that the Śrāvaka Vehicle should be abandoned,

original: sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de de bzhin te /
translated: said, Śāriputra, it is so, it is so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Just as it was said.

original: rnam pa gzhan la dgongs nas zag pa zad pa nyid yin par zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa nyid yin par dngos su bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan la dgongs nas zag pa zad pa nyid yin par zhal gyis bzhes pa'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa nyid yin par dngos su bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he accepted that they had exhausted the defilements with an intention directed to another aspect, and because he explicitly refuted that they were arhats,

original: gnyi ga yang ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ma yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: he taught that they were neither.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes dogs pa la gtan tshigs su /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes dogs pa la gtan tshigs su /
translated: Why is that?

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ltar nyan thos kyi sa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in this way, I have no desire for the level of the śrāvakas, etc.”

original: nyan thos dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar kho bo'i bdag gi bsam pa sred pa zad pa'i phyir dang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyan thos dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar kho bo'i bdag gi bsam pa sred pa zad pa'i phyir dang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: I have no desire for the level of the śrāvaka arhat and the pratyekabuddha, because my intention is to end craving and to be nonexistent.

original: nyan thos kyi sa la 'dod pa med pa'i rnam grangs tshul 'dis na kho bo zag pa zad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa la 'dod pa med pa'i rnam grangs tshul 'dis na kho bo zag pa zad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: By this method, I have no desire for the level of the śrāvakas. I have indeed exhausted the defilements.

original: dgra bcom pa ni ji ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni ji ltar yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nges par bzung ba'i don te /
translated: But I am not an arhat. The word “but” has the meaning of exclusion.

original: ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “not at all.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: gang zhig nyan thos kyi theg pa 'dod pa de la ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig nyan thos kyi theg pa 'dod pa de la ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: Whoever desires the vehicle of the śrāvakas has the view of self, etc.

original: de lta ma yin na bdag zhi bar bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bdag zhi bar bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, they would not apply themselves to pacifying the self and to complete nirvāṇa.

original: mi sbyor ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: mi sbyor ba kho na yin no //
translated: “But I am not an arhat.”

original: mngon par bzhed pa'i shes rab bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par bzhed pa'i shes rab bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the wisdom that is truly desired,

original: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub kyi snying por 'dug la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang byang chub kyi snying por 'dug la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Mañjuśrī, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva were to sit at the site of awakening,” and so forth.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gis so //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni gang gis so //
translated: “If” means “by whom.”

original: byang chub kyi snying po ni mtshan nyid bstan zin to //🔽'dug la gnas te bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po ni mtshan nyid bstan zin to // 'dug la gnas te bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i skal ba med par 'gyur ba /
translated: The site of awakening has already been explained in terms of its characteristics.🔽“Were to sit” means “were to abide there.”

original: snod du mi 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs yod dam zhes dris so ;
analyzed: snod du mi 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs yod dam zhes dris so ;
translated: “Could it be that there is a category of those who are not fit vessels for attaining unsurpassed awakening?”

original: / rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Category” means

original: bshad pa'i rim pa la bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rim pa la bya ba yin gyi /
translated: a sequence of explanations.

original: dngos su ni dus thams cad du de bzhin du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir rnam grangs med pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos su ni dus thams cad du de bzhin du gnas pa yin pa'i phyir rnam grangs med pa yin no //
translated: But in reality, since it always abides in that way, there is no category.

original: lan du 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: lan du 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
translated: In response, Mañjuśrī said,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Blessed One,” and so forth.

original: skal pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba'i rnam @45b grangs mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsol to //
analyzed: skal pa ma mchis par 'gyur ba'i rnam @45b grangs mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du gsol to //
translated: There are synonyms for unfortunate.

original: de gtan tshigs ci yod ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de gtan tshigs ci yod ce na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub la cung zad tsam gyi chos kyang ma mchis shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub la cung zad tsam gyi chos kyang ma mchis shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, In that way, there is not even a small dharma in enlightenment.

original: 'di ltar byang chub la cung zad tsam gyi chos kyang ma mchis so zhes lan grangs du mar bshad do ;
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub la cung zad tsam gyi chos kyang ma mchis so zhes lan grangs du mar bshad do ;
translated: In that way, it is explained many times, There is not even a small dharma in enlightenment.

original: /'di las gong na lhag pa med pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: /'di las gong na lhag pa med pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
translated: Since there is nothing higher than this, it is unsurpassed.

original: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Correct is unmistaken.

original: rdzogs pa ni tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: Complete is indivisible,

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid gcig pa yin no //
translated: since all dharmas are of one characteristic.

original: byang chub ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: byang chub ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: Enlightenment is the wisdom of equality.

original: de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: de ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: That is perfect complete enlightenment.

original: skyes pa'i chos gang yang med du zin kyang /
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos gang yang med du zin kyang /
translated: Even though there is not any dharma that arises,

original: 'on kyang byang chub de ni skyes te yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub de ni skyes te yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: nevertheless, that enlightenment arises and exists.

original: de'i phyir byang chub de yang ma skyes pa ste zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub de yang ma skyes pa ste zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, that enlightenment is also non-arisen.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi don gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of the etymological definition,

original: de la gang byang chub kyi snying po la mchis pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang byang chub kyi snying po la mchis pa 'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: he says, “Therein, one who is seated at the site of enlightenment…” and so on.

original: gang dang gang gis dang / byang chub gang la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis dang / byang chub gang la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: “By whom, by what, and in what enlightenment will one fully awaken?”

original: byed pa po byang chub sems dpa' dang / byed pa lam dang / las byang chub rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa po byang chub sems dpa' dang / byed pa lam dang / las byang chub rnams la bya ste /
translated: This refers, respectively, to the agent, the bodhisattva; the action, the path; and the object, enlightenment.

original: de dag gang yang ma mchis shing zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gang yang ma mchis shing zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “None of these exists” means that they are non-arisen.

original: mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ta /
analyzed: mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ta /
translated: “They are not apprehended” means that they are not real, like dreams and so on.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po med par bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dngos po med par bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The non-arisen is taught to be non-existent,

original: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: but not because of momentariness.

original: 'di ltar de ni gzugs brnyan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gzugs brnyan yin te /
translated: Thus, it is a reflection.

original: 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: 'gog par byed do //
translated: It is cessation.🔽The intrinsic reality of enlightenment was asked about in order to demonstrate that the qualities of ordinary people, etc. are the same as enlightenment.

original: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos bstan zin pa'i rnams byang chub dang mnyam par bstan pa'i ched du byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das byang chub ces bgyi ba de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po dag gi tshig bla dgas so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos bstan zin pa'i rnams byang chub dang mnyam par bstan pa'i ched du byang chub kyi rang gi ngo bo dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das byang chub ces bgyi ba de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po dag gi tshig bla dgas so zhes gsol to //
translated: “Bhagavat, enlightenment is a synonym for the five inexpiable acts.”

original: byang chub bshad ma zin nam de la gzhan ci zhig bshad du yod ce na /
analyzed: byang chub bshad ma zin nam de la gzhan ci zhig bshad du yod ce na /
translated: “But enlightenment has already been explained. What else is there to explain about it?”

original: de bden te 'on kyang byang chub ma bstan par so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos rnams de'i rang bzhin yin par bstan par mi nus pas yang de bstan pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bden te 'on kyang byang chub ma bstan par so so'i skye bo la sogs pa'i chos rnams de'i rang bzhin yin par bstan par mi nus pas yang de bstan pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: That is true, but it is not possible to explain the qualities of ordinary people, etc. without explaining enlightenment. Therefore, there is no fault in explaining it again.

original: ci'i phyir de'i tshig bla dgas yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de'i tshig bla dgas yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it a synonym for the five inexpiable acts?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po de dag nyid dngos po ma @46a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar mtshams ma mchis pa lnga po de dag nyid dngos po ma @46a * //
translated: “Bhagavat, it is because the five inexpiable acts themselves are

original: mchis pas byang chub kyi rang bzhin can te zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mchis pas byang chub kyi rang bzhin can te zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it has the nature of enlightenment.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: Thus means for what reason.

original: byang chub kyi rang bzhin de dag gi ngo bo nyid yin pas byang chub kyi rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rang bzhin de dag gi ngo bo nyid yin pas byang chub kyi rang bzhin can no //
translated: Since that nature of enlightenment is their very essence, it has the nature of enlightenment.

original: rang bzhin de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that nature?

original: dngos po ma mchis pa nyid pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa nyid pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be non-entityness.

original: dngos po ni 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: Entity refers to the elements.

original: de lta bu ma yin pas dngos po ma mchis ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin pas dngos po ma mchis ba ste /
translated: Since it is not like that, it is non-entityness.

original: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma skyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for non-arisen.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid do //
translated: Its essence is just that.

original: de bas na mi gsod pa la sogs pa de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ni dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi gsod pa la sogs pa de dag gi rang gi ngo bo ni dngos po med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the essence of those such as not killing is just non-entityness, they are only non-arisen.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa de'i slad du byang chub de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga'i rang bzhin can lags so //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du gyur pa de'i slad du byang chub de ni mtshams ma mchis pa lnga'i rang bzhin can lags so //
translated: Since all phenomena have become the nature of non-entityness, that enlightenment has the nature of the five inexpiable acts.

original: des na mtshams ma mchis pa rnams dngos po med pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa mtshan nyid bstan zin pa ni byang chub lags so //
analyzed: des na mtshams ma mchis pa rnams dngos po med pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa mtshan nyid bstan zin pa ni byang chub lags so //
translated: Therefore, the realization of the immeasurables as non-entities is the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: mtshams med pa rnams ni mtshon bar zad kyi /
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams ni mtshon bar zad kyi /
translated: The immeasurables are exhausted by the weapons,

original: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yang byang chub yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yang byang chub yin te /
translated: but the realization of all phenomena is also enlightenment,

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: because of the same nature.

original: glegs bam kha cig las mtshams ma mchis pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa byang chub ma lags so zhes byung bde'i don yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig las mtshams ma mchis pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa byang chub ma lags so zhes byung bde'i don yang 'di lta ste /
translated: In some texts, it is stated that the realization of the immeasurables is not enlightenment. The meaning of that is as follows:

original: dngos po med pa ni mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni mngon par rdzogs par rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because non-entities cannot be realized,

original: mtshams med pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de byang chub yin la /
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de byang chub yin la /
translated: the realization of the immeasurables is not enlightenment.

original: mtshams med pa rnams ma mthong ba'i mtshams yin te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa rnams ma mthong ba'i mtshams yin te /
translated: The immeasurables are the limit of non-seeing,🔽but the realization of the immeasurables is the limit of seeing.

original: chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par ni chos rnams ma mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes lan mang du bstan to //
analyzed: chos thams cad mthong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin par ni chos rnams ma mthong ba nyid de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes lan mang du bstan to //
translated: The characteristic of not seeing any phenomenon is the non-seeing of phenomena, and that is the seeing of reality.

original: 'dod pa bstan zin nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa bstan zin nas /
translated: Having taught the desirable,

original: mi 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to refute the undesirable,

original: chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa yang byang chub ma lags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon du gyur pa yang byang chub ma lags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The manifestation of all phenomena is not enlightenment.”

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa rnams mngon sum du bya bar sbyor ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa rnams mngon sum du bya bar sbyor ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa ste /
translated: The application to manifest that which is not manifest is manifestation.

original: de'i rnam pa mngon sum du byed pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad mngon sum du byed pa de ni byang chub ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa mngon sum du byed pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad mngon sum du byed pa de ni byang chub ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The manifestation of all phenomena in the manner of manifesting their aspects is not enlightenment.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon sum du byed pa med cing /
