analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon sum du byed pa med cing /
translated: Thus, the non-manifestation of the aspects of all phenomena,

original: mngon sum @46b du mi byed pa byang chub yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum @46b du mi byed pa byang chub yin no //
translated: and the non-manifestation of non-manifestation, is enlightenment.

original: yang gtan tshigs gang gis yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs gang gis yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what reason is it so? Therefore, it is said:

original: chos thams cad ni shin tu mngon sum ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'di ltar shin tu mngon sum ma lags pa'i chos de dag ni sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni shin tu mngon sum ma lags te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di ltar shin tu mngon sum ma lags pa'i chos de dag ni sangs rgyas sam /
translated: All phenomena are not directly perceived.

original: gzhan gang gis kyang mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan zin pa dang / ston par gyur pa lta bur mngon par rdzogs par rtogs so //
analyzed: gzhan gang gis kyang mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan zin pa dang / ston par gyur pa lta bur mngon par rdzogs par rtogs so //
translated: In this way, those phenomena that are not directly perceived are fully understood by the Buddha or by anyone else, as if the characteristic of full understanding were taught or had become manifest.

original: ma mthong ba ni lta bas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni lta bas so //
translated: The unseen is seen through seeing.

original: ma thos pa ni nyan pas so //
analyzed: ma thos pa ni nyan pas so //
translated: The unheard is heard through hearing.

original: ma 'tshal ba ni shes pas so //
analyzed: ma 'tshal ba ni shes pas so //
translated: The unknown is known through knowing.

original: yang na mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la ltos nas so //
analyzed: yang na mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam la ltos nas so //
translated: Alternatively, this is in reference to the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: bar gyi sgras dran pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar gyi sgras dran pa gzung ngo //
translated: The intervening word “is” is to be supplied.

original: ma rtogs pa ni kun gyis so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa ni kun gyis so //
translated: The unrealized is realized through realization.

original: de lta bu'i shes pa gang yin pa sgro 'dogs dang skur 'debs kyi mtha' thams cad dang bral ba de lta bu de ni byang chub po //
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes pa gang yin pa sgro 'dogs dang skur 'debs kyi mtha' thams cad dang bral ba de lta bu de ni byang chub po //
translated: Such knowledge, which is free from all extremes of superimposition and denial, is awakening.

original: 'thad pa gzhan yang de lta lags kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'thad pa gzhan yang de lta lags kyis kyang /
translated: Another argument in favor of this is as follows.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān has said, etc.

original: lhag par zhen pa 'am lhag pa'i nga rgyal ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa 'am lhag pa'i nga rgyal ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Excessive attachment or excessive pride is manifest pride.

original: de spyod pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can te /
analyzed: de spyod pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can te /
translated: Those who practice that are the manifestly proud ones.

original: log pa'i sgro 'dogs shing spyod pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i sgro 'dogs shing spyod pa'o //
translated: They practice with false superimposition.

original: de dag gi rnam par rtog pas gzhan na ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mngon sum du byas shing /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par rtog pas gzhan na ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams mngon sum du byas shing /
translated: By their conceptualization, they superimpose the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, and they are posited as having directly realized

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin par gzhag go /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin par gzhag go /
translated: and fully awakened to them.

original: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras mthong ba dang / shes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba'i sgras mthong ba dang / shes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “also” includes seeing, knowing, etc.

original: de dag gi rnam pa de dang de'i rang gi ngo bo stong yang rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma shes pa de dag ni stong pa nyid ma rtogs te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa de dang de'i rang gi ngo bo stong yang rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i rang gi ngo bo ma shes pa de dag ni stong pa nyid ma rtogs te /
translated: Although the nature of those aspects is empty, those who do not understand the nature that appears to consciousness do not realize emptiness.

original: rnam pa de dag phyi rol na yod pa nyid du yang dag par mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag phyi rol na yod pa nyid du yang dag par mngon par zhen te /
translated: They are attached to the existence of those aspects externally.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pas de dang de la rtogs par byed pa yin gyi de dag yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pas de dang de la rtogs par byed pa yin gyi de dag yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is due to grasping at signs that one conceptualizes this and that, but they are not real.

original: dgongs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dgongs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the intention is finished.

original: da ni 'thob pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'thob pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the attainment should be explained.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams dang 'phags pa'i chos rnams de ltar byang chub kyi rang bzhin nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams dang 'phags pa'i chos rnams de ltar byang chub kyi rang bzhin nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught that ordinary beings and the qualities of the noble ones are of the nature of enlightenment,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the qualities of perfect buddhahood,

original: 'jam dpal ci khyod nga la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ci khyod nga la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Buddha] says, Mañjuśrī, do you think that I... and so on.

original: nga la zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //🔽'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba /
analyzed: nga la zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o // 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba /
translated: I refers to oneself.🔽Think like this means the thought and expression that arises,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo sems pa dang tha snyad du byed @47a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo sems pa dang tha snyad du byed @47a * //
translated: The Tathāgata is my Tathāgata.

original: pa 'byung ngam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: pa 'byung ngam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Do you think like this?

original: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dang / de'i phrin las ston pa po nyid la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid dang / de'i phrin las ston pa po nyid la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is intended to show the perfect Buddha himself and his activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bgrod par bya ba de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bgrod par bya ba de bzhin gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is the one who goes thus, the Tathāgata, because he goes just as he has come.

original: bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni bdag la de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log par ston pas de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni bdag la de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir dang / phyin ci ma log par ston pas de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is the one who teaches thus, because he teaches just as he has been told, and because he teaches without error.

original: ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He is the one who teaches.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra gnyis 'byung ba la snga ma ni ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra gnyis 'byung ba la snga ma ni ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the word Tathāgata occurs twice. The first is understood as “just as he has come.”

original: gcig ni rjes su ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni rjes su ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The second is “he teaches just as he has been told.”

original: ston pa po la ltos nas bdag gis zhes drug pa yin no //
analyzed: ston pa po la ltos nas bdag gis zhes drug pa yin no //
translated: The genitive case in “his Tathāgata” is based on the teacher.

original: de skad dris pa dang bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsol te /
analyzed: de skad dris pa dang bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsol te /
translated: When asked this, Subhūti replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag gi lags so zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang tha snyad ma mchis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bdag gi lags so zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang tha snyad ma mchis te /
translated: There is no conceptualization or designation of the Tathagata as 'mine'.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that there is no logical proof.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs med par gsungs te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes dris pa dang / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs med par gsungs te /
translated: The Lord has said that the reason is that the Tathagata is thus.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs kyis brtags na ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yod pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste ;
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs kyis brtags na ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa yod pa ma yin par blta bar bya ste ;
translated: Thus, when examined by logical reasoning, it should be seen that the knowledge having the aspect as taught does not exist.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang tha snyad kyang med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang tha snyad kyang med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Since that is a prerequisite, conceptualization and designation should be understood as non-existent.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar khyod shes pa med par gyur zhe na 'dir gsod par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar khyod shes pa med par gyur zhe na 'dir gsod par byed pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Why is it so? Here, the Lord has said that the reason is that the Tathagata is thus.

original: de bzhin nyid yul du gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par rig par mi bgyid pa ni de bzhin nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la khong du chud par mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yul du gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par rig par mi bgyid pa ni de bzhin nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa la khong du chud par mi byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Tathāgata, who is the object of suchness, does not cognize suchness by means of suchness. This means that suchness does not comprehend the Tathāgata by means of its own nature.

original: 'dis ni rtog pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bsal te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas kyang skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la ;
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bsal te / de bzhin gshegs pas kyang skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la ;
translated: This eliminates the Tathāgata as an imagined object.

original: de bzhin nyid rnam par rig par mi bgyid khong du chud par mi bgyid de mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam par rig par mi bgyid khong du chud par mi bgyid de mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathāgata does not cognize or comprehend suchness for those who are fortunate, because that is not possible.

original: 'dis ni rjes su ston pa nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bsal to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su ston pa nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa bsal to //
translated: This eliminates the Tathāgata as an object of instruction.

original: de ci'i phyir rig par mi byed ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rig par mi byed ce na de'i phyir /
translated: Why does he not cognize it? To explain this, he says,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar don dam par na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @47b te ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar don dam par na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @47b te ;
translated: “Bhagavān, it is because ultimately…” and so on.

original: yang dag par de bzhin nyid kyang med /
analyzed: yang dag par de bzhin nyid kyang med /
translated: There is no suchness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang med na de ji ltar rnam par rig par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang med na de ji ltar rnam par rig par byed pa yin /
translated: If the Tathāgata does not exist, how can he be an object of cognition?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, therefore…” and so on is the conclusion.

original: 'dir gtan tshigs kyi snod du de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bgyi ba de ming tsam du bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs kyi snod du de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bgyi ba de ming tsam du bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, in order to make a vessel for the reason, it is said “the so-called Tathāgata is merely a name…” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ming tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ming tsam du zad de /
translated: The so-called Tathāgata is merely a name.

original: de ni dngos po stong pa yin na /
analyzed: de ni dngos po stong pa yin na /
translated: That is empty of entity.

original: shes pa dang tha snyad kyi yul dag la bdag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snyam du shes pa dang / tha snyad 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang tha snyad kyi yul dag la bdag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa ni bdag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snyam du shes pa dang / tha snyad 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: “If that is so, how can there be the arising of the cognition and conventions ‘I know the Tathāgata’ and ‘The Tathāgata exists for me’?” This is the conclusion.

original: de nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gtan la dbab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to ascertain that,

original: 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la the tshom za 'am zhes zur gyis dris so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la the tshom za 'am zhes zur gyis dris so //
translated: he indirectly asked, “Mañjuśrī, do you doubt the Tathāgata?”

original: the tshom spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: the tshom spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes gsol to //
translated: In order to eliminate doubt, he said, “No, Bhagavan.”🔽The Bhagavan said, “Subhuti, if a Tathagata arises or does not arise,🔽the dharmas of the Tathagata remain.”🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage,🔽which are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba 'am zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo nyid spangs nas 'phags pa'i sar zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba 'am zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo nyid spangs nas 'phags pa'i sar zhugs te /
translated: The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skyes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skyes pa ste /
translated: The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.

original: dper na so so'i skye bo'i ris mthun pa'i skye bo'i lus snga ma bor nas ma'i mngal du zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid skyes pa dang de nas rim gyis yan lag dang / nyid lag tshang bar yongs su grub pa bzhin du gyur pa 'am lhag ma med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa 'am /
analyzed: dper na so so'i skye bo'i ris mthun pa'i skye bo'i lus snga ma bor nas ma'i mngal du zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid skyes pa dang de nas rim gyis yan lag dang / nyid lag tshang bar yongs su grub pa bzhin du gyur pa 'am lhag ma med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa 'am /
translated: The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs par yongs su grub pa ste /🔽dgongs pa yongs su grub pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs par yongs su grub pa ste /🔽dgongs pa yongs su grub pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.🔽The dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage are the dharmas of the Tathagata’s lineage of the Tathagata’s lineage.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni de la bdag the tshom 'tshal lo //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' zhig mchis na ni de la bdag the tshom 'tshal lo //
translated: If there were any Tathagatas who had attained the perfect Dharmakaya, which is characterized by utter purity, I would have doubts about them.

original: de sum char yang ma mchis pas de bas na bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la the tshom ma mchis te /
analyzed: de sum char yang ma mchis pas de bas na bdag de bzhin gshegs pa la the tshom ma mchis te /
translated: But since none of these three exist, I have no doubts about the Tathagatas.

original: mngon sum du nges par gyur ba kho na lags so //
analyzed: mngon sum du nges par gyur ba kho na lags so //
translated: I am certain of it.

original: gal te de lta bu yin na 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa byung ngo snyam du mi sems sam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las byung ngo snyam pa'i blo med dam /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu yin na 'jam dpal khyod de bzhin gshegs pa byung ngo snyam du mi sems sam bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs las byung ngo snyam pa'i blo med dam /
translated: If that is so, O Manjusri, do you not think that the Tathagata has appeared, or that he has arisen from the accumulation of merit and wisdom?

original: 'dir lan du bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings la byung ba ma mchis na ni zhes gsol te /🔽de dang tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yang byung ngo snyam du sems @48a * //
analyzed: 'dir lan du bcom ldan 'das gal te chos kyi dbyings la byung ba ma mchis na ni zhes gsol te / de dang tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yang byung ngo snyam du sems @48a * //
translated: In reply to this, he says, O Lord, if the Dharmadhatu has not appeared, then the Tathagata, who is not different from it, has not appeared either.

original: par 'gyur na /
analyzed: par 'gyur na /
translated: If I thought that the Tathagata had appeared,

original: gang gi tshe chos thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi dbyings ma byung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi dbyings ma byung ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the dharmadhātu, which pervades all phenomena, does not arise,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba ga la mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba ga la mchis /
translated: how could the Tathāgata arise?

original: 'o na de ltar 'byung ba ma mthong na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar 'byung ba ma mthong na /
translated: If one does not see arising in that way,

original: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi mos sam /
analyzed: 'jam dpal khyod sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi mos sam /
translated: Mañjuśrī, do you not believe that the Buddha Bhagavats as numerous as the sands of the Ganges have passed into parinirvāṇa?

original: yid mi ches sam zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yid mi ches sam zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa brjod par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa brjod par bzhed nas /
translated: Wishing to speak of the inconceivable,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du yul gcig pa ma lags sam zhes dris so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du yul gcig pa ma lags sam zhes dris so //
translated: he asked, Are the Buddha Bhagavats not of the same inconceivable realm in this way?

original: yul gcig pa zhes bya ba la yul ni spyod yul lo //
analyzed: yul gcig pa zhes bya ba la yul ni spyod yul lo //
translated: Of the same realm means of the same domain.

original: gcig pa ni dbyer med pa ste /
analyzed: gcig pa ni dbyer med pa ste /
translated: Same means inseparable.

original: shin tu mchog tu phul du byung ba'i blo can /
analyzed: shin tu mchog tu phul du byung ba'i blo can /
translated: Those with the most excellent, supreme intellect,

original: sangs rgyas de dag gi yul de ni gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de dag gi yul de ni gcig pa yin no //
translated: the realm of those Buddhas is the same.

original: 'dis ni thugs su chud pa sna tshogs pa nyid sel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thugs su chud pa sna tshogs pa nyid sel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This eliminates the variety of understandings.

original: yul de la gzhan dang gzhan rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa yod na ni mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: yul de la gzhan dang gzhan rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa yod na ni mi shes pa yin te /
translated: If there were other objects, other than that, that were understood or not understood, then there would be ignorance.

original: sngar bstan pa lta bu sangs rgyas ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa lta bu sangs rgyas ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: As previously explained, he would not be a Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni grags pa dang ldan pa rab tu grags pa yin te /🔽ji skad du sa'i steng gi lha rnams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni grags pa dang ldan pa rab tu grags pa yin te / ji skad du sa'i steng gi lha rnams nas bzung ste /
translated: The Lord is renowned and well known.

original: 'og min gyi lha'i bar du kye ma'o 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no zhes sgra sgrogs shing sgras go bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha'i bar du kye ma'o 'di ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no zhes sgra sgrogs shing sgras go bar byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: As it is said, “The gods of the earth up to the Akaniṣṭha gods proclaim, ‘Oh, this is a perfect Buddha,’ and they make it known through their cries.”

original: de bas na gdon mi za bar yul de kho na nyid dam pa gcig yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gdon mi za bar yul de kho na nyid dam pa gcig yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, without a doubt, that object is the one and only truth.

original: yul de kho na nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yul de kho na nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: If that object were not the truth,

original: du ma yod na ni 'gron po'i mi bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i grags pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ma yod na ni 'gron po'i mi bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i grags pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and there were many objects, then, like a traveler, he would not have the renown that is desired.

original: de kho na nyid dam pa de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa las gzhan ma yin pas 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du zhes gsungs te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dam pa de yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa las gzhan ma yin pas 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du zhes gsungs te / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos rnams la mngon par ma zhen pa ni don yod pa'o //
translated: Non-attachment to things is the meaning.

original: gang zhig don la rlom sems byed pa de ni 'di'i don med pa chen po yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zhig don la rlom sems byed pa de ni 'di'i don med pa chen po yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if one imagines that there is a meaning, that is a great lack of meaning.

original: de'i dgongs pa 'di lta ste //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa 'di lta ste //
translated: The intended meaning is this:

original: sangs rgyas yul ni bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yul ni bsam mi khyab //
translated: The domain of the Buddha is inconceivable.

original: de mchog rtag pa de kho na //
analyzed: de mchog rtag pa de kho na //
translated: That is the highest, the permanent, the reality.

original: zad dang skye dang ring thung sogs //
analyzed: zad dang skye dang ring thung sogs //
translated: Extinction, arising, long, short, and so on,

original: de ltar rtog pa log pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa log pa yin //
translated: Such conceptualization is perverted.

original: brdzun pa dag la mthu med phyir //
analyzed: brdzun pa dag la mthu med phyir //
translated: Since the unreal has no power,

original: 'ga' yang yang dag sel mi byed //
analyzed: 'ga' yang yang dag sel mi byed //
translated: No one can eliminate it.

original: smig rgyu'i chu yi tshogs rnams ni //
analyzed: smig rgyu'i chu yi tshogs rnams ni //
translated: The collection of waters of a mirage

original: dpyid dus tsha bas sel mi byed //
analyzed: dpyid dus tsha bas sel mi byed //
translated: Cannot be eliminated by the heat of summer.

original: ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like that.

original: 'jam dpal de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgongs pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgongs pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is so, and so on, is in accord with the intention.

original: ci ni bcom ldan 'das de ltar bzhugs sam zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul can de ltar bzhugs sam zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci ni bcom ldan 'das de ltar bzhugs sam zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul can de ltar bzhugs sam zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: What is the Bhagavān like in that way? is asking, Is the Bhagavān like that, having an inconceivable object?

original: 'jam dpal de de bzhin no zhes 'dir yang zhal gyis bzhes so //
analyzed: 'jam dpal de de bzhin no zhes 'dir yang zhal gyis bzhes so //
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is just so!

original: 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis gsol ba /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul nyi tshe ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul nyi tshe ba ma yin pa /
translated: Bhagavān, for that reason, etc.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa de dag bzhugs pa de'i slad du /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bzhed pa de dag bzhugs pa de'i slad du /
translated: The Tathāgatas, who are the Buddhas, the Bhagavats, who have the wisdom of the nature of non-error, who are not limited to the inconceivable object, who are about to pass into nirvāṇa, for that reason,

original: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das te /
translated: they do not pass into nirvāṇa.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa de dag la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes kyis mya ngan las 'das pa de dag la mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of the wisdom that has the characteristics as taught, they do not observe nirvāṇa.

original: dmigs na ni yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs na ni yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did observe it, the inconceivable object would be impaired.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though it is inconceivable,

original: ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Why do you not pass into parinirvāṇa?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du yul gcig pa'i slad du ste zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'di ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul du yul gcig pa'i slad du ste zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: The buddhas, the bhagavats, are like this: they are one realm, because of the inconceivable object.

original: de gnyis 'gal bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: de gnyis 'gal bar ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that those two are contradictory.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de nyid ni skye ba ma lags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de nyid ni skye ba ma lags zhes bya ba la /
translated: That very inconceivability is not birth.

original: de nyid zhes bya ba ni @49a * //
analyzed: de nyid zhes bya ba ni @49a * //
translated: That very means

original: nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: it is ascertained.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni skye ba ma lags 'gag pa ma lags so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni skye ba ma lags 'gag pa ma lags so //
translated: Inconceivability itself is not birth and not cessation.

original: gal te 'di skad du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ye shes gcig pa yin na /
translated: If the one wisdom that has the characteristic of being taught in this way exists,

original: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa de lta bu thams cad mi srid par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo la sogs pa de lta bu thams cad mi srid par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then all such things as ordinary beings would be impossible.

original: de bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said that it is just so.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān himself has said, “If I were to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening…”

original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: Those who in the future🔽will become Tathāgatas, Arhats,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom par 'gyur ba de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom par 'gyur ba de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: will have already fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: phyis 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur re //
analyzed: phyis 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur re //
translated: They will not awaken later.

original: gtan tshigs su bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'das pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs su bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'das pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The reason is stated in “The inconceivable is neither past…” and so on.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the past and so on does not exist.

original: ring ba dang nye ba dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa la sogs par dbye ba rnams ni log par rnam par rtog pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: ring ba dang nye ba dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom pa la sogs par dbye ba rnams ni log par rnam par rtog pas byas pa'o //
translated: The distinctions of far and near, coarse and subtle, ordinary being and noble being, bad and good, and so on are made by false imagination.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bas na su dag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so zhes bgyi ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bas na su dag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes so zhes bgyi ba nas /
translated: Bhagavān, whoever thinks, ‘The Tathāgata arose…’

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du sems pa de dag gi 'jig rten gnas pa ni 'khrul par bgyid pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'khrul par byed pas 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar du sems pa de dag gi 'jig rten gnas pa ni 'khrul par bgyid pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'khrul par byed pas 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The world of those who think in this way, up to the thought of complete nirvana, is deluded.🔽It is deluded because it is deluded.

original: kun tu rmongs par byed pa'o //🔽'jig rten gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / snod rnams gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs par byed pa'o // 'jig rten gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sems can dang / snod rnams gnas pa'o //
translated: It is confused.🔽The world of those who think in this way, up to the thought of complete nirvana, is deluded.🔽The world is the aggregates of form, etc.

original: yang na 'jig rten ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / de dag gnas pa ni zhen pa'i sems la yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / de dag gnas pa ni zhen pa'i sems la yod pa'o //
translated: Its abiding is in the mind that clings to them.

original: de ni de dag la 'khrul par byed 'khrul pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de ni de dag la 'khrul par byed 'khrul pa skyed par byed do //
translated: That is deluded, it produces delusion.

original: bcom ldan 'das de dag 'jig rten gnas pa 'phros par bgyid pa lags so zhes bgyi ba la /🔽de dag gis 'khrul par byas pa ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dag 'jig rten gnas pa 'phros par bgyid pa lags so zhes bgyi ba la / de dag gis 'khrul par byas pa ;
translated: Blessed One, they spread out the world's abiding.🔽They spread out the delusion of those who are deluded.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten gnas pa 'khrul par byed pa rnams 'phros par bgyid bye brag de dang de dag gis rgyas par bgyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten gnas pa 'khrul par byed pa rnams 'phros par bgyid bye brag de dang de dag gis rgyas par bgyis pa'o //
translated: They spread out the delusion of those who are deluded by those particular things.

original: de gang zhe na su dag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa dang / sems can la gzigs pa dang / 'dren pa dang / smin bar mdzad zin to //
analyzed: de gang zhe na su dag 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes pa dang / sems can la gzigs pa dang / 'dren pa dang / smin bar mdzad zin to //
translated: has looked upon sentient beings, has led, has ripened,🔽will lead, will ripen, has led and ripened, will lead and ripen,🔽has been born, will be born, has been and will be seen, has been and will be led, has been and will be ripened,

original: @49b mdzad do mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas de nas 'di mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya ba'i bar du kun tu rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: @49b mdzad do mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas de nas 'di mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya ba'i bar du kun tu rtog pa yin no //
translated: has been and will be extinguished,🔽have a conception of the Tathagata.

original: 'jam dpal de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam du med pa bsam pa las 'das pa bsam gyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shin tu zab pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul de la sgro 'dogs pa
analyzed: 'jam dpal de'i phyir khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsam du med pa bsam pa las 'das pa bsam gyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shin tu zab pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul de la sgro 'dogs pa
translated: Therefore, Mañjuśrī, the inconceivable, unthinkable, super-thought, unfathomable, etc. of the Tathagata,

original: dang skur pa 'debs pa 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: dang skur pa 'debs pa 'gog par byed do //
translated: in that extremely profound inconceivable way, refutes superimposition and denial.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa de yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa de yin te /
translated: The inconceivable of the Tathagata is the inconceivable of the Tathagata just explained.

original: de ni 'dir bye brag can gyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir bye brag can gyi tshig yin no //
translated: That is the specific word here.

original: lhag ma gsum ni 'di'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni 'di'i bye brag yin no //
translated: The other three are its particular cases.

original: bsam du med pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa ni bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam du med pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa ni bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is called “inconceivable” because it cannot be conceived.

original: de yang ci'i phyir mi nus she na /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir mi nus she na /
translated: And why is it not conceivable?

original: bsam pa las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa yin te /
translated: It is beyond conception.

original: bsam par bya ba'i chos 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //🔽nges tshig ni bsam pa las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i chos 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro // nges tshig ni bsam pa las 'das pa'am /
translated: There is no dharma at all that can be conceived.🔽The verbal derivation is that it is beyond conception.

original: bsam pa 'di las 'das pas bsam pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di las 'das pas bsam pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: Or it is beyond this conception, thus it is beyond conception.

original: de bas na de ni bsam pa'i 'os ma yin pas bsam gyis mi lang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ni bsam pa'i 'os ma yin pas bsam gyis mi lang ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not fit to be conceived, thus it is inconceivable.

original: de ltar na sems par byed pa'i ngang tshul can skal ba med pa so so'i skye bo rnams la bstan par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na sems par byed pa'i ngang tshul can skal ba med pa so so'i skye bo rnams la bstan par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is not to be taught to those of no fortune, the ordinary persons who are inclined to think.

original: sems pa'i dra ba spangs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan snga dang / phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa yang dag pa dang ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo yang gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems pa'i dra ba spangs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan snga dang / phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mos pa yang dag pa dang ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo yang gzung bar bya ste /
translated: But it is to be taught to those who have abandoned the net of thought, to those who stand before the Tathagata, and to those who are called “irreversible,” even if they are ordinary persons who possess correct belief.

original: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: nyi khri lnga stong pa la sogs pa las /
translated: In the Twenty-five Thousand, etc.,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa yang /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa yang /
translated: it is taught that the one who is situated in the member of penetration

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: has the characteristic of irreversibility.

original: mgon po byams pas kyang 'di skad du //
analyzed: mgon po byams pas kyang 'di skad du //
translated: The Lord Maitreya also says this:🔽The one who is situated in the heat, summit, patience,

original: drod dang spyi bo bzod pa dang // 'jig rten chos la de gnas pa //
analyzed: drod dang spyi bo bzod pa dang // 'jig rten chos la de gnas pa //
translated: or supreme mundane quality,

analyzed: byang chub las ni phyir mi ldog / ces gsungs so //
